column1: review_id;user_id;business_id;stars;useful;funny;cool;text;date
nh3t9u2tc688KV4JkQwdhQ;hNVDKA4ka8k3hSlicCQDjQ;C9K3579SJgLPp0oAOM29wg;5;3;1;4;"This was one place that I was looking forward to trying in Nashville and was easily my most memorable meal. Yes
column2: try the dry rub ribs I couldn't get enough of it!! The best dry rub ribs I've had. The seasoning and moistness of the ribs were just fantastic. The green beans were surprisingly different from what I'm used to but it was really tasty and good and so were the beans for sides. We also tried the pulled pork nachos and was finger-licking good with all the cheese. Even their sweet tea was delicious.

column1: There's street parking along the road. Go in and get in line (the entire time we were there
column2: the line was out the door but its worth it!) There is a bar area and was able to catch some games on tv while we were there too as we're eating. It is crowded but table turnover is fast.

column1: The pictures don't do it enough justice. Go and try it
column2: you won't be disappointed. If I ever go back to Nashville
column3: I'd definitely eat here again!";14/01/2017 22:02

column1: x-Wr6BY-HIHf2fRp2V5pwg;gZTe6SgFxPDq5hq2fX6iSw;aIVk0IEUj7rPaAMeAmBSGg;5;3;0;1;"Came back for lunch time and there were 3-4 other groups around. I ordered literally the exact same thing as before (pork belly plate with Brussels sprouts and corn bread)
column2: and my husband ordered the pepper jack bacon mac & cheese & the Cuban.

column1: This time the service was 150% better than before! Water was refilled promptly
column2: didn't tale forever to get the check or even talk to him
column3: and food was out quickly!

column1: The food is just as exceptional as before
column2: although Brussels sprouts are a bit on the greasy side
column3: but overall still delicious. Pork belly has that crispy sweet edges
column4: and despite being a fatty cut
column5: actually had a great ratio of meat to it! Portion size was also great for $12.

column1: I know we didn't eat during the dinner rush so I can't truly say if the restaurant addressed my claims from before
column2: but it looks like they at least tried and I'm quite happy!";07/12/2018 22:40

column1: GgIH0ueMvNJj2bU4tPROOA;MMoQ22Aow5trC8GQROtNAw;_jRB9wKomaO1W3tfA1sX_Q;2;4;0;0;"I was excited to see a new Starr restaurant in the form of burritos open up in Philly. A year of pandemic has left me looking for a little change in take-out options. My partner and I ordered the salsa trio with chips
column2: Baja shrimp burrito
column3: and K-Town burrito. The packaging was very cute
column4: but the food was unfortunately a flop.

column1: Starting with the salsa trio ($6). Highly disappointing. The salsa verde was ok
column2: just a little spicy but not much flavor. The pico de gallo was almost frozen solid
column3: so that was a huge let down.. and then the salsa roja smelled and tasted extremely off. I couldn't put my finger on what I was tasting but it smelled like burning rubber. The chips were excellent though.. too bad there wasn't much use for them.

column1: I thought the K-Town burrito ($14) was ok. It had Korean beef
column2: kimchi
column3: rice
column4: refried beans
column5: grilled scallions
column6: lettuce. My partner
column7: who is Korean
column8: was extremely disappointed in the flavor. He disliked it so much he did not want to finish the burrito. We enjoy Korean fusion foods but he felt there was a bad aftertaste from the kimchi. There wasn't much meat in the burrito although it was hefty overall.

column1: The Baja shrimp burrito ($14) was also ok. The fried shrimp was buffalo flavored which was fine
column2: but I was expecting a different profile from the name ""Baja"". Nothing really stood out in the burrito
column3: it was a little boring despite the description.

column1: All in all
column2: a very expensive pair of basic burritos with nice names and packaging. We paid about $45 after tip and delivery. Part of me wants to try their mission style burrito or the frito pie
column3: but this experience left me a little sad. :(";04/03/2021 01:51

column1: drgvVR7NJM5bQMs3dwYv2Q;gZTe6SgFxPDq5hq2fX6iSw;FSvFk1lWR0YBYP_-L_iLTQ;5;1;0;0;"Great little local coffee shop that's awesome for studying or reading or just catching up (when it's not packed with Tulane/Loyola students!). It used to be a bank
column2: so the architecture is awesome and super cool with the tall vaulted ceiling. I love their circling selections of fresh brewed ice tea
column3: or you can pick from a ton of hot teas
column4: and they have several options for coffees of various strengths as well. Baristas are always friendly and the service is pretty quick depensing on the technicality of the order in front of you!

column1: They also have an awesome display of pastries
column2: and they even make some awesome bagel sandwiches! I recommend the chocolate croissant or banana bread! Also
column3: the upstairs is better for super quiet studying
column4: but I prefer sitting outside and watching the hustle and bustle on Oak/Carrollton. Free Wi-Fi
column5: and bathroom is tucked in the back.";19/07/2018 05:31

column1: UKOMhioYDIHhpQ0Io4rW3Q;7GJxBv0lHxwyNHs0jaxhLw;mfNF4bUG19l_78FerZPfSA;5;0;0;0;Let me start by saying I never leave reviews. Maybe it's because I'm old and still assume a business should simply do what they say? I took my custom Harley to Mo Music because of the reviews and a personal reference. I had another dealer tell me it would be over $1k to do what Mo Music did for less than $500! My system sounded better then the day it was installed. What they did may not have been elaborate
column2: but they didn't rip me off! This is SO important to me. I just want to patronize local businesses that do the right thing. Simple right? Nope! So many places want to churn and burn. Mo Music is the real deal! They do what's right and want to create lifetime customers. I for one will always take my business and refer others here!! Thank you Mo Music for being an awesome
column3: reputable business!;28/08/2021 04:15

column1: b6M7n_K-xeLltMBwTD_piQ;4qXTMirb3noPUosWj_Pfvw;yZ-vvz96ekS2-zG_ZsyNLQ;5;1;0;1;If you're in the mood for a fresh

column1: etEL5tf1LDZNoSkt5vOi_Q;5XYe6_nNeICXkDO54S-29A;TnB88L2wYnBL6X9axvzg2Q;3;0;0;0;"Cool looking place

omLksSCXwr-bMYwvt18ywg;t-66V7L-S3Yp9GWB7V81Iw;DHzvDHtS0nmvJCt5qpag2g;3;3;0;0;"I was a customer of Rizzo's and any comparison isn't really fair. Trevi's menu and food quality is a big step above your average pizza / spaghetti place. I have been to Trevi many times and I think they achieve what they are trying to accomplish. Slightly fancier Italian fare with some standard favorites. I only have 1 complaint and unless you go here often
column2: you probably won't notice.. The MUSIC. They have been playing the same Frank Sinatra ""Duets"" albums (the worst records ever released by the arguably greatest pop singer of all time) since they opened
column3: on some kind of torturous loop. They also play the overly cliche' Italian / American novelty songs by Louis Prima and Lou Monte etc. Also on a loop. Be prepared to hear the same songs at least twice every hour you are there. I honestly don't know how the employees can stand hearing the same music looped day in and day out. I would honestly give them an extra star if not for the horrendous
column4: repeated music. Clemenza said ""Leave the gun. Take the cannoli"" I say ""Enjoy the food.  Ignore the music"" If you can...";05/01/2015 01:45

column1: OQr0hxwR3L39ZSkcqyfvYg;8L9oiV_vfDWI2y71EnbbbQ;LHfckMyH7hyS7l401mM4Lg;1;12;2;0;"Extremely concerned customer here.  For starters we originally put a $1000 down payment to reserve our model 3 back in April 2016.  Finally we were allowed to order the model 3 in August 2018 and they required an additional $2500 deposit
column2: something we were not informed of.  We later learned that because we moved states that we would not be able to acquire Tesla financing and would have to go through other lenders which took some hoops but finally we got it done through USAA.  Because we couldn't get the invoice and get the taxes/registration calculation
column3: we just took a loan out for $55
column4: 000 from USAA for the car.  The car ended up being $53
column5: 000 when we took delivery in early November 2018.  Customer service could not give us our difference in payment or refund our deposits.  We were informed it would take up to 6 weeks to get a refund and also we also to get the free supercharging for 6 months.  It's now almost 3 months later and we haven't gotten anything.  We've called Tesla of Devon multiple times who have given us a toll free number in California where there is not an option to get to a live person or the department you need
column6: you wait on hold for hours and end up getting disconnected and our issue is still not resolved.

column1: Finally I had it and asked to speak to the manager after Elliot notated my account.  I was then put in contact with the manager named Brian who has been helpful but is limited in what he can do because apparently all responsibility remains on Tesla HQ in California.  Ridiculous doesn't even begin to describe.  When we spoke he told me that HQ and the case manager (who I still can't get a name
column2: number or email for) only had a record of us putting the $1000 in April 2016 and the overpayment when we picked up the vehicle in November 2018 and that we would only be getting a check for $2700 on January 16th unless WE PROVED THAT WE PAID THEM!!!  I gave them their TESLA  invoice number and was told that we had to get a copy of our credit card statement proving that we were charged the $2500 and that it could even then take further time to resolve us getting paid.  Here's an excerpt of his email:

column1: Hello again Kim
The issue of your $2500 not showing can only be some sort of computer error/glitch
column2: or a matter of the payment never processing. Personally
column3: I think it's an error. I agree that it's frustrating
column4: but right now we can only deal with what facts we have
column5: which is why I'm trying my best to get all the information that we can that proves that you paid the $2500 so that your refund can be processed without delay on the 16th.

column1: Regarding why you were never told about the issue
column2: I wish I could answer that. When we submit refund cases here at Devon
column3: that's usually the end of our involvement as all refunds are processed and paid by California. Now give that refunds usually take 2-3 months
column4: I can only assume that someone from California would have contacted you soon
column5: had you not contacted us first. But of course
column6: after the fact I can't say anything more than my assumption.

column1: Again
column2: I know this is frustrating
column3: and I'm sorry to ask you to gather information like your credit card statement as proof
column4: but right now that's the quickest option to try to ensure that you are refunded in full ASAP. I apologize for any inconvenience
column5: we may never fully know why the payment isn't showing now unless California contacts you to explain when they know
column6: but we can certainly do our best to correct it in the mean time at least.

column1: I know it's not the answer you were hoping for.""

Our credit card company only keeps 4 months of statements and could not fax us a copy so we had to order one and wait for it to come in the mail to send to Brian. We did on January 12th and this was the reply I got.
Hello Kim
I have contacted the case owner who was working on your refund via our company software and uploaded this credit card statement to the case. They should reach out to you directly regarding this
column2: if not
column3: hopefully to me and we can let you know when it is sorted.

column1: -Brian""
What hurts more is our family is one of the 800
column2: 000+ families currently affected by the government shutdown and for us to not get over $5000+ back on a refund and for Tesla to keep some of our monies essentially for years without interest
column3: apology or any type of expedited remediation is just plain wrong.

column1: We even purchased $26
column2: 000 solar from this company and still no genuine assistance except hearing the California HQ blame game.  We remember purchasing a Toyota in California and getting a refund check 3 days later.  On top of this our car registration and taxes were due on January 8th and our refund check still hasn't come yet and we still have absolutely no idea of when it's coming and the company that messed up hasn't said
column3: ""We're sorry"" or ""Let's give you something to make this right.""  How can the #1 car seller not get their act together or put their customers first?  Shame on you Tesla.";15/01/2019 14:23

column1: tSJJoPEBa0FMLb0JY84oZQ;jcURiDqCLY7AOqo8KClJnQ;LJwbztdjO9dx9ZTGQqkQVg;5;1;0;1;"Being in a new city and in a rental.. I was very frustrated during this trip due to getting things ready for my cousin's wedding. So I ended up locking myself out of the rental car. I saw Royal Locksmith on Yelp and realized it's only a mile done from where the rental was located. They arrived in 15mins. Communicating with me the whole time. Took them less than 10 seconds to pop the car open and done.

We were on our way within 30mins. I wish i would've calling them earlier. I wasted 20 mins arguing with Dollar Car Rental trying to get someone to come out. Upset that they will take 60 mins and it's not even guaranteed.
So lucky to have Royal to responded ASAP. And rescue us within 15 mins from freezing.";15/02/2020 21:17

column1: FTXifXxrWIc746xE9pgbBg;PFxsk8gAgCjg_VYqRd3_8w;mEwfB8u-96p2lviZtTafpQ;5;3;0;2;"This would be my go-to breakfast joint if I lived here! I'd already been to the Wild Eggs in Louisville during a recent road trip. Imagine my shock of good fortune to happen upon this location during that very same road trip! A visit thus was a no-brainer.
Interior is bright
column2: modern
column3: and cheery. Service was friendly and attentive. I even got my own carafe of coffee at my table. (Me: Need a warm up on your coffee
column4: honey? Also me: Why yes!) And I'm a self-professed pancake junkie. I'm always on the hunt for a place that adds pancakes (toast is overrated!--lol) to an entree with eggs
column5: bacon
column6: and potatoes. Wild Eggs was there for me. Cakes were malty and fluffy. Everything tasted like grandma had folded together the raw ingredients only five minutes prior.

column1: Prices are higher than your local greasy spoon diner
column2: but this isn't a greasy spoon. There's more overhead here
column3: sure
column4: but the ambience and cheery setting gave exactly the laid back late-morning breakfast I craved. Wild Eggs has a new fan in me! :-D";14/06/2021 14:09

gj9PYEi3TASe2pILckaWIw;5-bqaDnfp0ytZxgCShI_WA;fKFY6nfVdaaAvzceXF2U-w;2;1;0;0;"First and foremost
column2: this place has NO business having the word ""Express"" in their name.

column1: I chose this urgent care because they could do on-site xrays and they accepted online 'reservations'.   When I got there
column2: I was summoned to the desk pretty quickly (a good sign
column3: I thought) though I was a little confused bc I had 'pre-registered' online and didn't think i had to register again.

column1: I was told by the pleasant front desk person that i would be called.   Little did I know 1 hour and 45 mins would go by
column2: before I finally had to say something.   At that point
column3: I mentioned that I had a 11:30 appointment and it was explained to me that it really wasn't a true appointment.  (Then why have this feature?!?).  She checked her schedule and told me that I would be called next.  (I had invested significant time already and had a specific needs so I couldn't just to go any urgent care).

column1: Another 45 mins ticked by (and by the way
column2: others who were there before me had still not been called so I wasn't THAT surprised to not be called next) and I went to the front desk again.  A different front desk person said she would 'see what was going on' and again came out and said I would be called next.   Thankfully this time
column3: I was called within 10 minutes. But when I walked back it didn't seem as if any of the staff was in ANY hurry in caring for the patients.. They were basically seeing one patient per hour almost. There was NO URGENCY whatsoever to get people through.  Granted
column4: they were friendly and APN that i ending up seeing was nice and caring enough.  Ultimately
column5: I accomplished what I wanted (xray and meds) but felt I had to pay the price with 1/2 of my day.  By the time my visit was over
column6: it was 4.5 hours in!!  Completely unnecessary!!";07/01/2019 00:18

column1: Everyone in our party started with a cup of seafood gumbo as their appetizer. And it was a hit! The roux was rich and on point. Each cup had a random sampling of shrimp
column2: crawfish
column3: oysters
column4: and crabmeat. Bravo
column5: five stars for the gumbo!

column1: Three members of our party chose fried seafood plates. Papa ordered the fried oyster plate and said the oysters were delicious. Jenny ordered the fried shrimp and the shrimp were huge. And Henry ordered the fried fish and his plate was stacked high with fried fish. Everyone loved their seafood and the seasoned batter was tasty. The generous portion of hot French fries were a perfect accompaniment.
Linh ordered the traditional oyster po-boy. It was ""dressed"" in New Orleans fashion (lettuce
column2: tomatoes
column3: pickles)
column4: and it didn't disappoint.

column1: Paula ordered the Italian Combo po-boy. She thought it was interesting that the meatballs and sausage were sliced. She said the sandwich was delicious.
I ordered the ham and roast beef sandwich. It was very good
column2: but could have use a little more roast beef gravy. It is a big sandwich. I ordered the half sandwich and could only finish half of it.

column1: As a side note
column2: we had intended to eat at New Orleans Food and Sprits
column3: but the wait for a table of six was going to be 90 minutes. R&O is next door and we were seated immediately. Our experience was just as good as past experiences at F and S. The atmosphere is similar
column4: and they offer plenty of seafood options. But the lagniappe (little extra) is that R&O's offers those traditional Italian dishes.";20/07/2021 12:10

column1: rN6i5IazuGFO4K2t3CyjJA;0Um0BLiP05X48dUgK_Rruw;HpmsY3JJ4gIuS8EiVHwMJw;3;0;0;0;I've been to Agustin's Kitchen 3 times
column2: maybe 4
column3: the most notable being the trip my boyfriend and I took there a month ago. I was really excited to show off this restaurant because he'd never been there and every time I'd eaten there before the pandemic it had been great. We were sat on the patio and we were not even greeted for 20 minutes until I went to find the hostess and ask her to send the server. As the evening progressed I realized other tables getting the same treatment so it's likely the restaurant was very under-staffed. There seemed to be some manager intervention outside assisting with drink orders so they seemed like they were trying to get on top of it
column4: but that night they bit off more than they could chew. I ordered the oysters and they were great and came out relatively quickly
column5: as did the wine once we ordered drinks. I wasn't sure what I wanted to eat so I held off on ordering and my boyfriend ordered the burger which also came out timely and was delicious. When I did order I ordered the tuna tartare and it took so long to come out and when it did the tuna steak came out by mistake so I had to send it back... they quickly reconciled the bill and I believe they even gave me my first glass of wine for free because of the time it took to get greeted. I will be back because I've had other nice experiences here but I hope this restaurant isn't being mismanaged as other recent poor reviews might suggest.;08/08/2021 17:11

8FKKtnmtiRb3_cJIr3U0yQ;TblUttf3s3eMBeW9KTCsNw;30cpm1uq6xcQCmN6JTrB8w;4;7;1;6;"I've had Luke's Lobster on my list of places to try for some time and I had the opportunity this weekend.  I was able to set up a curbside pickup in the busy Rittenhouse location.  The location can be easy to miss. As I pulled up I called and they were able to come right out.
I order their signature lobster roll which comes with a bag of chips (~$20).  They have the 4oz option and the 6oz option for the lobster roll
column2: I ordered the 4oz and the lobster overflowed out of the roll.  I could only imagine how full the 6oz. would be since the roll size remains the same regardless of how much lobster meat you order.  The lobster roll was DELICIOUS!!!  The meat was abundant and there wasn't any fillers.  Just some type of butter sauce.  As traditional lobster rolls the meat was chilled but not cold or frozen
column3: but perfect.  The roll was lightly toasted and soft with a bit of mayo.  The chips were a nice add BUT as others mentioned I wasn't full after that meal which was the only drawback.  This was a good treat/splurge.";21/06/2021 15:31

column1: eV1PrnRUlYHBVV_Txx4uKQ;YRYpqWcYkc0r4G5G6Tfhbw;QJTBOy9RA0qVKx5XkeF-gA;1;0;4;0;"Where to begin. During this pandemic
column2: I completely understand potential staffing issues
column3: or even less than stellar customer service. We are all human. With that said
column4: this place would do better being closed than open. The staff is surly to say the least. Hell
column5: I even left a generous tip for the employee who took my order for over priced shitty food
column6: even though she was clearly annoyed by my existence. There is so much potential here that is being wasted. The owners would fair better at shutting it down now or replacing staff before it gets even worse. The only saving grace was the kind and clearly embarrassed woman who worked at the pizza place in the building. She isn't even a staff member of the bowling alley
column7: yet still apologized profusely on their behalf. That should tell you something.

column1: Also
column2: a friend of mine wasn't going to bowl because of a bad back. The cranky old bastard in charge of the shoes was quick to tell us that he has called the police on people in the past for not wearing shoes. Yep. So she paid to rent shoes to not bowl...sigh.

column1: The gaming area looked so fun. Until it took my girlfriend's money without being able to play a single game. You can guess how helpful good ole cranky was. At this point
column2: it was almost comical.

column1: In conclusion
column2: there is so much potential
column3: but the staff is destroying this business. Be warned and bowl elsewhere.";28/01/2021 23:58

column3: best doctor ever. So my stars are for all of them. But the actual office and office staff? Jesus take the wheel! In the last 6 months it's become a complete and utter hot mess. On a Tuesday there was no office manager or assistant manager available
column4: I still haven't gotten a call back from the billing department 6 months later

column6: no urine sample cups or toilet paper (2 occasions recently). They almost never pick up the phone anymore. As a result messages to various departments are ignored and go unreturned repeatedly. And forget surgery/ob scheduling ever knowing what scheduling is doing and so good luck getting in for your early scheduled OB appointments
column7: mine got pushed out further and then rescheduled to accommodate surgery changes the day of my appointment. They then acted like they were doing me a huge favor when they split up my 3 appointments the day of said appointments
column8: and canceling my first as I arrived in the parking lot?! To accommodate surgery because of their lack of communication between departments. And ultrasound? The ultrasound department doesn't know what anyone else is doing and sometimes not even what they are suppose to be doing. And referrals? Still waiting weeks later and so I'll miss out on recommended testing because my window is swiftly closing because they could not be bothered to make my appointment. It it wasn't for knowing that my doctor was one of the best in the area and how crappy the others are at the neighboring practice I would be long gone like several of my friends. column9: even if you aren't traveling with friends and kids.  We'll definitely return.  There is lots more to do in Philly than we realized.;20/10/2014 19:27

column1: xVA2N7zhUdJA_FJaksYteA;jMy_BrFo7ze24UyE8OHbnQ;OuXwt35S4Fx3ZpeDGACSdg;1;1;0;0;"When I checked in
column2: the woman in the lobby was very kind and provided a ton of information to all the questions we had.  When we first got to the room
column3: there was a technician in it trying to fix the light switch
column4: which I thought was odd.  Then after we were in the room for about 20 minutes and had already used the restroom
column5: housekeeping came in and said she forgot to provide clean towels.  At this point I wanted to cry as we had already used one of the towels.  Oddly enough she only replaced several random ones (of the fully stocked line of them) and kept the rest.  I asked her how she determined which were the old ones and why she was randomly picking and she said that she just knew.  I did not even let her walk away before I took the other ones she did not replace out and placed them in the corner of the bathroom so that we would not use them.  I knew I did not pay a high price and did not expect a luxury room; however
column6: this was all pretty off-putting.  It got even worse when later that evening we found blood on the sheets!!!!!  I called the front desk completely outraged and even said
column7: ""I am so disgusted that I don't want to even stay here"".  He VERY RUDELY replied with no problem
column8: you can leave and we will refund you.  I was appalled.  There was no apology whatsoever or offer of correcting the problem.  I got very testy with him and explained my daughter had an early morning event and I needed some resolution.  He then
column9: still in that rude tone
column10: offered to have housekeeping come in and change the sheets.  In the interim
column11: the woman who checked me in called my room and explained she was sorry for the inconvenience and that she would work on resolving this with finding a new room or sending housekeeping. I could not believe this was all happening!!!  When housekeeping FINALLY came - about 15-20 minutes later she saw the stain and insisted it was paint (nail polish).  I became very angry and explained that I had spilled nail polish on my sheets before and that it was NOT nail polish.  When you attempt to wash nail polish it remains hard on the sheet.  The crazy part was that there was simply no attempt to make this ugly situation better.  There was argument and defense from every corner.  The truth was that even if it was wine / food stain
column12: WHICH IS WAS NOT
column13: the sheet should have NEVER
column14: EVER been used!!!  Needless to say
column15: I would NOT recommend this motel at all!!!

column1: They did not even offer a refund for my stay there!!!!!";05/03/2017 23:18

coL77jj61Lfy3XPzI_LXTw;eQ3KXZKdD4hP-US4WI4lbg;0qrSkugigIhLIN4_0onM5A;1;48;32;12;"Oh my goodness
column2: I cannot believe I wasted a nice dress to go here. I was searching yesterday on Open Table to see who had a reservation available for 7-7:15ish pm. Chappy's came up so my  husband and I did a little research online via Yelp and Open Table reviews. The reviews were pretty favorable overall so we decided to give it a try. I had read that people go here for special occasions
column3: so my husband and I ditched our jeans for nicer clothes. Oops.

column1: I immediately judged the place when I walked in. The carpet
column2: yes carpet
column3: was completely stained. The lights were bright and the decor just awful. Completely awful. The hostess was no where to be seen and we were fourth in line waiting to be helped. About 5-10 minutes after we walked in the door the hostess finally greeted us and sat us for our 7:15 reservation. As we walked to our table the hostess noticed she had forgotten to give us Mardi Gras beads. What? Yes
column4: this place gives you Mardi Gras beads to wear when you enter. It's just that cheesy.

column1: Once we sat down I told my husband we could leave. Really. Suzie Wong's House of Yum is just down the street and I would gladly get up and go down there for dinner. We decided to stay put and see what this place was like. Hmm... kind of wish we would have left.

For dinner I ordered the Grilled Red Snapper and a side salad. The salad was decent and just your run of the mill side salad. I was very surprised the salad dressing came out in a plastic ramekin. At $29 for my entree I was not expecting a plastic ramekin. Wow. My dinner was actually okay. Although it was served on a dirty plate. The ""dirt"" was from my dish
column2: but the server/manager should have wiped it clean before it left the kitchen. It was luke warm and not hot
column3: but overall the fish which was topped with crab meat was good. The rice was nothing to write home about.

column1: Other things I noticed:
a) Water damage to the wall close to the ceiling. It had been painted over and not fixed.
b) There were a lot of older people dining here. I'm talking late 40s+.
c) The carpet is stained everywhere
column2: not just at the entryway.

column1: d) The only thing really cajun about this place is the fact they offer things blackened.
Net: My husband is thinking about nominating this place for Kitchen Nightmares.";28/02/2011 00:04

A simple order of a grilled cheese sandwich and a philly steak pushed our limits as these basic sandwiches took well over 40 minutes to arrive at our booth on a sleepy Saturday.  I watched our server slowly trudge back and forth without any sense of purpose or urgency
column5: trying to look busy

The philly steak was satisfying and is classic comfort food. The grilled cheese looked equally as ""comforty"" and is served on two thick slices of Texas Toast
column7: with a heaping mound of well prepared fries.  Overall

column1: My favorite rolls are the tidal wave
column2: thriller and crunchy red - although you truly can't go wrong. They all taste fresh and have interesting unique combinations. The crispy brussels or the shishito peppers are definitely the best apps I've tried. Both are light enough that you'll still be hungry for sushi

column1: yhEghfzjS1eqEYxXpKKUFw;Qf8PRDKe_Y-a4C7Hs8we0w;823XwYHayzm0Kufem5E1Aw;4;2;0;1;"Friendly service when ordering on the phone and picking up. The restaurant looked very clean inside. My food was ready on time. I really enjoyed my food. I have minimal experience with Korean food so I'm happy to know I can trust this place to introduce me to new food.

The fried rice was cooked perfectly with plenty of vegetables. It tasted amazing by itself and they gave me a big portion. I also enjoyed mixing the fried rice with my chicken. The chicken I tried was Kanpunggi which is meat in a sweet & spicy sauce. It did come with plain white rice
column2: but I always buy fried rice. The breaded chicken pieces were covered in a delicious sauce that gave them a vibrant color. The outside of the chicken was still crispy. The sweet & spicy balanced well because the chicken didn't taste too sweet or too spicy. Again
column3: they gave me plenty to eat over more than one meal.";11/08/2021 07:52

column1: Eg7CbquP6ZrQsn_dE9vbng;cGr0m1jvZeQbL_RWgAjK-Q;Hp1nkc3c3Q7_8oKXFn0vbw;4;6;1;2;"Denizens of Treasure Valley
column2: I don't make it out to breakfast very often.  Most breakfast fare (outside of a good poached egg) is pretty simple to make on your own
column3: and you don't have to bug the waiter to get your bacon extra crispy (or extra soggy
column4: if you prefer.)  But when the opportunity came up to finally attend an event with some fellow Boise Yelpers
column5: I had to jump on it and head over to Moe Joe's.  So I just want to take a quick second to thank Ophelia for organizing
column6: and getting the chance to meet everyone else who attended the ""Breakfast Club"" event! :)

column1: That said
column2: I have to start off with some negatives.  Moe Joe's really isn't set up to handle a large group like we had.  Despite having made prior arrangements for the event
column3: it still took about 20 minutes after our prescribed time before we were seated.  I understand not every restaurant is equipped to handle a dozen people at once
column4: but I have to say Moe Joe's kind of dropped the ball on this one.  I'd still recommend the place for a casual breakfast by yourself or a friend
column5: but if you're bringing the whole office or something... I'd say ""pass.""

column1: The food itself was well worth it though.  The cinnamon rolls (thanks again Ophelia) were as good as advertised.  My son plowed through most of the one we ""shared"" although I did get a bite or two.  The coffee was good
column2: better than your usual ""diner"" fare
column3: and refills were prompt and plentiful.  I got the Enchilada Chicken Stacker for my entree
column4: and I enjoyed it... good portion size
column5: good flavor.  The only ""complaint"" would be that I think I wanted more of that yummy cream sauce.  That was good stuff.

column1: Bottom line folks
column2: if you're looking for breakfast in Meridian
column3: Moe Joe's will fill the bill.  Just don't plan a family reunion brunch there. :P";30/05/2015 18:17

column1: dngVdjhsbRVJg-L5RKr8hw;5jlydBxYlYo7-A7AIMdBtQ;#NOME?;2;2;0;1;"So this is my once every 5 year best friend argument.  You know
column2: that argument you have with your best friend every few years that makes you wonder why you're friends in the first place.  Then a week or so goes by and you realize it's only natural
column3: and it's OK not to see eye to eye on everything!  I forgive you Yelp and I'm not going to throw away years of loyal friendship because you were dead WRONG about this place.  First off
column4: we were asked if we had reservations for lunch in a restaurant that was half empty.  The outside dining area was 80% empty and we were seated there within a few minutes.  Water was brought to the table immediately
column5: but we waited for at least 5 minutes for a waiter to even greet us.  And by greet I mean
column6: come over and ask if we were ready to order when we didn't even have menus yet.  He didn't introduce himself
column7: mention any specials or crack a smile. (under a mask that was half off his face)

column1: We ordered a prosciutto plate which was fairly dry with some wilted greens.  I had the spaghetti carbonara which was fine
column2: nothing special and a ricotta cheesecake which was OK too.  I don't remember anything much about the meal except I ate it with little interest other than hunger and I was paying for it.  The prices were extremely high for the quality
column3: but the kicker was the poor service.  I think our waiter checked on us once
column4: until I had to call him for the check.  But wait
column5: there's more!  As he walked away and saw I only tipped 15%
column6: I saw him shaking his head and say
column7: ""come on people"". The effing nerve!

column1: Now remember
column2: I tipped 15% because it's the decent thing to do.  Even if I get bad service
column3: I still tip 15%
column4: I just won't go back to that establishment.  I normally tip 20% for good service and  25% for excellent service.  I did this even before Corona because people are working hard for their money
column5: most times.  His entitlement was the only thing that shined during the encounter and that was proven by his reaction to a standard tip.  I have no sympathy for people who dial it in at work
column6: put no effort and expect optimal results.  All this coupled with mediocre food qualifies for a 2 star rating. I understand I'm an outlier here
column7: but it was what it was.";14/08/2021 03:30

column1: The takoyaki
column2: which is another thing I'm chronically afraid to chance

column1: And of course I also had to try an origiri because they're hard to find here y'all. I tried the pork. It was perfection. I'm finishing it right now for lunch.

column1: KHkX8nbaaMN44xjrh8GONw;Op2jHmwVRYVjbeUUlQ09Gw;s__nxHjThBRn0lQoZuXLsw;2;0;0;0;Made reservation for my family in their name using my credit card to hold.  When family arrived
column2: there was no room reserved for them and they were advised to go to the other LaQuinta close by.  A couple days later i discovered a charge on MY CREDIT CARD for the cost of the room that was never used.  (the same thing happened last year
column3: but too much trouble to pursue at the time-not this time). After returning I went to inquire about the missed reservation and was told it was reserved in my name.  After some resistance and misunderstanding on part of the desk clerk
column4: she finally acknowledged that the error was hers
column5: she submitted the refund and was told my account would be credited within 48 hours.  That was 6 days ago and I haven't gotten the refund yet.  Suffice to say I won't be recommending this motel again - two errors in two tries.  When I made the reservation on a Sunday afternoon
column6: I asked for a confirmation.  He handed me a hand-written number on a piece of note paper.  There as another lady
column7: whom I won't name
column8: working the desk with him.  The date was 2/4 for a 2/5 reservation.  There are plenty of suitable lodging locations in the area.  In case anybody wants to know
column9: I will be contacting the home office with my concern.  The refund invoice number is 249180
column10: supposedly processed on 2/19/18.  Any business can provide a clean bed
column11: TV
column12: continental breakfast
column13: etc.  It's the little things
column14: the attention to detail
column15: that keep customers coming back.  La Quinta was my family's choice of lodging.  Not again.;26/02/2018 01:10

column1: 2l7GB3FkLv7PHOjHK0Oslw;FHr7uFEjte9M0QQGIRYQcQ;_bVkb7sohmuJnQ9Bx65uhw;5;2;1;2;"Great location in the heart of downtown Saint Pete. We arrive there mid afternoon on a Monday and October 2021. While their selection doesn't have as many beers and some of the other breweries in the area but Enough of a selection that has a little bit of something for everybody. Parking can be tricky because it is located in downtown Saint Pete. Because of the time a day we were able to find parking along the street across from the brewery but easily would be difficult to find parking on a busy weekend.

I got the St. Pete Orange Wheat (very similar to Blue moon or shocktop) and my husband opted for the McCracken Scottish Ale. Both of yours were delicious and we opted to sit outside because of the beautiful weather. You can tell that the Brewers and the employees who work there truly look out for their customers. While we were sitting enjoying our mirrors a parking meter was going around and giving tickets and when the employees Thought that my car was going to get a boot or a ticket (they were closing off parking meters for the next day) let me know right away! Thankfully
column2: the meter employee was just closing some of the meters off for the next day! Good looking out fellas!";05/10/2021 20:54

column4: this is the place I'd want to be for my treatment.

column1: Before my treatment
column2: Nurse Richie and Pharmacist Brad gave brief presentations on the benefits of IV treatments and how accommodating Mobile IV Medics can be. I learned so much about their treatments and realize how beneficial IV therapy is. Not to mention
column3: they can administer your treatment anywhere. No taking time off of work and waiting in a clinic with a bunch of sick people!

column1: During my entire visit
column2: Estética Mia owner Claudia and her staff were attentive and so sweet. They were engaging and warm and added to my relaxing experience. From the amazing refreshments (including pastries from Renauds!) to the peaceful facial mist
column3: Claudia had me feeling right at home and wanting more!

column1: Nurse Richie (a registered nurse) was there every step of the way while my body safely absorbed the cocktail and I had zero worries about any damage to my kidneys or liver like I might by swallowing a regimen of pills. column1: lRCjto-MKmAwvm2-nW_exQ;PvN_bu_Mn8fgDitpREfczA;OYDAQKuxU8TeXRdER0qbkg;1;1;0;0;I spent 4 nights in the hotel. My friend and her two children joined us for the last two nights. My brother and his kids spent two nights in the hotel as well (in their own room). My nephew wanted to sleep in my room with his cousin one night. My nephew wet the bed in the middle of the night. When I woke up and discovered what had happened
column2: I immediately stripped the bed. There is a mattress protector on the bed
column3: and that was wet as well. I tried to take it off
column4: but it was zip tied on. I called housekeeping around 6am and let them know what had happened and requested that someone come and remove the cover and change the sheets. I reminded the front desk of my request around 1pm
column5: as it had not been taken care of yet. Around 6pm
column6: it still had not been taken care. I called the front desk again and said if someone would just come take the cover off and bring me sheets I would make the bed myself. Someone came up and handed me sheets and then started to leave. I told her I needed the mattress cover removed. She went over to the bed and started to make it. I stopped her and said the mattress protector needed to be taken off. She explained that she didn't speak much English. I tried to explain what was needed
column7: and she said she had to talk to a supervisor. She left. A few minutes later
column8: the front desk calls and says that the mattress protector can only be removed by maintenance
column9: and they won't be in until 6am the next morning. I explain that there is only a zip tie holding it on
column10: and she said only maintenance can remove them. She repeated that they would be in the next morning. I explained to her that there was per on the bed
column11: and we needed to sleep on it. She stated that my only other option was to switch rooms. I'm sorry
column12: what??  You really can't change this sheet
column13: so now I have to move rooms with 3 little kids?  I was told that was my only option. Because we needed the bed
column14: I had to switch rooms. The new room was on a completely different floor. It was a huge inconvenience
column15: and took at least an hour and a half out of the time I was supposed to be spending visiting with my friend. No one offered any help with our move or any other form of compensation for this huge inconvenience. I find it ridiculous that there was no way to remove this mattress cover. I can't be the first person to stay there who has had a child wet the bed. What would they have done if the hotel was full and they couldn't find us a new room?  If you are going to put covers on the mattresses that are not removable
column16: then at least make them waterproof!!  It is highly unlikely that I will be returning to this hotel.;01/01/2020 04:10

NLDwdpucJ2XYDSKCZgjkIA;405avW-box8RewXN6mfUqw;6opkFOcm4bWNLI-0ltojww;5;0;0;0;"Amazing... LIFE = CHANGED. Danny is an absolute magic worker. Truly
column2: finding Skin Harmonics has been the biggest blessing
column3: and I am forever grateful!! I was struggling with intense breakouts + trying to be proactive about anti-aging. This resulted in getting stuck in a Sephora hamster wheel
column4: completely trapped into trying new products only to find that my acne was getting worse and ""clean"" anti-aging products began giving me dark spots around my eyes. I tried more and more products
column5: diet changes
column6: supplements
column7: everything... hoping to find a solution. It felt completely hopeless.

column1: At start of quarantine
column2: my skin began breaking out like never before. Cystic pimples that were painful
column3: embarrassing
column4: and to be hones completely consuming. I tried everything and my skin seemed to only be getting worse. I'd spent hours researching ingredients in products + skin care
column5: and continued to be let down.

column1: When I stumbled upon Skin Harmonics on Yelp (so random)
column2: the reviews seemed promising and I figured I'd give this a shot. Obviously
column3: nothing else was working. I called Danny and we had an initial consult. She painted a clear picture our skin operates
column4: and promised me that my skin would clear up. To my disbelieve
column5: she kept that promise... Magic worker!

column1: Starting the process was not glamorous with the extraction facial
column2: but absolutely worth it. Without a doubt.

column1: I received my recommended Skin Harmonics products after my initial consult (the re-usable glass packaging is amazing btw).
She then recommended:
1- Use the products morning + night. She warned me my skin would purge
as I adjusted to the products for two weeks (which I was already breaking out constantly so it wasn't out of the ordinary).
2- The facial. Danny explained the extraction would be intense and that the next could days I would need to lay low and let my skin heal. She was right
column2: it definitely was painful
column3: but satisfying at the same time knowing that years of reoccurring clogged pores were finally having their break through. It was pretty insane

7pGSwMwMxwHdj_RAEvDcPw;3IH8qG5FNKZuMRY5TSlgYA;DxzL49yhgQ2CxZvmcXV_YA;3;1;2;2;"Ok so this is a difficult review to write. The reason this is so is because I have now been here 3 times and the first 2 times were pretty good the 3rd was atrocious. The first time I went it was to grab a quick bite with a girlfriend after our work out. We got the Edamame with the garlic lime topping as our appetizer and omg these are amazing!!! I highly recommend them. For my entree I chose the Buenos Aires bowl as it sounded as the most delicious to me and it did not have beans (which I am not a fan of). I instantly fell in love with this bowl! All the flavor! omg! I got it with the coconut avocado rice as my base and blackened chicken as my protein. After that first time I could not wait to go back and grab another bowl
column2: so I did. I went back for a late lunch with another girlfriend on a Saturday afternoon at about 3pm. Again I had the edamame appetizer and I ordered the Buenos Aires bowl as my entree
column3: this time I had a Michelob ultra with my meal (yes they have a beer selection + a craft soda machine). Again everything was great
column4: food was delicious
column5: service was fine
column6: nothing crazy!

column1: Well fast forward to this past weekend when I finally got honey to bring me to this establishment after raving about how great it was. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and were promptly seated by the kind hostess. The restaurant was not too busy maybe about 6 or 7 tables and it seemed they had quite a bit of servers/staff. It just so happened we had made it in time for Happy hour
column2: this meant discounts on bowls and drinks! Our server quickly came over
column3: introduced herself and took our drink orders. Honey just ordered water and I got a white sangria. This is when thing started to go down hill. I am pretty sure I received a mimosa in a wine glass the way one would serve sangria
column4: either that or there was a ton of orange juice in my white sangria. I let it slide... Our waitress is now ready to take our order
column5: I excitedly state I would like the Buenos Aires bowl when she tells me they are out. I am very annoyed at this point because this bowl is honestly the only reason I chose to come to this establishment on a Saturday afternoon. I figured it's not the waitresses fault and just suck it up
column6: happy I did because shortly after she stated a patron the day before was very upset they did not have the bowl. I then asked her to recommend another bowl that is similar
column7: she recommended the fajita bowl stating it was basically the same and that they could provide the chimichurri sauce that comes with the Buenos Aires. After looking at the menu it is very apparent these bowls are not ""basically the same bowl"" and in fact this bowl contains beans
column8: after expressing my disdain for beans she stated the can came sure to not include them. Great! This is not what  came here for but heck I am trying something new. Honey ordered some other bowl which he did say he enjoyed. Well our bowls come out and wouldn't you know it mine is covered in beans. As I wait for our server to come back around (trying to make eye contact) I tell honey to go on and start eating his food
column9: he wants to wait a bit. Our server comes over and i explain the issue
column10: she apologizes and says they will remake it and it will be right out. Waiting
column11: waiting
column12: waiting... I tell honey to eat his food. He begins to eat and I can tell he is trying to take his time. Waiting
column13: waiting
column14: waiting. Honey is done with his dish. Waiting
column15: waiting
column17: hostess happens to be walking by and ask if everything is okay
column18: at this point I tell her it is not and that we just want our check and we will be leaving. She noticed honey had finished his dish and we had finished our drink and I still did not have my food. Finally my dish appears as I am waiting for the check. I tell the person that brought it out that I am okay I will just take my check. At this point I had already decided and told honey I would just get a Chipotle bowl and eat it at home. Honey is very patient and was a server back in the day he was the reason I was patient so long--- but it got to the point where even he was like ""this is ridiculous"" and agreed I'm better off just grabbing a bowl at Chipotle. The only thing we can assume is that they put my ticket in for a new bowl as if a new customer had walked in?!?!?!?!? Why was my ticket not cut in line and my dish rectified in a more expedient manner? Beyond me! Anyhow they packaged my meal to go and out 2 cookies in the bag
column19: I appreciated the gesture but I was so upset I was ready to get out of there and we did. We paid our tab and they had removed my bowl which was kind. When I got home and ate my bowl I was disappointed. It was not ""basically the same bowl"" very different and just not as good even with adding the chimichurri sauce they gave me on the side.

column1: All in all many mistakes where made! How do you run out of the Buenos Aires bowl? How does it take longer to correct a bowl than it did to initially make it? Just make another!";07/06/2019 14:05

column1: 68NX05_XApvgdgpUHYl6Iw;0oLUvJnNu2RzFwXLsuaqYQ;lGKQ01-GSgSNBI4v8cj5dw;4;13;6;13;"I honestly can't imagine being a small business owner in today's new horrifying Covid-19 reality. The amount of pressure to stay afloat when most people aren't leaving their homes must be intense
column2: but to go ahead and OPEN a new business during these rough economic times takes perhaps the biggest set of balls that have ever existed. This is exactly what the guys at Heights Meat Market (new Brandon/Bloomingdale Ave. location) have done
column3: essentially extending their middle fingers to the virus
column4: pushing their chips to the middle of the table
column5: and betting all-in that the Brandon community will flock to their new store to devour their vast selection of meat and specialty game.

column1: Truth be told
column2: I visited this new location on a whim as I was actually cutting through back roads to avoid traffic on Bell Shoals and Bloomingdale when the buddy I was with mentioned that they read somewhere that this new store had just opened a couple of months ago and that we should check it out because they'd heard that their Seminole Heights location had a great reputation. Since I'm a sucker for checking out new places
column3: I quickly jotted into the adjoining parking lot next to the auto parts store where this new establishment now resides
column4: and we ventured inside.

column1: I've never been to any of their other stores (Seminole Heights and Land O' Lakes)
column2: so I don't know what exactly the layout is supposed to look like
column3: but I have to admit that the inside looked a little underwhelming (you can make your own assumptions based on the pictures I took attached to this review).  Perhaps things were more spread out due to virus regulations
column4: but it was basically about 14-15 freezer cases that had signs atop each one describing the proteins that were inside each one. But seriously
column5: who cares
column6: it's all about the product that they provide and based on that notion
column7: this is where my dilemma makes my way into this story.

column1: I didn't actually purchase anything
column2: so my review is really about getting this particular store on the YELP map (I noticed no one had reviewed the place yet
column3: so I wanted to help them out). The guys in the store (I'm pretty sure were the owners) were extremely nice and friendly
column4: and did a great job describing everything in the store and answering all of the multitude of questions that people had. I would have gone 5 stars based on my overall experience
column5: but I just have one gripe (which is really just my own personal issue) and that is that they outsource all of their meats from out of town (other states). I'm probably just getting old and cranky
column6: but when I think meat market I envision the old school butchers that are still wearing their bloody aprons from cutting up their meat in the back when they come out to the counter to help you
column7: but I digress.

column1: Per my earlier comments
column2: this review was really an attempt to help get butts in the door for these fine folks
column3: so my promise to them is that I will do a follow up review after I've actually purchased and eaten their delectable looking meats
column4: and then give some quality feedback. Until then my fellow Brandonites
column5: go check this place out and let me know what YOU think
column6: and make sure to continue to support local businesses like these guys
column7: they all need are help in these crappy times";19/09/2020 00:00

column1: SpPDVFnRuq43eYASzv9cSw;5NW3QBHwUyxY-eeHQ4VGTA;8tJWgFe3ztfxYg3YWcw3rA;4;8;6;5;"When I say that I literally walked into this place

column2: some things are not worth it but just hear me out.

column1: After placing the polish on my hand which has purple and some gold tones
column2: they used a magnet
column3: a MAGNET and right in front of me the gold gathered in the center. I was so amazed and it looks so good! That's worth the extra $5!

column1: The service on its own was great as this was one the best full sets I have had!
They are a little pricier than other pricey places in SB but you will come out LOVING IT and LOVING YOU!";07/04/2019 07:54

bH7kAWrSTQ8r32_9X4GXrg;EVVVBxIm05vptKQmgDwWvw;z6I4QVP1M1HXETgwD92XHg;5;1;0;0;"This place is INCREDIBLE.
Everything from the service to the wine selection (they even have some wine from the Planetas in Sicily which are my extended family!) to the FOOD.
Famfreakintastic people! The beef carpaccio and caprese are the best starters....melt in your mouth beef...beautifully creamy mozzarella. What's not to love.

The carbonara has to be one of the best pasta dishes I have had outside of Sicily...hands down. Blows my mom's outta the water (hope to God she doesn't read this). The duck ravioli in a mushroom pecorino cream sauce is every person's wildest dream come true...
Their dessert selection is always heavy duty with a good dozen smackin' tasty options :)
Love this place!!! Always come when I visit SB
column2: never leave disappointed and the value is BOMB!

column1: wuVLaVFW2CLSEdMX_YG5XQ;m5ORqgiVvB_JvVAdPQcGhg;1kRUUIg0EsHQndMfMC2x9g;5;2;0;0;"Yelp reviews don't lie. George has been fixing jewelry for 33 years! He's super chill and provides professional level of customer service. Overall

WxMXVgG5zWIXFeW7VpC51g;oeFiWvoOG0hpMOXXxblfyQ;MqFYLVFTCPseygf593p2Uw;4;6;0;1;"I am surprised that this restaurant is still so undiscovered.  Pronounced ""sung hung."" The placemats on the table show historical and travel information about the Hue province of Vietnam as well as the city of Hue.  I did taste a slight difference in the flavorings of the food
column2: but not much difference in the menu offerings.  The décor is quaint
column3: clean
column4: and well organized.  There is not much to see from the outside
column5: and you can forget about seeing inside from the road.  This is mostly seen with the table's utensil and condiment offerings on all tables.  From the clientele
column6: it has to be authentic.

column1: We started off with the Goi Cuon ($3.00)
column2: two large fresh rolls filled with the usual items.  But
column3: these were much larger and tastier than I am used to.  There is a lemongrass flavor on the shrimp and there are also crispy fried onions- a great flavor.  Muc Chein Don ($10.95) was an appetizer of fried squid rings on a fresh bed of salad
column4: served with a side of unusual sauce.  The sauce was like garlic
column5: ketchup
column6: and pinapple used for dipping the squid.  This was a very large portion for an appetizer
column7: which would explain the price.

column1: The Pho Tai (large $7.95) was a heavy bowl of flavorful broth.  Some in Tampa say that it is the best in the city
column2: served here.  While it is very salty
column3: beefy
column4: and full of flavor- I would not say it is better than Pho Quyen on Hillsborough.  It is sad that they do not offer flank steak with meatballs.  Only meatballs on their own.  The Special Rice Plate (Com $8.50) was pretty average in offerings.  The mixed omelet was dry
column5: the fried egg was excellent (over easy)
column6: and the grilled pork had an interesting (yet delicious) flavor.

column1: We were too full to order Che Ba Mau
column2: which they had on display in the large cooler.  Note that you are served iced green tea here for free
column3: so there is no reason to order a drink.  They do not have a fountain
column4: so it is only per can for soda and coconut juice.

column1: This was an excellent meal
column2: and I will definitely be returning after trying out even more items in the area.  Next on my list here is the spicy beef salad
column3: Che Ba Mau
column4: Bo Luc Lac
column5: and one of the many cook at your table hot pots.";20/10/2009 17:34

column1: ekbL_2DKxX19OxzehxEWoQ;A4bsa7ykYRVCnb4h2vZALw;FdoqtMadj4ybDAL7S-yUBQ;4;81;60;79;"This place is my little escape from town even though it's only about 10-15 min away from where I live.

The best part about this place is the Free meal you get on your birthday! You can get breakfast
column2: or lunch at any price on the menu. So take advantage of that if you're in the area on your birthday.

column1: The food has been good to me aside from my latest visit where my sons potatoes were served black and burnt to the crisp! I wanted to send them back but he taste tested them and surprisingly said they were good. But really guys who serves potatoes that burnt to customers?? C'mon now!
Aside from that one mistake I still like this place. My favorite breakfast choice is the two's (see pic). This comes with 2 eggs
column2: 2 slices of yummy bacon
column3: and 2 slices of French toast. It's not too much food and I can actually finish this meal.

column1: Water will cost you extra here since afterall we are in drought mode! But they offer Voss bottled water for $1 and if you don't finish the whole bottle it's yours to keep.

I look forward to coming back here again next time to try out their lunch menu.";30/12/2015 14:59

QrgrsxqTvYYuthlBLV2SuA;8690gLMZkjXU3xzV-DObTA;tARR9jhv5gi9TjsfSVmjmw;5;2;0;1;"I love this place so much!
I planned a Sunday Breakfast here on a Sunday Morning - we arrived right when it opened. The owner and staff opened the doors for us and while we were waiting for the crepe grills to warm up
column2: a very friendly woman made us lattes.  As we were sipping on our lattes and reading the menu - a huge group of people went to the ordering counter in front of us
column3: so the owner (I assumed out of courtesy) asked us what we wanted and started on our order.

column1: My companion had ordered the French Riviera Crepe and I ordered the Mediterranean Crepe
column2: with the plan that if we were still hungry after we ate the 'hearty' crepes we would split a sweet crepe.  While I can't speak on behalf of the French Rivera Crepe (it has chicken and I'm Vegetarian) - my companion said it was delicious. The Mediterranean Crepe came with classic hummus
column3: feta cheese
column4: artichoke pesto
column5: tomatoes and cucumbers - it was delicious
column6: hearty
column7: and filling! The contrast between the light crepe
column8: tomatoes
column9: and cucumber with the richness of the hummus and feta was amazing! We were too full to try a sweet crepe. Also
column10: before I forget the plain latte was excellent - no bitter after taste
column11: but not weak either.

column1: They had many vegetarian options already and the owner informed me that crepes with meat could be made without meat. Sadly
column2: since crepes have eggs - by default not recommended for vegans.

column1: The cafe itself is small and simply decorated. It was also immaculately clean. The also had a small outdoor seating section if that appeals to you. The owner we meet and staff were super friendly. They had many vegetarian options. While sitting there and eating - french sounding music was playing in the background
column2: we were eating delicious crepes - my companion turned to me and said ""this is just like the small cafes in France"" (they have been numerous of times).

column1: The ONLY NEGATIVE about this cafe is that there are soooooo many delicious options and a human stomach can only eat so much at one sitting ;)
I will be coming back! I can't wait to try the Cowgirl and a sweet crepe!";04/05/2018 19:34

G_4SI7cPtUKwMvHbkAks8A;HezB1JmzC8sXSqAk0lJ00g;DB8-IvAryyddpIuZWwpGNA;5;1;1;1;This is a really nice visit in Boise.  Large grounds

column1: wnfQqCg0M8jk4zsI-eF3EQ;6JFPn3cHzHpG-uN8lvQ4lQ;mnwTbHyIgpMvOG9705zqWA;3;6;1;4;"I wouldn't describe myself a country music fan
column2: but I am a music fan and a history buff. And when I visit a place I enjoy learning about what makes it tick. So as a tourist in the Music City I didn't feel I should ignore the opportunity to visit this museum. Especially considering the investment made in its fabulous new home in downtown Nashville. Of course
column3: I've also toured plenty of attractions that I initially wanted to avoid only to come away pleasantly surprised. So I'm inclined give new things a try even if it isn't necessarily what I'd choose on my own. And if I don't like something
column4: I'm usually glad I at least gave it a shot.

column1: To start with
column2: the entrance fee for adults is $28 USD
column3: which is actually a little below average for an attraction of this size and quality anywhere in the world. Still
column4: if price is a big consideration for you and you're on the fence about whether to go
column5: you should probably bow out. I'm glad I went
column6: but I can also admit I wasn't entirely satisfied by the experience. The facility and presentations were beautiful
column7: and the layout and design are pleasant
column8: but the gallery wasn't as engaging as it could have been and I was expecting a larger collection and many more artists to be featured. I especially wanted to see much more about the origins and history of country--which was pretty light relative to the attention paid to contemporary artists.

column1: In particular
column2: I found the tribute to The Judds a bit out of place at the entrance. And while Taylor Swift is undoubtedly an important figure in country's crossover into popular music
column3: featuring her here just seemed to be pandering to what's currently popular. And the closing bit about the unbroken circle and the Guardians of Country Music was too contrived and self-important.

column1: In the end
column2: I'm glad I went. I wasn't entirely fulfilled
column3: but I learned a few things and enjoyed the experience even if I wished for more. To me
column4: if you like experiences
column5: it's one worth having. But if you're easily disappointed or put off by the cost
column6: you can safely spend your time elsewhere.";02/06/2019 16:35

column1: q7XzjEaW-tVZf8PxDDB5sg;i1t8QVSzFW9uZr-4K_abjw;8XShad-H8bEr_p2GwFIoiQ;4;1;0;0;"Tapped is a new bar concept that has joined the slew of bars that have been building up in Maplewood. It takes over the space that was formerly housed by A Pizza Story. The theme of Tapped (thus its name) is that you pick and pour your own drinks. When you arrive at the restaurant you get an ID band. You then use this ID band to activate the different taps around the bar. They have a collection of roughly 8 wines and then 40 different beers to choose from. There are a large number of local beers
column2: which myself and my fiancee really appreciated.

column1: I liked the fact that you can sample the different beers. Often times I don't want to try a full pint of some outlandish beer I have never heard off. Tapped provides the ability to try many different beers. If you find one you really like you can fill up a full pint. The wrist band limits the total amount of alcohol you can get
column2: but unless your goal is to just get hammered this isn't an issue.

column1: You can also order a limited selection of pizzas and other bar food. The food fired oven installed in a Pizza Story is still there. The food has looked good
column2: but I have yet to try it. I view the place as a bar
column3: and the food is just an extra bonus.";07/06/2017 15:35

column2: but most of it is suggestions.

column1: First of all
column2: the location is ok
column3: but not great. It is kind of ""off the beaten path
column4: in the commercial area of Harrahan
column5: which is ok
column6: but I am guessing only people who live in Harahan ever really go here. The parking is fairly ample.

column1: As far as service goes
column2: everyone seemed to be fairly professional. The lady at the register was helpful and efficient.

column1: When you walk in
column2: you have to order at the desk
column3: which I actually like better than table service. They have a wide variety of teas
column4: including awesome herbal teas. This is a big plus for me
column5: since I don't do caffeine.

column1: The breakfast menu offers a wide variety of options
column2: but since I won't be heading out that way often
column3: I decided to jump right in and get the eggs benedict with hashbrowns. It is my firm belief that if a cafe can get that dish right
column4: everything else will be awesome. There is real skill involved in making even a decent benedict.

column1: When my breakfast came out
column2: it looked ok
column3: but since I eat with my eyes first
column4: I would say that it would be worth it for the business to invest in slightly nicer plates and to add some green to the dish for color. A little parsley on the potatoes
column5: for instance
column6: wouldn't hurt
column7: or even a slice of orange with the peel flipped up along side the eggs. These additions would be inexpensive
column8: and would make the dish so much more appealing.

column1: The flavor of the benedict itself was good: lemony and well balanced. None of the yolks were overcooked. Still
column2: I was missing the benefits of a ""pretty"" breakfast.

column1: As for decor
column2: as a customer I dislike cheap/stereotypical kitchen decor
column3: and this place is the poster child for ""I went to Kirklands and bought some chef pictures."" It would be great if the owner could
column4: instead
column5: find some local artists with Louisiana themed pieces
column6: and put the art up on consignment. It will give the cafe a more personal feel
column7: and the owner wouldn't have to spend a dime.

column1: Also
column2: there is a nice little cubby in the center of the room...filled with things like Styrofoam to-go boxes and random
column3: hodgepodge decorations. Maybe those things could be swapped out for a little merchandise like cute mugs branded with the business name.

column1: Most of all
column2: the back wall above the large windows has an obvious mold problem
column3: and I found this concerning. That stuff needs to be taken care of ASAP.";27/02/2018 20:26

column1: pZFUCWjtp6lxbJQ4EdteeQ;plt49nLB5xzZz042A94Bsg;wIiAO9IHsLEPQ1BVI2RJug;2;2;0;1;"This is hard as I really want to leave a good review but it's impossible to do. column2: that's where this review goes South.  I ordered a dirty martini.  The don't have Absolut

column1: Oh!  They brought bread out to the table with pesto!  That tasted good.  We had stuffed mushrooms that were alright.  My salad looked like they took a handful of spring mix from Publix and put it in a plate.  I'm not kidding!  I ordered the Parmesan crusted salmon.  I would value my dinner at $8.99.  There was absolutely no pride put into this food.  In fact the salmon I had looked exactly like the frozen salmon portions I but from Walmart.  I know because we had some a few nights ago and it was strangely familiar.  The crust was not a crust.  There was a few slices of summer squash on my plate that I don't try as they were overcooked and soggy.  The mash potatoes were- ok.  This is nothing worth the money we paid.  My husband had the veal.  He said it was chewy and had a paste like coating on it.  Let me put it this way: my husband purchased a veal dinner and did not finish it.   The wait for everything from the drinks to the food to the check was not prompt or even a reasonable wait.  We actually all stood up at the table to show we were ready and needed the check.  It's really sad because it's a cool concept but going on a Friday night and being out of key dishes and not having enough staff
column2: liquor
column3: or food is unacceptable.  We paid

column3: and she had a good sense of humor. She was on top of things the entire time and I would return just to see her again.

column1: My son got the Chili Burger and I got the Bbq Burger. My burger had a lot of sauce on it. If that's a problem then I'd say to specifically request to go light on the sauce or just get the sauce on the side. Now both burgers came out cooked as we liked them and were very tasty.  The sidewinder fries came out perfectly cooked and were very good as well.

I totally forgot to check in on Yelp. For those that go make sure you do. They have a $5 off $25 coupon. I will return for the great service I got from Allie and the burgers for sure.";03/09/2019 17:28
WhEEpuyC8SzjakhxqSFrxA;xbeL7U-dQkVwUlNiyxUpCA;F9BES1HFD3BkIudUe4oTgg;5;0;0;1;"Holy smokes
column2: this place is massive and awesome. The recommended time to check out the whole place is 3-5 hours
column3: and I can see why. There are a lot of different planes and helicopters to check out. I don't think I got to see the whole thing
column4: because of how much there was.

column1: They had the Air Force One that transported Kennedy and Johnson there
column2: as well as the same type of plane used for the movie Top Gun. But they also had a bunch of old airline planes that I had never heard of or haven't seen in a while. Vietnam era helicopters and others that are currently used
column3: too.

column1: It can get really hot walking around the whole place
column2: so drinking water is highly recommended for the time you are there. A must for fans of aviation and history

column1: yFKT0UNlUWNWD4vPpYiNFA;Oe-iKp0X7luTvlpDuWmgBQ;Vwj0mnaY_6_lSsyOYXRz4g;4;4;0;3;David's is a convenient place in Spanish Springs for a quick bite to eat. Typically

z__xZ4JMTije32d6iLUtmQ;#NOME?;LalGsMdQmJeIvCgqHVZZsg;5;2;0;2;We waited in line for about 15 minutes outside to practice good social distancing while waiting to order our shakes. Once inside

column1: #NOME?;oeFiWvoOG0hpMOXXxblfyQ;IULNbESdOY5-EvQT6RsTcw;3;1;2;1;"Cedars Cafeteria is a humble Lebanese joint

column1: There is an ordering counter with the menu on the wall.  But
column2: if you are dining in
column3: there is table service and hand held menu ordering.  Service was quite good
column4: but there were only two tables of customers at the time I was here.

column1: While I'm not necessarily hooked by any of the dishes
column2: there are a few items that are not common:

column1: 1. Soujek Wrap- house made sausage wrapped in a pita with garlic tahini sauce.  It was just a wrap
column2: nothing spectacular.  The fries were actually more impressive
column3: coated and super crispy.

column1: 2. Fatayer-  Huge basket of ground beef pies.  The pie shell portion was tender and served hot.  Again
column2: not bursting with flavor or anything
column3: but a large portion for only $5.99.  My husband could not stop eating them.  But
column4: the flavor just reminded me of a Krystal burger.

column1: Almost $6 for a service of hummus

column3: so for this price

column1: I hope that the Babaghanoush is worth a trip back.
If you are looking for Halal classic American dishes

column3: Philly Steak sandwiches
column4: hamburgers

column1: EP4_XBaKu2mRwjDWV9LH9A;RmoukqJ3juSqBVDZwPdGbg;zJbcZW_h5v7L5W8PVGUB5w;5;0;0;0;Great food

column1: YNcFOop1dhUi4FFEO0r8eQ;zUKeZNu4tCG56xjwWH54Vw;X2J_iYaWmqI-7PoYVNbp-g;5;26;11;25;"New Orleans is a walking city. I didn't rent a car because I knew I'd be either walking or taking an Uber.
After a few days of looking at Uber costs
column2: I went to the front desk of my hotel and asked about alternate transportation. Sir
column3: we have the St Charles Street car! Download the app and you'll see times
column4: pricing
column5: etc..

column1: Now that's what I'm talking about!
I'm from New York
column2: no need to hail an Uber when I have the oldest working trolley system in the United States still in operation! For a little over a buck I'm hitting up the most of the highlights of the city. And let's not get it twisted
column3: I've been on the San Francisco trolley. They have to stop traffic and physically turn the damn trolley? What. The.

column1: New Orleans has it down
column2: it's a pretty unique system. Every time I hopped on
column3: it wasn't jammed like a NYC bus.

column1: Comfortable
column2: running on time and historical is how I'd best describe the St Charles Street trolley.

column1: PS- when I was on the San Francisco cable car
column2: I was humming ""The San Francisco treat"". It would have been nice to be greeted by a band
column3: something. Get on that the next time I visit.

column1: 5 stars from me
column2: it was a pleasure to ride on your New Orleans treasure.";09/11/2021 12:40

column1: 0Gd3JpkTBE2eE49m8497aA;WO6L5yMX5LEeJuMNMjerRQ;WAmcXAO2Q5-qvyj9oT88fw;5;0;0;0;"This place exceeded my expectations!

column2: it's Cinnaminson I know it's not gonna be Morimoto grade but it fulfilled my craving and was fresh! The wasabi quality could def be better but hakuna matata

column1: The chirashi was surprisingly so fresh and tasty! I love the little garlic rub they put on it. The only critique I have is I would appreciate a little bit more rice and less daikon.  The variety and quality of sashimi was so perfect
column2: exactly what I was craving.

column1: Can't wait to try more stuff here!";14/01/2022 01:33
ZwC975phygLGkYuoTDtyFg;B8c17RLH6AaglKN-jW4RwQ;MxRZHZoDVVnN7EvMAHf1EA;5;0;1;0;"Dined here with a business occasion with 4 others. This location has a great vibe

column1: Some excellent Happy Hour deals on wine and appetizers. The bar was very crowded but a comfortable upscale crowd.

Big tab for this crowd. Lucky I dodged the tab on this one. This is a great event/business venue restaurant.
Excellent corporate expense account price/value relationship. It always helps promote your business and keeps you clients happy and stuffed.";10/02/2010 00:55

column1: 2Mr2Y11QqMBizlm3JjuiPQ;xmpCHaykU2G6bZE0PnSfVg;kbS-2VzNI6ulsmQg0szIWQ;4;0;0;1;"My husband and I booked a dinner reservation here. When booking

column1: K4DzjPtLAtzc-oHyePcEEA;HO4-64uz5xuSmjfhP8Doxw;c0F9yKr0bJuQDtG1lzDgmQ;5;5;0;1;"We absolutely love this place. There's nothing about this place that isn't astonishing from the decor to the great service to just the overall feel of the restaurant was very good.

We came on a Sunday just me and my wife to get away from the kids and just have some couple time. We were greeted immediately and we decided to sit at the bar. At the bar we were greeted by the bartender and offered the specials. Of course I'm on the hunt for Bloody Mary's so I ordered the regular one and my wife ordered Peach Bellini. She offered to the special of unlimited drinks for both of those but we declined.

The bartender then made a few suggestions and we ordered one of the suggestions. The brunch selection is very eclectic and well thought. My wife ordered the Meat Scramble and I ordered the 3 Little Pig Sandwich.
My wife's dish looked good but my fish was phenomenal. The sandwich was made of jalapeño cornbread biscuit with sausage
column2: egg
column3: bacon and a spicy sauce.  It was more in the sandwich but that's what caught my attention as I was devouring it.

column1: I then ordered the Smoked Bourbon Bloody Mary. The glass is smoked by burning a wood plank then placing the glass on the plank to give it the smoke effect. Although the bourbon is a bit strong for my taste it was good. The bartender suggested the next time that I can trade it for vodka. I thought that was thoughtful.
The experience there was great and we are heading there sooner than later. They have specials all week long btw.";01/05/2017 03:55

column1: I've gotten a wedding & a different wedding's rehearsal dinner to serve Sweet Lucy's BBQ... It is the holy grail of Philadelphia Barbecue.

Whether you're gorging on their Monday night buffet (the last buffet on earth I will subject my body to) or grabbing takeout (don't forget the extra fixin's!) the food is always fan-flipping-tastic. If you're not a buffet person
column2: it's worth going to the one at Sweet Lucy's just once
column3: so you can try one of each of their mouthwatering options in one sitting. (Be forewarned
column4: you may have something like a religious epiphany while there.) Some barbecue joints serve their meat without sauce
column5: but not so at Sweet Lucy's. Theirs is a perfect blend of sweet/tangy/tart/smokey deliciousness that is on the pulled pork
column6: brisket
column7: and ribs
column8: and I always get extra to put on because who wouldn't want extra happiness on their sandwich? (So if you're doing take-out
column9: don't miss the fixin's station to the right of the cash registers. Get some of that business (and some pickles!) to go!)

column1: Best Side: Sweet Potatoes

Go hungry
column2: go ravenous
column3: just get there at some point. It's definitely one not to be missed.";13/03/2018 15:53
