column1: 4MGX5wtzKd5P0A1L5CLVdA;AlX2vfHDt9ckUYYx4WzjhA;YeJAxQZMvD0YldaDu4rQaQ;2;0;0;0;"Food was decent
column2: slightly on the high side in price
column3: but not too excessive. However
column4: the lack of instruction to not stand in the waiting room with the others while waiting to be seated
column5: but to instead shove through everyone else and take any empty seat
column6: was the first question mark. After asking and then and only then being told we could sit at a table
column7: we waited. Another couple sat next to us and a waitress took their order first. After looking around obviously perplexed
column8: another waitress came up and took our order. We did receive our food in a timely manner and it was fairly good. The bright side in an otherwise dark story. So then we waited for our check. At some point the waitress came by and we asked and she said ""oh I forgot your check!"". No big deal
column9: they were busy and things happen
column10: although we already went through a few things so far
column11: but then she never came back. And keep in mind the place is only so big and we were no more than 5 feet away. I went to get up to the counter where she was talking and then she gave me the check
column12: so I went to pay and took out my bank card. This is when I was told ""cash only"". No where on the entrance door
column13: on the walls
column14: or anywhere else that I could see during our visit was a notice of ""cash only"". Nor did the waitress think it important enough to mention during this visit to a restaurant in the 21st century. But
column15: wait! A solution! Of course they have an ATM for you to get cash. For a fee that they get a percentage of. How thoughtful to provide this service. Why use credit cards that cost you a fee
column16: when you can charge people a fee to give you cash! To me that is pretty crooked.

column1: Will I go back? Certainly not. There are much better places to get equal quality food without the stress and added costs.";07/06/2018 00:48

column1: WgO3fTyOET_qythsDCj1sw;I49YlA_84naO59X0N3Sy7g;IWHscMR1NaaLDy6g5lpnkg;4;1;0;0;"Visiting from Austin

column4: we were pretty disappointed. To recover our disappointment
column5: hoping this place would be better than Pho Orchid.

column1: This place was packed during lunch time. we were lucky to find a table for 5.
We were served by a server name John.  Here is what I thought of this place:
Tried many awesome Pho & I have to say Pho NOLA was far far better than Pho Orchid.
Service from John was amazing. He was smiling whole time
column2: make sure we get what we need & double checking by asking us if we need anything.

column1: Food: It was very fresh & delicious. If I have to pick few things... I had char grill pork for vermicelli dish. Little too much fat & little too chewy. Flavor can be little more marinated flavor but it was light flavor. I requested to not have noodle
column2: just salad which was very fresh. Also Had pork spring rolls
column3: rice paper was little too dry but I enjoyed it.

column1: I didn't try pho so I am not so sure how pho is like but I know I am coming back to definitely try pho.
Oh
column2: I also tried Thai tea with tapioca. Thai tea was little too sweet & less tea flavor for me.

column1: All my coworkers just loved their food & they told me to pick lunch restaurant from now on.
At the end
column2: my lunch was $21 including tip. Again
column3: I am not a good tipper but I gave John more than 20% which in my book
column4: he rocks!  (no I am not related to him what so ever. LOL)";12/05/2015 21:05

column1: HRuUxzNjD_KRlqv9q4iI_g;dbWn8HCsG3eI9AmS2G3O2g;j4ZuVRyMlFVTQAXJuWDluA;4;0;2;0;"I love PIZZA! PIZZA! And I love the Hot & Ready deal. $5 for a pizza and you don't have to call ahead

column1: This is my favorite Little Caesars in the Tampa Bay Area. First
column2: the staff had great customer service. Friendly with warm smiles. It was hard to say no when they asked if I wanted to upgrade to the meal (with crazy bread and a 2 liter). In a act
column3: it was so hard that I said yes!

column1: This location is conveniently located on the corner of a strip mall. There is lots of parking and the inside of the store is bigger than most other Little Caesars in the area. This store is a perfect example of what Little Caesars does right.
For some time
column2: I have had fun calling the Hot & Ready Pizzas Hot & Sweaty Pizzas. I would have probably given this location 5 stars had it not been for the fact my last pizza was a bit more sweaty than ready. It seemed a bit under cooked. Nevertheless
column3: whenever your get the awesome deal called Hot & Ready
column4: there is always some risk of hit of miss.

column1: I will keep coming back to this location for the clean and large store and great customer service. Surely there will be a few more misses (sweaty pizzas)
column2: but I hope for a greater percentage of hits (ready pizzas). And remember
column3: even if the pizza is a bit sweaty
column4: it will always taste better than a frozen pizza you cook in your oven
column5: and if you have seen prices at the grocery store for frozen pizzas
column6: many of them will cost you a lot more than just picking up a Hot & Ready at your local Little Caesars.";27/01/2013 19:13

ueKSvMB0GUk_JxxWD5RO_A;eypiTTvXcQKwvSdicerkZw;G8pVaj3yS503ah8fxncDVA;5;5;2;4;"Best bakery and lunch spot in Nashville for an eclectic cafe meal with decent vegetarian options. Dozen baked all their bread and pastries in house
column2: daily which makes for what I think
column3: the best bread in Nashville. Combined with the mix of traditional and experimental dining options
column4: this is one of my new favorite spots in Nashville. The menu offers breakfast and lunch on weekdays and brunch on weekends. It consists of salads
column5: sandwiches
column6: tartines
column7: soups
column8: and baked goods. You can even mix and match 1/2 a sandwich or tartine with a salad or soup. All the ingredients are extremely fresh and for the most part local as well. The portion sizes are not too big
column9: but definitely filling. I had the egg in a hole with caprese salad which had  toasted homemade sourdough and an egg over medium. The bread was toothsome
column10: buttery
column11: crunchy
column12: and not sweet unlike most american bread and the egg was perfectly over medium with a somewhat runny center. The salad was extremely fresh and not overdressed. You could tell it was made to order. My friend tried the benton sandwich which had such a beautiful combination of peaches
column13: pesto
column14: tomatoes
column15: and bacon on a baguette. He was very pleased with it. We split a pastry that was like a croissant with strawberry filling and it was divine. So flaky
column17: and moist but not too sweet and perfectly paired with the strawberry preserves. Dozen serves Crema coffee
column18: which is some of the best in Nashville

column1: Though the spot is a little out of the way
column2: it's certainly worth the trip. I went on a sunday for brunch and was pleasantly pleased to not find a line  or 45 minute wait or slew or bachelorettes in matching t-shirts. Just some young hip locals and family's enjoying a modern and cozy spot. Dozen is minimally
column3: but expertly decorated to keep the vibe casual but still alluding to the artsy neighborhood it is located in. Even the bathrooms are decked out in cool graphics.

column1: I love this place and will definitely be back.";06/06/2017 20:45

column1: Bq2t0BO5RL1B3i9OFpqkuA;6rdtGHlLN7LrKLSDmIV-wA;nQeu2F4xOiKoXIp-9engUw;4;0;0;0;"Update

column2: who messaged me and rescued the situation. He provided a detailed explanation of why the issue occurred
column3: how they were going to make sure it never happened again

column1: This review is not about the food
column2: because they cancelled my reservation and I was never able to sample it
column3: but their service. Long story short
column4: I made a reservation on Thursday for Monday night
column5: got a confirmation text on Sunday night and 10 minutes after receiving the text got a call from the restaurant cancelling it. Apparently
column6: someone decided to book the whole restaurant the day I happened to have a reservation and they were kind enough to call and tell me the good news that my reservation was no more. I loved the fact that she followed it up with
column7: "" I can help you make a reservation for another day"". I was a little upset as this was a team dinner for co-workers coming in from out of town and I had to scramble to find another suitable restaurant. When I mentioned that it was very inconvenient to be told this late that my reservation was being cancelled
column8: the answer was less than satisfactory. In short she didn't care and offered a hollow apology and that was that.

column1: I understand that they are a business and if someone is offering to buy out the whole place they won't say no. But at the end this business is focused towards customer service so if you're causing a potential customer an inconvenience

column1: UVBSQaC9di95uPIGctV4qQ;woAENwRAPjSbnn00KAcdPA;_qmFWIAH9ZATeQpXxdm8rg;5;1;0;0;"My mom and I did Cloud Climbers last weekend in SB and had such a fabulous time! Our driver picked us up directly from our hotel that morning. We were with 4 other people
column2: which was perfect. Then we were off into the gorgeous countryside of Santa Ynez! We visited 4 vineyards throughout the day
column3: each with a unique character and wine-tasting experience. We started with a larger
column4: more commercial winery and ended up at a lovely family-owned vineyard. Since there were only 6 of us
column5: we were able to really engage with the owners and wine experts at all of the wineries. Our driver/guide also took care ordering lunch for the group from a place called Panino's - AMAZING sandwiches! We never felt rushed at all
column6: our guide let us enjoy ourselves for as long as we wanted at each winery. He also drove us through the actual vineyards and provided a lot of historical background about Santa Ynez.  I honestly would not have changed a thing about our experience. The cost is $120 per person. Totally worth it for the gorgeous views
column7: wine knowledge
column8: lunch
column9: transportation
column10: and of course the copious amounts of incredible wine you will taste!

column1: My only word to the wise: be prepared for a crazy ride! It is quite an experience being in an open-air jeep sailing down the highway and whipping through the mountains. Ladies

column1: 8Pos5Zck0RoRef0K6x8Ryw;y9Z1goRUMW8H9GqBhXp15Q;#NOME?;4;7;6;0;"Can you believe it - I actually had a pleasant experience purchasing my new car from this place?!?!  Now it could be exaggerated by the fact that I had just walked out of Kentwood Ford after telling them where they could respectfully place their pressure 'sales' techniques (and by respectfully place I may or may not mean shove it!!).

I walked in knowing exactly what I wanted and exactly what I wanted to pay for it.  And I walked out with just that - exactly what I wanted for exactly what I wanted to pay - is this real life???  They were straight forward and did everything they could to track down my dream car (which turns out was in BC).  Made sure that I got every deal available (winter tires and rims
column2: a way more than wicked deal on my crappy trade in
column3: and they even gave my dad a referral bonus even though he had only talked to this sales guy once before but had not purchased anything which is typically how the program works).

column1: By the way the referral program is actually not bad - not like 'go-auto' who gives you $500 bucks towards services they offer at their locations - $750.00 (minimum) cash to do whatever you see fit with - like an actual incentive
column2: not ""here's $500 bucks that you can give right back to me when I perform overpriced services on your car in my shops only...blah blah blah.""

column1: In general
column2: I found Rob (the sales guy) and Ashley (the finance lady) to be respectful
column3: straight forward
column4: and fair.  I didn't get the vultures swarming feeling when I walked in which is a plus.  I do have to mention - Rob pulled the best sales technique on me I thought - after we settled on the price I said I needed a few hours to think about everything.  Rob says no problem - here take this other ford focus to drive around while you are thinking - Brilliant Rob!  Since I have huge buyers anxiety this may have been the best way to get me to come back and not just chicken out!

column1: Really impressed by this place - which is saying a lot as I have walked out of countless dealerships where the level of scumbaginess was too over the top!!!  Keep up the great work Sherwood Ford - I know I will be spreading the word!";30/11/2011 17:34

column1: 7kkM2FrmZWbolkLRKLLidQ;eyLMNYTzspRkq2KlF2574Q;6fTsU770S7Pn6cv-ISAmDg;2;0;0;0;"I'll preface this by saying that Chick-fil-a normally knocks it outta the park on service
column2: speed
column3: and quality BUT today was a joke.

column1: I stopped for lunch at 1:30 which makes one think you'd be outside the normal lunch rush/crowd. The drive thru was wrapped around the building. I've seen this often and normally they move the customers very speedily.
I sat still for over 5 minutes so I decided to pull out of the line
column2: park
column3: and go in to get my order to go. As I got in line I noticed the cashiers being friendly with the customers which is great but to carry on a conversation with them while others are waiting to give their orders is not so cool.

column1: Finally I was able to place my order. The young man made some sort of mistake punching it in and had to restart. I waited 5 minutes on my original chicken sandwich combo.
This was certainly not what I expect from Chick-fil-a.";15/05/2010 02:10

column1: LibUnnkP9CneebEo1bN9qQ;Wjia69bHEb7xeWMlxWNPGA;K0phq-z3IfGQg7zd5tFhiQ;5;5;1;2;"I went to a great event here called Cupcakes and Cocktails held by Chef Beth Lukens
column2: who owns and operates the local company Cloud 9 Confections.

column1: Everything about this event was fun.  Just like you see on cooking shows
column2: Beth stood in front of the 3-tiered seating area
column3: with a camera on her
column4: and a camera overhead showing inside the pot she was cooking in.  Beth is an experienced baker
column5: and I loved that in addition to demonstrating how to make the Bourbon Chocolate Pecan cupcake
column6: she also gave us helpful tips for substitutions and shortcuts.

column1: In addition to cupcakes
column2: the event included 3 cocktails
column3: specially designed to compliment the cupcakes we would be taking home.  Pumpkin Prosecco - made of champagne and pureed pumpkin
column4: Hard Apple Cider - made with gin
column5: cider
column6: and fresh crushed grapes
column7: and a Bourbon Cocktail - but after the first two drinks
column8: I have no recollection of what went into this last one.  It was great
column9: though! :-)  Roger
column10: the bartender from the hotel restaurant Élevage
column11: came in each time to explain his concoction
column12: which was really a nice personal touch.

column1: After Beth demonstrated how to make the first cupcake
column2: all the participants went down to group stations where we got to frost our own cupcakes.  She had all the different cupcakes lined up for us
column3: as well as the different bags of frosting.

column1: First we did our own Bourbon Chocolate Pecan cupcake - by scooping out the inside to fill it with pecan filling
column2: then frosting it with a thick bourbon chocolate buttercream
column3: and sprinkling roasted pecans on top.   Next was the Hard Apple Cider cupcakes with cinnamon buttercream.  And finally we did the Pumpkin Spice cupcake
column4: with a sweet cream cheese frosting.  I have to admit
column5: there was a LOT of taste-testing the frosting
column6: even after the cupcakes were all frosted.  Beth even provided plastic cupcake containers
column7: so our 6 masterpieces (2 of each flavor) could travel in safety and comfort.

column1: I would definitely do another event here - it was very well organized
column2: and in addition to the promised take home cupcakes
column3: we were also provided with recipes on how to make the different cupcakes and frosting.

column1: The only thing that wasn't cool
column2: and wasn't mentioned ahead of time
column3: is that you had to pay $5 for valet
column4: which also meant tipping too.  I think the Epicurean Hotel needs to include this in the cost of the class
column5: or let people self-park in the spots they have available for the wine store or bakery.

column1: Other than the parking
column2: an A+ event from start to finish. Support local small businesses and go check out Beth's webpage

oz5A-nHDXjv-h8gzgoHlrw;FDyCP5oAtan0QMCafr-bNA;EvjOPotlf9pXRXzVvN4GaA;1;1;0;0;"I hesitate to review this restaurant
column2: because it now says the place is closed. Just in case they open back up
column3: I want to put a warning out there to all the possible patrons of this place. Spare yourself!

column1: As I browsed over the good reviews I was shocked
column2: as our experience was nothing like what I read. My sister-in-law and brother were moving out of Nashville
column3: and she had a Groupon for this place that needed to be used. It was a Wednesday night
column4: and my boyfriend and I wanted to dine with them. Having been to Anatolia's (which is awesome
column5: by the way)
column6: we knew just where to go. Getting there was simple
column7: but that's where the good part ends.

column1: We arrived
column2: and the restaurant had only two other tables being served. We waited at the host's station for at least five minutes
column3: having the only waitress walk by us then noticing that there was a lady within plain view doing something with the cash register in the bar area. My boyfriend went to ask about seats
column4: and we were told to sit wherever we wanted. She brought us menus a few minutes later
column5: and about ten minutes after that the waitress asked for our drink orders. By then we knew our food order too
column6: so we ordered all at once. About five minutes later we received our drinks (three waters and one tea). We were supposed to get salads before our meal
column7: but after about twenty minutes of no one checking on us or bringing us salads I started get annoyed. Ten minutes after that I was pissed
column8: but my brother and boyfriend talked me into having a sense of humor about the place. So
column9: from then on out I laughed when things went wrong; I ended up laughing a lot.

column1: So
column2: we never got our dinner salads
column3: even though a table of girls who came in 20 minutes after us did. We also never got an appetizer we ordered. We did
column4: however
column5: get greasy garlic bread with our meal. It seemed to be the only thing that was fresh. Our meal came after an entire hour of waiting
column6: and our waitress spouted the most nonsensical babble I've ever heard from an adult. She laughed and made inappropriate jokes to other tables too
column7: calling one room a ""make-out room"" for a middle-aged couple who looked completely embarrassed.

column1: The food was less than average
column2: in my opinion. I had pasta with a vegetable red sauce. To be honest
column3: the horrible experience had totally made my taste buds biased at this point; it would have been the most heavenly food in the world to impress me.

column1: When she asked us if we wanted dessert
column2: I literally laughed and asked for our checks in the nicest way I could. She was obviously oblivious
column3: and after another twenty minutes of waiting on checks we simply handed her our cards as soon as we glanced at the checks. I paid for dinner
column4: as I had been the one to suggest my boyfriend accompany me to this place. There was no way I was going to let him pay for the little less than two hours we spent in this place.

column1: So
column2: heed my warning - do not go to this restaurant if they reopen! Find another Italian place with consistent reviews; no matter what you're guaranteed a better experience than this place.";13/02/2011 15:23

column1: k0OnsHADxf95WmBpgdf6Mw;iEdlKAaZbYJT25nAaSQxkQ;kG4XZT8mm8Ws1FDw0nzVnQ;1;1;0;0;Let me first say that everyone else seemed amazing except for the older woman who did my nails. column4: buffed them down
column5: & without even wiping it off fully she put the color directly on

LPmKRRiU4i82IAnc8sONtg;2fWMTXLNI8me38FTjvLrdQ;JPfe9B-RLrE5Nz75kcKImQ;1;2;1;0;"There are two schools of vegetarian: those that embrace vegetables -- from beans to greens to grains -- and the 'meat substitute' kind.  Lately
column2: restaurants have been trending toward the former
column3: but Govinda's is squarely in the old camp.

column1: Perhaps faux-meet vegetarian can work
column2: but it doesn't at Govinda's.  My ""burger lover's"" wrap contained a soy-based ""meat"" with a pungent after taste.  It was so unappetizing that neither I nor my companion could finish it.  The other dinner
column3: a ""meat""ball sandwich
column4: was at least palatable
column5: but only barely so -- with generous camouflage courtesy the cheese and tomato sauce.

column1: The French fries we shared were greasy and soggy.
(We did eat in the quick-serve area closer to the corner of Broad & South; the dining room was closed for renovations
column2: and perhaps that menu might be different).

column1: Can meat-substitute vegetarian restaurants work?  It has been done successfully -- the Horizons restaurant comes to mind.  But for me
column2: this sort of place gives vegetarianism (and veganism) a bad name.  Implicit in eating here is a sort of compromise: the food tastes weird
column3: and to the degree that it's editable
column4: it's because it's been smothered in cheese
column5: as in each of the items in our order.

column1: Rather
column2: a better (and tastier) model for vegetarianism is to embrace all vegetables
column3: and create delicious dishes
column4: not poor meat substitutes.  Beans
column5: cous-cous
column6: hummus
column7: yellow rice
column8: bell peppers
column9: asparagus
column10: green beans -- all can be ingredients in delicious dishes.

column1: But Govinda's takes the other approach -- vegetables are just along for the ride.  Until restaurants like this one get the message
column2: vegetarians/vegans are doomed to the stereotypes; we're going to have to keep answering the question ""how can you eat that stuff?"" and ""if all you can eat is salads
column3: don't you get hungry?""

column1: So
column2: in sum
column3: the ingredients were reasonably fresh
column4: but the faux meat was revolting.  Go elsewhere.";28/04/2012 13:53

column1: cmUtfeq_drDERR8fjfEWyw;khk-xOwzgLYn0o2u3pwTTQ;UTHAZKeSgEXT_a3eiIo2UQ;4;1;0;0;"After getting a sandwich at the Rubicon Deli

column1: I like the decor and the solid selection of beers on draft. I had a Belgian Wit beer with a slight hint of apple nose. I know it sounded weird enough to me

column1: I shall return

column1: I wanted to try something completely new for me and had the spinach salad which is served with a generous portion of fried oysters on top. Glad I ordered it. It was a taste of the region and quite delicious. Plus
column2: nothing that I would regret when going to bed not-so-much later.

column1: 90 degree weather outside and we had a sick person who could not leave the room. Ridiculous in my opinion.

column1: The staff did seem friendly at first

column1: After consulting the manager

column6: as we were instructed

column1: It was a back and forth battle and eventually we were issued a refund

27FCWzAHuVurRiASQAQeOw;otBEESzGIg-NgDWgQm1q9g;ynvrlgIHGuPaYj9abA35hw;2;2;0;0;"This Steak n Shake is pretty awful.  It's close to work
column2: so a bunch of us who work late have come here on our breaks. Usually the drive-thru is ridiculously slow
column3: and nearly every time our orders are messed up.  A colleague ordered one of the whatever-chocolate milkshakes (dark chocolate? Chocolate fudge? Whatever.) and somehow ended up with strawberry (which she has an allergy to) and banana in it.   I ordered cajun fries and instead of the usual (read: well-mixed and deelicious)
column4: they just put regular fries in the cup and shook some cajun seasoning on the very top ones.    Another colleague paid extra for something (bacon? cheese? I can't remember)
column5: and it was left out. One asked for (I think it was) BBQ sauce at the speaker
column6: and then again asked at the window to be sure
column7: to which the woman snapped ""It's in there!""
column8: and of course it wasn't.

column1: Last weekend I had a craving for one of the Nutella shakes. So
column2: I ran up here on a break. It was all I ordered
column3: they were slow
column4: but somehow I ended up with a cup that was only 2/3 full (the top of the whipped cream didn't even reach the rim of the cup..?!?)
column5: and seemed to be plain vanilla. Since they also just put plain chocolate sauce on top
column6: as opposed to the Nutella drizzle
column7: I had assumed they just screwed it up and gave me some plain vanilla thing
column8: but toward the bottom there was suddenly some weird
column9: watered down Nutella taste with a bunch of ice crystals.

column1: I don't even know. I think at this point we have all given up on even bothering trying ""one more time"". The only reason it got 2 stars instead of 1 is because it sucks
column2: but not quiiiite as much as the Steak n Shake DooDoo Diner on Pendleton Pike.";26/05/2015 08:20

column1: 8RdSA6nslUq8DGIRNEbj7w;tCg24VwUdu31iGoAP0hnew;ChlcxTEoWBQJXJ2Xb2vm5g;3;2;1;2;"Went here for dinner and ordered:

-first bite was excellent but then it tapered off real quick. If I wasn't splitting the meal with my partner

column1: 49D140pHEcqRWiJ7OUpPaA;A9cXP_K95FRor1qxuUEu2g;QTbahs-GVuWYL5yfdjH34A;4;3;1;1;"Have you ever seen that South Park episode called ""Cartman Gets an Anal Probe?""
That's what you can expect if you're a traveler with a disability traveling through Indianapolis International Airport
column2: an otherwise excellent airport that certainly ranks among the nation's better airports in terms of both amenities and service.

column1: It's well known that if you're in a wheelchair and are unable to go through TSA's body scanners that you will experience a full-body pat down.
While I'll admit that I somewhat question this policy
column2: while also acknowledging that someone in a wheelchair is perfectly capable of endangering themselves and others
column3: the truth is that Indianapolis International Airport consistently gives the most intrusive and intimate body checks of any airport I've experienced.

column1: Admittedly
column2: I'm not a frequent traveler.

the employees at Indianapolis International Airport were recognized by Indianapolis's Mayor's Advisory Council on Disability for their efforts at accessibility and in providing accessible transportation to individuals with disabilities.

column1: I don't think they lost any points for their version of ""Invasion of the Butt Scratchers.""
While every airport does a variation of the full body pat down
column2: with one exception I've never experienced the truly intrusive ""pat downs"" that I experience at Indy International. While they offer to take you into a private area to complete the pat down
column3: the simple truth is that even the best agent can't possibly overcome a policy that encourages violating someone dignity in the name of public safety. I mean
column4: yeah
column5: I realize I'm paralyzed and can't feel my rear end but that doesn't mean I'm rushing to blow it up.

column1: I mean
column2: seriously. I'm pretty sure an 8-year-old could do a take down on me if I started acting out.

column1: Other than the overly invasive body searches for individuals with disabilities
column2: Indianapolis International Airport is a beautifully decorated airport with an open concept
column3: nice tech supports including charging stations
column4: and a decent number of restaurants for what I would consider to be a medium-sized airport. The staff
column5: even those sticking their gloved hands up your butt cheeks
column6: are friendly and helpful.

column1: The security is typically fairly quick. They offer nice curbside baggage options
column2: excellent and reasonably priced parking options
column3: and generally have remarkably clean facilities. With only two concourses
column4: Indianapolis International Airport is also easy to maneuver
column5: a fact that makes me wonder why it doesn't serve as more of a connecting airport.

column1: I do rather despise that you have to leave the main floor to pick up baggage
column2: a bit of a hassle
column3: and you have to go from baggage carousel to baggage carousel to figure out which one's applicable to you. However
column4: this is a minor problem for an otherwise top notch airport experience.";21/06/2015 01:05

column1: TU_G4CVa9AfxQuPOD_BgBw;lb_R8cMWxoip-TpajN2EYw;TjAsf2vHEYh_mCHpQqGgDA;5;2;1;1;"This is a really wonderful Italian place.  Upon entering it has an ambiance where in a good way it gets your respect.  There is a lovely hostess to welcome you.
I called in on a late Sunday early evening and sat at the bar with my friends. I had a couple cocktails where the only slip up was the bottle went empty
column2: I got a short pour of bourbon but it didn't ruin anything. That just happens from time to time and something telling me maybe I don't need all that bourbon.

column1: There were family members of the owners at the bar who were great and bought us all a shot of tequila.  You don't get that everyday. He even sang for us and his wife told us a great joke.  I felt really at home here.
I had the scallops entree and they were spot on and prepared perfectly.  The spinach salad was good too. Dessert was great.  As opposed to getting my favorite tiramisu
column2: I opted for the creme brûlée spicy hot chocolate. This was great with 3 blue berry's perfectly placed on the whip cream.  Oh my
column3: it was good.

column1: We felt so welcomed that we left feeling like we were close friends of the family.  I won't write about it here but there's a great back story of how this place came to be years ago that could be a scene out of a movie.
Oh. By the way. This is a place where a lot of care and time goes into your meal and things are not rushed for a good reason.  See the beauty in this.";27/10/2014 03:01

column1: ivclahuE0nhslRwG-qVN-Q;xmc7JP_EwzPRsCo1y7tSSg;m3YaaSd7UFH7f0skHO2ISg;4;4;0;0;"I attended this sunset dinner cruise last night for a friend's birthday. I've never been on a dinner cruise before
column2: so was not sure what to expect. I ended up being surpried as I had a lot of fun.

column1: Pros: Great opportunity to take great photos of the sunset in the bay.
Attentive and friendly staff. They made sure to keep the drinks coming. They always had a smile on their face
Dj on board and he takes request. Great dancing times.
Endless wine
column2: beer and rum punch. Enough said.

column1: Cons: Cheesy and outdated decor (I supose that's part of the charm though).
Not so great food. I found it to be of Golden Corral quality.
Very small bathrooms.
However
column2: if you can overlook the cons and do this with a group of friends
column3: you will have an absolute blast. I loved it and would recommend this to anyone looking for something fun and different to do.";30/08/2015 14:51

column1: goEs5JfFtM2laxLCsmufOQ;cAiF4pN0_oHSnW_O5xdcbA;vpNJJNVgVmf2u1lfdFh81w;5;1;0;1;"My wonderful staff gave me a nice gift certificate to Matyson's

column4: sun chokes and truffles was sublime
column5: and was the one of the best lamb dishes I've ever eaten.  The duck and cornbread that following were also very good
column6: but paled in comparison to that lamb.

column1: Matyson's is now going to be on my restaurant rotation
column2: and the tasting menu (served Mon-Thur) is a defiant go to.  Remember to bring a nice white/rose and red to this BYOB
column3: you won't be disappointed.";14/11/2013 03:46

kNWGZ6IzXhSHrtGNUH77Ew;WBj50KJCMpbqDEVVJflWZQ;YQd-SVdwWiK5-_7S5xwzoA;5;4;4;4;"Mid-city my home sweet home.
Dear Mid-city

I've called you home for 8 years now. I'm raising my kiddos here. But lately I've been worried about you with the influx of non-local businesses. Please stop that. We also need a hardware store since home depot closed. I vote for a locally owned Ace Hardware. We could use some more local food options on Carrollton too. Don't want us turning into a baby metairie y'know.

I'm loving that we now have Swap Meet NOLA. 'bout time we got an art market of sorts. I'm also loving what city park has going on and the Bayou Boogaloo is awesome. I'll even grudgingly throw some love to voodoo
column2: jazz fest and endymion.

column1: Here's to living here a few more years!
Love
-me
P.S. Can we bring the rent prices down though? $1100 for a shitty tiny 2 bedroom 1/2 shotgun is kinda ridiculous.";17/12/2014 19:43

column1: JgHdCiKaA6GUsrXWwyYCuQ;EMjV9Em6CfCQnNJgewt8EQ;3znEsU5ctOr4TCj4t0ng0Q;5;2;0;1;"I relocated to the St Louis area about 2 yrs ago and have had a really hard time finding a quality manicurist.  I had become accustomed to having my nails done by someone who took great care in keeping my natural nails as healthy as possible and painting my nails very nicely.  Since coming to this area I have had many bad experiences while trying to find similar service.  I have literally tried every shop along the main thoroughfare in my area and have had bad experience after bad experience.  The bad service ranges from non-sterilized tools to having a file handed to me when I politely asked to have my toenail filed straight (because it was filed crookedly).  And if that wasn't bad enough
column2: the technician made a scene when I didn't tip her!!

column1: During my search I came across several reviews about Twisted Sisters (many from Groupon or Yelp users) that stated ""is okay"" but ""nothing special"" to quantify the extra cost.  To counter those claims let me just say that they are WORTH EVERY PENNY  if what you are looking for is quality workmanship without the worry of getting a fungus--which is exactly what I've been looking for.

I have had my nails done by all three ladies and they have all done a top-notch job.  I value the time spent getting my nails done because it's ""me"" time and these ladies really add to the experience.  They are all very kind and accommodating.
Masters at what they do.
Clean shop.
Reasonable prices.
Quality products.

column1: ThdEfAsHx-HDPWiN88Mc4w;MQI-K98hhjP6h9XEx5KTUw;CBWmYHLgtFrOJs7SCcQn0g;4;2;0;0;Overall this pizza is really good

column1: TTRiCpedV0WS2FkmbwgAoQ;AEg8EWeSSeNZn294FQ9_Qg;VANS_akAro5kFvvBf9jZPg;5;0;1;0;"In the past
column2: getting good service was a hit or miss at Pepboys.  My recent visit transformed how I view the business
column3: their employees and the services they offer.

column1: Last week I ordered a LED light kit online  (not affiliated with pepboys ). I did a self install and all was fine until the fuse went out.  I visited a local auto competitor and really were no help at all. They told me to just find a video on YouTube
column2: buy some extra bulbs and accessory parts to prevent a future problem with a fuse.  I was more confused walking out of there than when I walked in.  They didn't even bother to show me the specific fuse I needed to do the job.

column1: I went into the local Pepboys on Oracle and the service manager
column2: William
column3: was quick to assist me.  He was able to identify the problem
column4: provide the correct fuse and parts
column5: and even went out to my vehicle and performed the installation himself.  All with minimal cost to me.  Even after one of the lights burnt out without warning
column6: he came back out once again to make sure all was in order and that I was satisfied. I'd go back without any hesitation for any future auto needs.  Thanks again";20/12/2015 19:42

column1: OAIG8WXuuOG2YHt8mxLFGA;bTqyJoiKXSkXXmHRwYASvw;wJvkxHX_KSUwvsoEjrRe-g;5;2;0;0;"Hallelujah!  I love this studio.  This place works if you are a beginner (they have a class to teach the basics) or a seasoned student of Iyengar
column2: far along in your practice.  This is IYENGAR yoga
column3: a Hatha yoga practice whose focus is alignment and strength.  Iyengar is perfect for everyone especially athletes looking to strengthen and enhance their most precious piece of equipment (one's body) as well as those on the opposite end of the spectrum who may be totally non-athletic but want to move their body and increase their chances for a long an healthy life - a life with increased flexibility.

column1: This studio is very low key and unassuming.  The teachers are well trained and have sufficient hours logged in the discipline to qualify to teach you.  I have my favorite teachers but I suggest you take a class from all of them to see who appeals to you.  Iyengar teachers tend to be a bit stern and demand that you LISTEN and are present in your practice.  This can be daunting to some new students but ultimately this is personal preference and you just need to find the Practice yoga teacher that suits you best.

This is NOT a ""power yoga"" studio and while you may sweat you will not be racing through asanas  you're not sure you're doing correctly and getting your heart rate over 150 bpm. While I appreciate that some folks dig this ""style"" of yoga this is not what is practiced here.  But come on and  try holding an asana for a few minutes WITH correct alignment and you'll see the challenge and beauty in this style of practice. And you will certainly break a sweat!";08/10/2012 12:45

h68TFPV1jzdOY_xJlXYtPw;mwRBFkkoJwJ6EyPSXL8LtQ;nFiobSfZqWmoA8LyuVK3vw;5;1;1;0;"Just amazing.
I came here for just a drink at about 8pm on a Monday night.  It was not crowded at all
column2: but there were several tables occupied.  I ordered the most expensive glass of wine I have ever ordered in my life - $22 for a glass of Cabernet Savignon and my companion ordered a scotch on the rocks.

column1: The server was super-friendly
column2: and gave me a nice healthy pour of wine right in front of me.  Magically
column3: a man brought over a little platter with two dishes of snacky stuff - some nutty crunchy mix and cheesestick crackers
column4: which I dug right into (even though I had just eaten a full dinner).

column1: Interestingly
column2: there is a glass of $650 cognac offered for on the menu (which is limited at that time of day to drinks and bar food).  When we asked about it (like
column3: in a way that said who the hell would ever order this $650 item) the waitress brought the bottle over so we could check it out and let me smell the stuff.  It kind of smelt like the stuff I used to steal from the way-back of my parent's liquor cabinet.

column1: Anyway...$48 including tip for two drinks.....but so worth it.  I'll be back for Afternoon Tea soon.";19/05/2009 18:41
1LmOKbm4YrcM1_irui75ew;je08G4XiZIJMV6RCUOoZSg;VNSJ-UxAXoSpi6KhHkj3Rg;2;1;1;1;"Sneddons
column2: Sneddons
column3: Sneddons.  I had hoped this day would never come. I've been coming here since I was a tiny little girl and have now raised my kids coming to Sneddons for a special breakfast that always took me back to my childhood. But now I dont want to come back. And by the looks of the sparsely populated tables
column4: neither do many of other locals who have frequented your business since we were kids.

column1: Why? Sky-high prices and stingy servings.  Took the two kids there last Friday because they were begging for the cottage fries
column2: a Sneddons favorite.  One son got a club sandwich with the cottage fries
column3: the other eggs and pork roll with cottage fries. I got the BLT. I received a BLT- that's it. Tiny plate with two small slices of toasted bread and BLT in the middle.  Not a chip or french fry in sight - $6.99.  Two of us got water and one got a soda.

column1: The bill for the three of us: $32.50 BEFORE tip!!! And I had to go to the register for the privilege of paying for a meal I could have made at home for $4.32. Dont forget they dont take credit cards
column2: so be sure to go to the ATM before you get there. Even worse
column3: the famed cottage fries were burned and looked like they had heated some old ones back up rather than make them fresh for us.

column1: I have been noticing the price of meals out since that shocking breakfast and have noted that I could eat almost anywhere else and gotten a better dining experience at a lower price.
There used to be 4 or 5 waitresses at Sneddons that are like old friends - they knew the whole family by name. But now there are only 2
column2: though still friendly. It used to be a wait to get a table and now we walked right in with only 4 or 5 tables occupied at 9:30 in the morning. I dont think I am the only one noticing that something has changed at Sneddons. But I cant afford to eat there anymore.";04/09/2013 02:13

column1: dKb8kkhUu3Llu_MBY53kgg;39BNR77enXP4BsxynNSb4Q;NLVsIjPW6ungGB4k1QenfQ;4;2;2;1;We went to Joe's Crab Shack for my birthday tonight (Friday night) with our 9 month old son
column2: both sets of our parents
column3: and sister. We made a reservation over the phone
column4: and even received a text confirmation with the time and date. We show up
column5: and we're not in the database! No reservation in the books - wondering how that is even possible when we got a text confirmation? Anyway at this point I was afraid it was all going to go downhill from there
column6: but luckily they had a table and we were sat within ten minutes. It was a really fun atmosphere
column7: especially with a 9 month old (lots of noise
column8: silly dances by the servers
column9: lots of lights and things to see
column10: cute sayings written on the lobster bibs
column11: and they really embarrass the birthday people). Our server Bree was excellent. She even brought my little guy a toy shark afterward - he loved it! The food was great. We had the crab nachos and calamari
column12: both delicious but I would have liked to see more crab meat on the nachos. I ordered Joe's Classic Steampot and really enjoyed it. The prices were reasonable. I am a huge seafood fan so we'll definitely be coming back when I get a crab craving!;13/07/2013 04:13

column1: uFuA9jqO33jfau0W5D7xmQ;KBumVU5v15qLtn6wyCS9bA;me-gE1a7-DRGK9oeuCmbrw;2;0;0;0;Consistently terrible service. A few weeks ago I placed a mobile order consisting of a few cold items from the case and a warm sandwich. The whole point of placing a mobile order is that so you can just run in and grab it quickly. The only thing that they placed on the pick up counter for me was my sandwich(which was hard like they used one this someone didn't pick up instead of making a new one because I was there only a few minutes after placing the order) and my drink. I asked the shift supervisor where the rest of my order was and she said yeah it's in the case just grab it.i have never had a Starbucks make me collect all of my mobile items. Then when I asked for a bag she acted like it was the end of the world. Then today I went to pick up my mobile order through the drive thru because I had a little extra time and when I got to the window they didn't even know what my drink order was.. but they had my food? So? After telling them what my drink was they made it incorrectly not once but TWICE and the girl must have thought I drove away the first time she handed me the drink because she came back tot he window and said sorry for the wait the person in front of you was complaining about everything. The mac and cheese was just ""ok"" Nothing special at all. Can easily make it better at home.
The tea was tea and they refilled our glasses in a timely fashion.
None of our party thought their food was better than Meh.
What really killed me was after eating half my Cubano and giving up on it
column2: they change the specials board and it had lamb on it. Grrr. THAT might have been awesome instead of disappointing.";07/12/2013 02:17

column1: zo-WmIeqrL3h6jo-BYHGvA;Qk3GhBM63PnVgVpJcnbcWQ;OMT709IPPEwN91CAXpe9dw;4;1;0;1;"From the kitschy kitchen showing decorum to the confit
column2: this Modern meets mid-century eatery tastes of class.

column1: Blueberry and sage--Turning Violet is a beverage born of ingenuity and elegance.  I followed it up with some promptly served IPA and the Duck.  Which duck?  Pick any
column2: we tried a lake full.  It falls off the bone in tender pieces of delicious indulgence.

column1: If the description seems sparse it's because the food spoke of its own accord.  The menu changes--I'm talking high frequency--but
column2: if you're a lover of food for its passion
column3: this is the place to dig in.

column1: Try the tour
column2: try the confit
column3: and try the rich desserts.  We tried them all and have hardly a complaint.  If there is any chocolate jalapeno ice-cream hidden in the back
column4: ask (beg)
column5: it's worth the risk.

column1: On the side:  I've adopted the shabby chic bar lighting to work in my living room.  If you're a lover of restaurants for design ideas
column2: DTK +cocktails is a months' worth of inspiring design ideology.

column1: -Fairy Food Father";15/08/2013 15:31

aCS5bDimuj-2DBBAIbE65A;6i7XsIdjmExkLJJ8RggRyg;BHVHpgy8W3rtJTeM2dh6xw;4;0;0;0;"The Chocolate bar impressed me much more this time than I thought it would.
I went there with my wife and with 5 (yes five) kids aged 12-15 after they won their championship drumline competition.
When you walk in the door
column2: you are met with a very modern
column3: sleek and chic interior.  We were greeted by a friendly hostess who said she would be able to accomodate the 7 of us without a problem.  Once seated we decided to split the party up with my wife and I at one table and the kids at another.

column1: I will say that most places would be irritated to have a table full of kids but the waitress was fine and took their order and was very pleasant.  She also took ours - both tables started with the Chocolate fondue.
We did try the pomegranate martini - it tasted good (sweet) and (like acai) but was light on the spirits used.
When the fondue arrived its comes with the melted chocolate as well as an assortment of brownie squares
column2: poundcake
column3: strawberry and banana slices.   While the wife and I ordered the fondue for 2
column4: the kids ordered the one for 3 which was a few dollars more but looked about the same size.   Whatever - we all enjoyed the fondue (it didn't taste like cheap chocolate) and had a good time.

column1: Next up we decided we were hungry since we hadn't had any lunch and asked for their blue cheese chips.  The description sounded amazing
column2: homemade lightly fried chips with blue cheese on top (we love blue cheese).

column1: This where things went downhill as far as quality of this dish.  When the chips came out they weren't quite what we expected.   First off there wasn't any blue cheese to see
column2: after asking about that they told us they were 'tossed' in blue cheese. Um.. OK.  Secondly the chips were all limp and greasy - as far as I can tell the vessel they gave it to us in (a bowl) wasn't fit for the job.  Secondly the chips weren't cooked all the way through and third
column3: as far as I can tell the coagulated cheese on top appeared to have been microwaved.

column1: We mentioned this to our hostess who took care of it and removed it from the bill and apologized and asked if we wanted anything else.

I'm giving 4 stars because the desserts and drinks were very good as well as the service - especially taking care of our complaint without questioning or accusations.   I'm sure we'll come here again and try some other foods.  It is nice to have something at the summit other than bar and italian food.";30/03/2012 13:46

QuESWuSsUYZv5YU0b5cQKA;uX_368iHqGwA1iMDM7iM-Q;1onJyt5MQBGHvQmSlAZqHQ;1;0;0;0;"I do not recommend this service-- AT ALL!  Incompetent. Said the tow truck would arrive in 60-90 minutes because they were busy. Wasn't happy about that but I understand that things get crazy sometimes.  But after two hours of waiting and hearing nothing
column2: I got worried and called to check on it.  The receptionist immediately sounded panicked and said she'd check to see the status.  A few minutes later... ""Oh
column3: sorry
column4: it will be another 45 min because he is coming from Lake Wales after he makes his next drop.""  No
column5: no
column6: no. Lake Wales is a minimum hour drive from my home so he'd be lucky to make it even in 60 min
column7: let alone 45 min.  So
column8: I secured another tow service for immediate pick-up (ugh
column9: wish I had called them all along) and called back to Larsen's to cancel that service. The receptionist said she was confused and kept asking for my location. I would tell her the location again and she would say she was confused
column10: even though I was the one who was truly confused why she wasn't just looking up my reservation under my name!  I eventually convinced her to do just that and I hear her turn to someone next to her and say
column11: ""Ohhhh
column12: the address was under the wrong city."" then comes back on the line and says
column13: ""Sorry about that; we had your address wrong."" OMG
column14: I would have lost my mind if I had waited another 60+ minutes only for them to be in the wrong city looking for my house! Sooooo frustrating because I had confirmed my address (and even spelled out) several times when booking.  Whatever. Glad I got another service and just wanted to share that I do NOT recommend this one.";08/06/2015 17:34

column1: Kc4X41JMYwOQrE2Cs8yz3g;hF2urqIrvz-oWZJrAWULLQ;9BElHCdGOAT2jyXXArTytg;1;5;0;1;"My partner and I stopped in Justin's Carriage House
column2: while traveling down 73 in Skippack.   The building itself is beautiful
column3: and obviously dates back many decades.

column1: Once inside
column2: it was very cramped
column3: and very smokey
column4: as the bar is immediately located inside the door.   Despite this
column5: I was impressed with the menu
column6: it had several of my favorite dishes on it
column7: As I love high quality executions of comfort foods
column8: like steaks and chicken.

column1: I ordered french onion soup and the Chicken Parmigiana with Imported Linguini.   A simple dish
column2: but one that I typically really enjoy.

column1: The French onion soup was ok
column2: but was very dark in color
column3: almost black
column4: including the onions.   It definitely tasted as though the main ingredient was worcestershire sauce.   Not terrible
column5: but a little over-powering.

column1: The chicken parm
column2: however
column3: was the worst I've ever had.   The chicken was very grainy
column4: almost like a flounder texture
column5: but it wasn't fishy tasting.   The imported linguine was so saturated with water
column6: that the sauce didn't even stick to it.   It was mushy and tasteless.   The garlic bread tasted soapy.

column1: I won't detail the men's room
column2: but it rivals that of some dive bars I've visited in the alleys of Philly.

column1: This is the first 1 star review I've given
column2: and I struggled with giving it 2
column3: because I feel bad rating a place so low.  However
column4: the food here was just really terroble
column5: and I ate very little of it.  And that is rare
column6: I'm the type of person that usually eats most of my meal
column7: unless I really cannot stomach it.";18/08/2008 05:25

column1: Q8AHmtGxTRakjZAPI9JqEw;erqEW-3Tyzoi-XJx95BipA;gghwAK740kcnqHeTd5rmIg;1;2;0;0;This review is not for their dry cleaning but for repairs.  Several weeks ago  I took my duvet in for a small repair and cleaning.  I asked them not to clean it unless the small tear was repaired.  Well

column1: WdMf6xUaHQyAul5YmfoZTQ;P-7VidyXqOGd6zBnT85pDA;t4Pg_wMV-SDplEpbnVZtLw;5;5;0;2;"I've always been surprised that this place is where it is. Just seems so random. Then again
column2: its location allows me to hit this place on most Bloomington to Indy runs.

column1: The first time I came here
column2: I was not very impressed. The beer was on the poor side and the food was passable to good. However
column3: I came back. And I come back because both of those aspects have gotten consistently better as I've continued to come back.

column1: Black Swan deliberately changes their recipes to improve their beer
column2: as well as add new beers to the tap list. They have a few standards
column3: but others appear often and rotate frequently. And there a good number of beers on tap as well: usually about ten. And there's always a cider on tap
column4: with occasional guest taps. Casks also appear sometimes
column5: but I've only actually had one once
column6: because they run out so quickly.

column1: What I love about the food is that they make a concerted effort to use both local ingredients and keep everything fresh and healthy. Last time I was in
column2: I had a salad with grilled chicken and cilantro lime dressing. Probably one of the best salads I've had in the state. The dressing just blew me away: you don't get that sort of bold flavor in the Midwest very often.

column1: The best day/night to come is on Tuesday
column2: when they do their $2.50 pint special. The crowd is typically friendly
column3: mostly 30's and 40's
column4: and mostly local to Plainfield or Avon. The bar area is relatively small
column5: with only about ten seats. There are a couple of tables as well
column6: but there's a large dining area behind the bar and a small patio on the other side of the brewing room. Service tends to good (at least in my experience)
column7: but they do get busy on certain nights. Especially Tuesdays.

column1: For what you're getting - for both food and beer - the prices are very reasonable. You can get out for under $10 per person while eating something fresh
column2: of good quality and likely locally-sourced. This place is certainly one of the better options along I-70 west of Indy
column3: and really worth the slight detour if you're at the airport.";15/08/2012 05:29

column1: mFcjUGA_zZJuzavDfz-Jtw;GvMRGz5tV0USZ5i6MKWJyg;h6gEB2JmquKkuirJnrHk3g;4;0;0;0;Interesting food concept. Not exactly Mediterranean or Middle Eastern food. The portions are generous and the food is flavorful.;28/05/2018 22:11
nFCvcSCK3x2VtHb9mBIzhQ;sF11c02GpotsYjEzCgCeuA;Z2ETYcXzj1heNfadJMKO_Q;4;0;0;0;"I have experienced this place in two distinct ways.
1) a basic ""American"" lunch/dinner establishment with nice beer on-tap.
2) An astoundingly creative restaurant that can adequately complement a difficult beer menu.
Let's start by addressing #2: the Founders beer dinner on Jan. 31 was resplendent with creatively prepared animal fat - fried pork belly
column2: grilled halloumi (I'd never heard of this)
column3: goat cheese + salmon sushi
column4: rare duck breast. rare venison - and I'd never encountered such concentrated culinary delight alonside fantastic beer.

column1: But then
column3: the regular menu offers typical sandwiches and salads and meat dishes
column4: devoid of culinary intrigue. This is what I've seen in the past. Average 'em out
column5: and we get
column6: like
column7: 4 stars or something.";01/02/2012 09:20

column1: KfvVhDFCXZJS87NWSllKlw;Xw7ZjaGfr0WNVt6s_5KZfA;TdvI2kA0zslVlFS8a8YuTQ;5;10;5;5;"The sculpture garden at the New Orleans Museum of Art is one of New Orleans' hidden treasures.  Located behind the museum
column2: near City Park
column3: the garden is free to visit and the sculptures are ever changing and when you visit you almost feel as if you are in another world.  There is a body of water that goes through the garden and you can actually go on a gondola ride!

column1: This is a great place to just come and relax and reflect and enjoy the scenery.  It's very quiet and peaceful and I think it would be fantastic to come here after a long day and just walk around or even on a date.

I have been to a few events in the Sculpture Garden over the years and it's a lovely place to have a party. A few years ago I was fortunate enough to see a live production of ""A Midsummer Night's Dream"" and the garden provided the perfect back drop for this particular production. Because this spot is free
column2: it's a great place to enjoy a nice afternoon and just relax.";22/06/2016 21:40

column1: uvqijRRWP1oXPlmaWAQ_Dw;BO-vEt-yHGoGvuGbxjrIxA;KC8_Rx4Orlsz8LIonCYXsA;3;0;0;0;"I ate lunch here after helping friends move. I was starving and exhausted by the time we sat down.
Food- I had the house burger with cheddar cheese. I think based on my level of hunger
column2: this burger tasted like the best burger that I have ever eaten. The other four people in my group also had burgers and it seemed like the group enjoyed their meals. Honestly though
column3: I was so hungry and worn out that almost anything would have been delicious. I had garlic fries as my side and they were also great. I washed it down with one of the house beers. It was a perfect combo.

column1: Service- Eh. Our server was nice
column2: but she wasn't very attentive. I had to ask twice for water. I think she forgot the second time
column3: because it took her nearly fifteen minutes to bring it. When we arrived the place was packed with football fans
column4: but it cleared out within twenty minutes. The hostess also originally sat us at a table partially blocking the main walkway and a server had to arrange to have us moved. A bit chaotic.

column1: Atmosphere- Great for sports fans. Loads of TV's all over the place
column2: which is very distracting if you are not there to watch the game! Once the fans cleared out
column3: they played some obnoxious music. Still though
column4: it was appropriate for the type of place that it is..expect loud and busy.

column1: I would definitely go back here..but since I don't live in SB
column2: I would likely try a new place over heading back.";26/09/2011 07:12

column1: ZFlz3l8uAHbvNm1I1rDVGQ;#NOME?;cAx1ItLmeD10TLCwKG9KRw;1;4;0;0;"Terrible does not even begin to sum my experience with the 901 Convention Center Hertz location.
I rented my car from the Hertz at the airport
column2: location #144013 (see complaint below about this location) but I got a flat tire in the parking structure of this location as I was leaving a trade show at the convention center and leaving  for the airport.

column1: As I rolled in front of the Hertz location
column2: I asked if I could leave my rental at this location because of the flat tire. I offered to pay the change of drop off location fee
column3: but the gentleman said no.  He told us to call customer service. This was all behind a closed door and the door was locked 12 minutes before closing. Yet at that very moment
column4: the gentleman let another customer in to rent a car.

column1: My jaw dropped.

I then went to my car to change the flat tire but I knew this was going to take a while so I went back to the  front door and asked if they could assist us with changing my tire as I had to catch my plane. Please note
column2: I gave myself 2 1/2 hours to get to the airport that was half hour away
column3: I was now done to 2 hours.** As I tapped on the window and saw three Hertz employees
column4: they all ignored us. I knocked again and they proceeded to ignore us.

column1: Lucky a good Samaritan offered to change the tire. Unfortunately
column2: the car that was rented to us by the airport did not have the complete jack set so I could not lift my car AND the wheel nut remover was NO WHERE to be found. I went back to the Hertz office and asked if they had any spare parts
column3: they said
column4: ""We are closed. Call the service number.""

column1: Jaw drop #2.
I proceeded to call the 1-800
column2: which of course had a long wait (19 minutes) but the woman on the phone- who thank goodness was a saint- offered some assistance. 1hr 30 minutes until flight departure. She said to leave the car at the location and a tow truck will be over to help. She asked if I could hand the phone to the attendant at the Hertz to see if I could leave the keys with them.

column1: WITH the rep on the phone and on speaker
column2: I proceed back to the Hertz door and the gentleman
column3: after 3 knocks and stating I had a Hertz rep on the phone
column4: came to open the door. I explained to him that the representative asked us to leave the keys with him
column5: she seconded my response. He said
column6: ""No
column7: you have to wait until the towing company comes.""

column1: Jaw drop #3.
I asked the woman
column2: ""Did you hear that?"" She says
column3: ""Yes
column4: I am so sorry for your experience just leave the keys under the car..."" And the conversation ends.

column1: Despite the fact that this location did not rent the car to us
column2: they were NO help and it was extremely disappointing and frustrating as you are trying to catch a plane. I made it to the airport as my flight was boarding Group 4. I was Group 5.

column1: The Hertz airport location should never have rented this car to begin with. The car told me that the RR (right rear) tire was low and it was actually the FD (front driver) tire was low
column2: AND the darn car did not have the necessary tools to change a flat.

column1: There were FOUR wondering people in this story:
1. The police officer who helped get me help with the change of my tire.
2. The Samaritan who offered to change my tower AND found a jack and nut remover to help (by the way the 4 option nut remover did NOT fit ANY of the nuts)
3. The young man helping direct traffic and flagged us a taxi
And last but not least the woman on the phone from Hertz who unfortunately has to work with a team like the 990 Convention Center Blvd location.";14/11/2013 17:56

6hxFmlF83AAftHycQtbhbg;ZdODEy4O0-nPdPKwkdQkdw;WsOkaCp3l5G8ZHAx0uuTQg;3;1;0;0;"We tried Coyote Blues this past Cinco de Mayo. It wasn't our first choice
column2: but it was less crowded. I had heard positive things about it
column3: but we weren't sure what to expect.

column1: We were told it would be a 40-45 minute wait for 3 people
column2: so we headed to the bar to see if we could wait in there. It was very packed. The bartenders were not very friendly and were more interested in catching the basketball game on the TV. A waitress finally helped us with our drink order and we were  eventually brought 2 drinks instead of the 3 that we ordered. We knew that because it was Cinco de Mayo it would be busy. So
column3: we didn't make an issue of it.

column1: We were seated after about 23-30 minutes. It was a little shorter than expected
column2: so that was good. We were given fresh hot chips with two dips; a salsa and a creamy cilantro and avocado one. Both were loaded with garlic
column3: but fine. We ordered the grilled tilapia tacos
column4: smoked duck tacos and the grilled tuna steak for our entrees. All three were basically good. The tuna steak came with these awesome poblano and corn grits.

column1: Overall
column2: the meal was pretty good. I would come back again. ...Especially for those corn grits.. They were off the hook!";07/05/2013 19:59

column1: 05PmTiHecp_DChKU9JF7Qw;_zBDCYrhs-zZTpbe1ANEtA;qsAZNQ-6P4I9r7onkBZJ_g;4;0;0;0;"Now this is how BBQ should taste in your mouth! And I was full. Two deadly combo --full and tasty. Fuuudge yea! Any who
column2: I came here with family and friends
column3: and we all decided to try different platters (so we can all sample each other plate of foods). The BBQ consist of a Memphis dry rub
column4: and three sauce you can drench it with - go for the spice! go for the spice! The briskets - moist (fatty) - in my opinion - was the best bbq at this place... it just melted in my mouth
column5: the baby back ribs were decent (not over the top - might have been bland a bit)
column6: and the pull pork was pretty good. The only problem I really have at this place was the sides. The sides wasn't ""wham!"" in my face; the mac and cheese was okay and the cole slaw was a little running. However
column7: the German potato salad was pretty good.

column1: Anyway
column2: I really enjoy this place.

column1: * I was torn between giving 3 or 4 stars - but the service pushed my decision to 4 stars - awesome service

LsSB2O5ZYK4yRUy_zHbIWQ;nNlRYWO00FvLVQx9Hp6_dw;arjkq9xxhTjwmncEsXNRmQ;4;4;0;1;"My 115th review of Harrah's Reno!
OK
column2: so after almost a year of boycotting the place due to a sudden huge price spike
column3: it's tentatively back in the Reno weekday rotation. Don't get me wrong
column4: I still think the $10 resort fee is bullshit
column5: but the prices have otherwise cooled off since down to $41-45 on uneventful weeknights after tax and fee. Our little Reno is growing up and getting all Tech Gentrified
column6: and the hotel prices have elevated across the board a little bit such that that price is now on the competitive side again. Espc. if you get upgraded to the West Tower at a ""value room"" price
column7: which seems to happen most of the time if they have a bunch available and you either have some status in the player's club or you flash a Total Rewards Visa at check-in. For the East Tower with its sound-leaky walls and $1.50 Keurig coffee its a bit more questionable value
column8: but I'd take it over Circus Circus at least. Plus you can pop straight downstairs and across the street to Pho 777
column9: which actually is a selling point for me.

column1: To be fair the $10 increase wasn't a 100% complete cash grab. It does get you fitness center access and WiFi (where you had to pay for those separately before)
column2: and at some point in the past year they upgraded the TV selection to about 60 channels too.

column1: Slightly better value for Total Rewards Visa wielders as even at the lowest rate you get $2 back in comps per night thanks to the 5x rewards for spending on anything at Caesars properties. Plus the points for the base price count toward your tier points for the year.";06/11/2015 02:08

column1: 3JkifcOEbWKD3hc2FSQl7w;NyqoJTiKgXi1h7MDJDGbxg;BXXdejmA_rJpMD2MBKCyGA;5;0;0;0;"Now I'm not terribly religious or catholic

column1: Besides the great stonework of the cathedral that is obvious to any person who walks by

column3: starting in 1915 and completed in 1988
column4: containing more than 40 million glass pieces. That's also impressinve.

column2: and finally checked out Revolution. Not only is it a friendly atmosphere with great coffee and treats
column3: but it is also the Factory Workers location that allows members to use the space for crafting such as woodworking
column4: metal working
column5: sewing and ceramics. It used to be the Collingswood theater
column6: so it still has all the original architecture and stage as well. It's beautiful. The space can also be rented out for parties and events. Pretty neat.

column1: The young lady working gave us the tour through the factory to the back where they brew the coffee. A very small space indeed
column2: but it was cool to check out.

column1: A great place to relax and hang out.";01/04/2015 21:07

FmJBDd2zv1SEK3aVltgpEQ;nlQGyti20c07rpTSYYoNZQ;A6R7tIKLHZQL8pnazzX7RA;5;1;0;0;"It doesn't matter whether you're at this park for an event (this is the site for everything from concerts and art fests to 5K races) or just to watch the sun rise... you can't escape the humans!
THINGS TO DO
This isn't a football field kind of park (although there is a baseball field) but it does contain a huge dog park
column2: tennis courts
column3: pool and small playground) the main attraction is the long
column4: wide sidewalk and beach (yes a beach! With SAND and volleyball net and swimming!)

column1: APPEARANCE

This place is clean. You can't even tell events have taken place there because the trash gets picked up instantly. Plus the view of the Bay makes this a great place to relax. Even the water welcomes swimming--no fertilizer mucky water here. You'll see many people standing in the shallow water trying to catch crab or fish.
AMENITIES

There are a few free parking lots nearby (although when events take place they sometimes convert to paid parking--so park in the streets of the nearby neighborhoods) I only know of a one-stall bathroom for this place (I'm sure there's more but I haven't found them. It's only a 5 minute walk into the actual Downtown St. Pete.";07/05/2013 03:20

column1: KzgVAduK82885WOQ2nHT0g;z-rEVRRRn_-hdrNNPRNcyA;IZJacI6XEUxy3_wbW76Qfw;1;1;0;0;"After a 25 minute wait
column2: we were seated next to a bathroom
column3: which also happened to be next to the waiter's station.  So
column4: one would think that the service would have been excellent
column5: but this was not the case.  We were immediately encouraged to forgo live wait service by using an order system on the table that claimed to provide fast delivery of appetizers and dessert.  This computer screen stared us in the face through the entire meal
column6: encouraging us to order extras.   We used this for dessert
column7: but found that delivery was taking so long that we had to flag down a waiter who snapped ""it's coming"" without even checking.  Wait staff was extremely impatient with any interruptions and requests
column8: delivery of food took a long time
column9: and the food was only so-so.  My dinner arrived first
column10: and was served as an appetizer to the entire table (even though I had clearly stated this was my dinner when I ordered).   My son was asked by an expeditor if he wanted a refill on his root beer
column11: which we later learned added $2.50 to the tab.  Finally
column12: despite my protests and the treatment clearly given to other customers
column13: I was forced to pay my tab through a third party vendor service at the table

column1: We next ordered dinner and all  three of us ordered burgers

column6: the meal was much better on our first visit
column7: the fries were crispy and tasty
column8: not soaked in grease.

column1: The other disappointing part of the night is solely the responsibility of the wait staff.  When a waitress brought out the appetizer
column2: she very nearly threw the plate down on the table and almost spilled two drinks and walked away without saying anything or even asking who was getting the appetizer.  A bad night for her maybe?  We also had very so-so service from our main waiter.  At various times throughout the meal we ran out of drinks
column3: didn't get extra napkins and at the end of the dinner
column4: he brought us the wrong bill.

column1: It was such a complete turnaround from the first visit which was five star in every way possible

column1: tX8TMPDyllPQ-eAOxkdP_w;uUrpYFU-D-U76NRv5aVDdw;iC8FqRlWXqdV35kFX6Hlig;3;4;3;2;"Brazilians deserve their own reviews
column2: because it's a very personal treatment that is not specific to the spa or salon
column3: but to the aesthetician that performs them. And frankly
column4: one recommendation is not enough. Too many ladies settle for their first or second experience
column5: and I want it as comfortable and clean as I can find. That being said
column6: this review is for the spa - specifically the Brazilian side of my experience here.

column1: First off
column2: Pagave is a great salon up on 202 in a quaint shopping center off of the interstage. Easy location - easy to find. I got to my appointment early
column3: so I had time to browse the cute jewelry selection they have in the waiting area. I ended up purchasing a pair of gold earrings for New Years.

column1: The waiting area is SO comfortable. Comfy couches
column2: up-to-date magazines
column3: plenty of retail items to browse. The front desk service was mediocre
column4: honestly. It took them a minute to acknowledge me
column5: and I was trying to be friendly and didn't get any personality back. At the end of my service
column6: I had to put my tip in a box and couldn't even find my aestheticians box at first. It was weird. Whatever... That's the only reason there isn't a fifth star
column7: but based on other reviews
column8: it doesn't seem like they care about that part. On to the important stuff: The service itself.

column1: I'm downright picky about how who I recommend for Brazilian waxing. It seems I've made a habit of trying out places just so I can compare techniques to others. I was out of town and without contact info for my last local aesthetician
column2: so I poked around difference websites before deciding on Erin at Pagave for my next Brazilian.

column1: I was first impressed that there was no Enya music. Forget that shiz-nit. I was so glad to hear some rock music playing softly in the background. While I probably would've preferred she leave the room while I changed
column2: she was very chill and professional
column3: so it wasn't a big deal. After all
column4: she would be giving me the most intimate treatment available (at a licensed
column5: reputable salon).

column1: With Erin
column2: it's fast and clean. I read that she is a speed-waxer that could provide a 10-minute Brazilian
column3: which I was originally skeptic about in terms of pain and thoroughness. And while it might not have been exactly ten-minutes
column4: it was darn-well fast and way less-painful than any other Brazilian I have ever gotten. She talked me through exactly what I wanted and in no time
column5: I was out the door. I was sore for the rest of the evening
column6: which really brought me down. I've never been this sore before! She's a good conversationalist
column7: though. We chatted about this and that; she is a pretty cool girl. Definitely one of the best that I have experienced.

column1: Iffy front desk
Great waiting area
Quality products
Cozy but sophisticated atmosphere";14/02/2011 06:08

column1: 6fIXk1WAT89n3VjCFAspKw;KP_QjZrrMUTqDNU8yuWPng;9e_oT4olPUsUDgqNsCGghQ;1;3;4;0;"The manager of this place that I encountered is an officious ass and is clearly unsuited to being in a customer service role.
This place is right beside the City Centre theatre
column2: so a friend and I popped in there after catching a film. At the front entrance there was a sign indicating ""please wait to be seated"" so initially we did just that. There was just one family waiting in front of us. The place was clearly pretty dead; at least half of the tables were empty.

column1: We waited several minutes without any sign of any staff members
column2: and several people just walked past us and right in to the pub. Eventually I said ""the hell with this"" and my friend and I walked in and sat at one of several open tables. We were legitimately confused about whether we were supposed to wait or just walk in given the lack of responsiveness of staff and the behaviour of other customers.

column1: A moment later
column2: a man who appeared to be a manager walked over to our table with the family that had been waiting at the front in front of us
column3: and told us that those people were in front of us and he was giving them that table. This was totally understandable and we moved without complaint and sat at a different open table.

column1: A server came up to us and
column2: to her credit
column3: she was friendly and tried to be helpful. She asked if we'd been helped
column4: we briefly summarized the situation
column5: and she said she'd be happy to settle us in. The manager then walked over
column6: told her not to help us
column7: inexplicably claimed there was a wait list in spite of the fact that the place was very obviously not busy
column8: and ordered us to go wait at the back of the line at the front (behind people who arrived after us
column9: since the only people who arrived before us and had the patience to wait had already been seated) with a passive-aggressive ""if you don't mind"" thrown in. I replied ""actually
column10: I do mind
column11: since we waited several minutes there without service
column12: several people walked straight past us and seated themselves
column13: and clearly half the tables around us are available."" I explicitly told him we were willing to sit at any table that was convenient
column14: that multiple people had just walked in and singling us out was totally arbitrary
column15: and that the server had already offered to help us and resolve the situation immediately so I failed to see the problem.

column1: His response
column2: in a wannabe tough guy tone
column3: was that there were plenty of other pubs in the area and that I was welcome to go to them instead. I said that we certainly would
column4: and we left.

column1: Kudos to the server; I feel bad that she has to work for a guy that clearly revels in creating and escalating conflict with would be customers. The only good thing I can say about the manager is that his suggestion that we go somewhere that provided better service than he did was very sensible!";21/12/2015 03:14

column4: curt manner that ""I guess I'm not hearing anything!"" Os something to that effect.

column1: I am the most accepting person but her tone and repeated rudeness was enough and I decided to ask for the manager. I went to the bar and asked the lady working there to see the manager.  She said she would get him and I returned to my table.  My waitress came with a phone number written on a napkin and said the manager was not in but here was the number.  My friend decided to call and it ended up the number was foe a taxi company.  When confronted
column2: the two said it was an accident they gave us the wrong number!

column1: My waitress came to speak to me as did one other waitress to explain that we must have misunderstood the situation!!  I must say emphatically I misunderstood nothing!
My point is to say
column2: don't ever accept rudeness! I don't know what the problem was but it was not my problem the lady was evidently having a bad day and the manager was nowhere around.

column1: As to the food
column2: it was the best steak I've had there in a very long time!  It was moist and cooked the way I wanted it where in the past it was frequently excessively raw or cooked to the dryness and texture of old cardboard!  In all the years I've visited the restaurant
column3: usually because friends wanted to go there
column4: within the past year I've noticed the staff getting less customer friendly and the food quality going down!

column1: I hope other visitors will review their experiences
column2: and I hope my experience was an isolated one.  My visit was on May 28
column3: 2013 at about 5PM.  The rating is for the overall experience.";29/05/2013 01:17
