column1: nt3p3X9oMT4PCP1eeKjZ_A;uaYajVEqrZNFQUonfmukAQ;qsLVHCPvRkDX2sQdQM-RDQ;2;6;0;2;"I don't like giving this new place a 2 just for the record.  I am definitely going to return after they have been open for more time in hopes to chance this review.  I wanted to get that out in the open.

I went today it's a Saturday around for there were two full tables inside.  I am thinking that was a good sign.  There was even a man cleaning the windows.  I was greeted immediately.  The staff was extremely friendly.  The price I thought was steep for the amount of food I got.  I may have reconsidered had I known the price as it wasn't posted.  Again they are new so I completely understand.  I did carry out oxtails
column2: cabbage
column3: rice and beans.  I also grabbed a kola and my total was $16 and some change.  My food was bagged and I was out the door in about 5 min.

column1: There wasn't much meat on the oxtails.  It was very tasty though.  The cabbage had carrots
column2: peas
column3: corn
column4: and green beans in it and it was bland no flavor at all.  The rice and beans was normal nothing special.  I asked for a large and not a regular and only got 3.5 actual oxtails.  I expected more.  I will return hopefully my review will change for the better because this place is really close to me.";15/01/2017 00:29

column1: xEYO1xzo_aUVSbru6j61bw;cO0sWpjjSyIqngT2U4oZ9Q;_OgwyI_0mGs620_ZfKgzbg;2;5;1;2;"Ok I know my review is going to go against the grain. But having lived in a place where latin food (Cuban
column2: Colombian
column3: Peruvian
column4: Venezuelan
column5: etc) is the staple
column6: Tierra Colombian comes up short in so many ways.

column1: They offer Colombian and Cuban cuisine. It may well be the ""best Colombian and Cuban food you will find in Philadelphia
column2: but that doesn't mean it is good.

column1: The beef dishes were tough and tasteless. The fish was overcooked and dry. The Churrasco...PLEASE! And worst of all
column2: the pork had no flavor at all!

column1: In Miami this place would be a definite pass it by. Although the desserts were fairly good across the board. Try nearby El Balconcito
column2: or Sazon on Spring Garden
column3: for latin food done better. But I'm still in search of good Cuban in Philly. Forward any suggestions.

column1: I haven't been to the nightclub portion of this place

column3: it goes beyond description. Rats ate through our food on kitchen counters. Rat feces under

column1: And even after all of this

column1: KeazIblAKGMxz_vFudJ0JA;L3r7vRzFqfADMj12UrNHOw;pWpi_cCH8IxwWy7pRmtq2w;5;1;0;0;"My husband and I just ate at Nomzilla for the first time and loved it! There was a groupon available so we decided to try something new. The employees were very friendly and helpful in making our selections
column2: and the food came out fast.

column1: We both had the crunchy shrimp roll

column1: We also both thought the decor was cool and different then the typical sushi place.";29/12/2013 03:11

kxpx0X0YZgBTfpR_gDS9QQ;dD7LfCRuN0EXTmpkocnuaQ;o4IiNbNybcy-L4vzTSoDJw;2;1;0;0;"Quite disappointed to be honest. Partly because my expectations were probably set too high because of my extended experience with Italian food and people.
Upon arrival
column2: the place was packed. Not just packed as in 'full house' but packed as in 'if you were to push in one more person
column3: the place would burst at the seems'. Tables are so close to each other that you are almost sitting on top of each other. Waiters kept knocking down my jacket trying to squeeze through and you could easily grab a bite from your neighbor's plate while you were waiting.

column1: Food-wise there were no highlights. The free bread was cold
column2: straight out of the fridge. This takes away from the authenticity and makes it feel cheap. Putting it in an oven for 2 minutes would not kill you and creates a fresher (literally) start to an evening. I had the penne with ""smoked"" salmon which was actually cooked salmon and my husband had the rosemary salmon. Presentation was less impressive than if I would have made it myself at home and same goes for taste. Portions were European
column3: so smaller than Americans are used to. The tiramisu was OK although again a very small portion and presentation/taste were not making any lasting impressions.

column1: Service-wise we definitely did not feel special. Rather
column2: we felt like we were on a time clock. They couldn't wait to sweep you out so they could get the next person in. ""Done with your food? Here's the bill."" No special attention or smalltalk whatsoever. Also
column3: it did not feel like an Italian restaurant. It just felt like a cafeteria serving Italian-like meals.

column1: To conclude
column2: the pricing (although not that high) does not equate the food and service quality you receive and I would definitely not recommend this place if you are looking to have a more private or romantic dinner. Honestly feel bad I wasted my time here.";04/12/2016 03:29

column2: but getting someone to come and refill is a joke. I added up the minutes from each of the 4 times I pushed the call button and it was a total of 40 minutes before someone came. It made it worse because the attendant acted like I'm not supposed to ask for this and it's a hassle for them to get a refill. It's your job

column1: IVDNoXQh4VksKGzPOCT4rA;UyOY0Wdh1f99oFWWh2SOjA;2trMFZ3slXjccVumyvLF-w;4;1;0;0;"Man
column2: the first thing that caught my eye as the driver dropped us at our Tremé apartment was Hank's up on the next corner. True
column3: classic hole-in-the-wall dive. Whatever they made
column4: I had to have me some. So much that it detoured us from our mission to Li'l Dizzy's around the corner. Alas
column5: not open at 1:30 in the afternoon. That gave me time to Yelp it and learn that the day you really want to eat here is Thursday when they make the seafood baked potatoes.

column1: Everybody else wanted Italian on Thursday
column2: so I decided to get a couple of those potatoes to go for later. 6:00 I go in there and the joint is hoppin'!  R&B music we could hear 2 doors down
column3: folks spilling out onto the corner to smoke and drink. It's a true
column4: blessed hole in the wall-concrete floor
column5: dark walls
column6: ceiling painted black except for the pieces of particle board stuck up there for some reason. You order your food at the window in the back and have a seat while a server bags up orders
column7: hunts you down and collects your money; I don't know how she kept everybody straight
column8: but she did.

column1: A potato with seafood and crab meat is $12 with tax
column2: and one would make a light meal or big side for two people. The potatoes are cooked just right
column3: covered with shrimp and crabmeat in an étouffée-like sauce with a delayed afterburn that's not overwhelming. I loved it! They also have fried fish and chicken
column4: and some other items I didn't pay attention to because I only had eyes for the potatoes.";11/06/2016 21:08

column1: aOW62aMji-1yF8Y_jfDwVA;w4BiBncdzxNed_PLV-b1VQ;9GdGe93oLy8MTtmEsfmgEg;4;1;0;0;"Went to Sanctuaria for the 3rd time last night and continue to be impressed!  Their cocktail creativity is stunning.  Their beer selection is as well.  I think the best value for the taste beer-wise is the Black Butte Porter
column2: 22 oz of excellence for $9.

column1: Their tapas have a huge variety of flavors.  Every time we've gone
column2: we pick 3 and then I pick the 3 I'm going to order the next time.  Our all time favorites are their poppers stuffed with goat cheese served with a wonderful green devil sauce that we end up dipping everything into and the stuffed eggplant which has a spicy tomato sauce that is not kidding around.

column1: There've been a couple that we felt missed the mark on flavor (the Tostones and a potato dish that I can't recall the name of)
column2: so I'm keeping the rating at 4 instead of 5.  But on the whole I am excited to continue exploring their menu and already have my next orders picked out!

column1: Their desserts are excellent as well.  The first time we went
column2: we got the Banana Rum Cheesecake and it was delightful.  Last night we put in an order for the Havana Bread
column3: which they have a 20 minute wait warning on the menu.  We had plenty of drink left so that was no big deal.  When it arrived
column4: the aroma was amazing.  I highly highly highly recommend the Havana Bread.  Your taste buds will thank me.  As amazing as it smelled
column5: the taste was downright sexual.

column1: Have to also put a shout out to the very friendly and helpful staff.  The bartenders will chat away with you if they are not too busy.  It's fun to sit at the bar and watch them create the cocktails.  Also a very fun and artistic decor
column2: great place for a date.";28/04/2012 16:00

WB8J29tbpHK8xYp7dj0N8g;niyWxHK9V1JQjGEhmNr2jg;JGueVoNa1JFywVdeHtcHug;1;1;2;0;"To be fair we booked this room because it is located inside the French quarters. Right off canal street.
Pros: location
column2: Staff was friendly
column3: valet quick with about 15 minute advance call
column4: AC works
column5: bar and restaurant downstairs
column6: artistic feel with Art Gallerie next to lobby. All these pros do not out weigh the cons this hotel has to offer at $161 a night. $45 a day for vallet.

column1: Cons for location:
Due to location you will hear every conversation on the sidewalks
column2: cars with loud mufflers racing down the street
column3: the garbage man
column4: the delivery guy
column5: the loud music from cars
column6: the garage filled with cars with owners hitting the horn to locate their cars all night
column7: cars and motorcycles with loud music and loud mufflers doing burnouts all night

column1: Cons for the hotel public access:
Floors were sticky through out our stay
column2: elevator floor was sticky
column3: elevator was not clean
column4: carpet on all the hallways were not leveled and prupose a trip hazard to everyone
column5: carpet in hallway poorly installed as the entire building is not leveled.

column1: Cons for the Room:
We were given 218 second floor. When asked by my wife about personal safes inside the room the gentleman lied about the ongoing installation not making it from the 3rd floor to the second floor yet.
Yes the building is old
column2: yes it has recently been remodeled but
column3: who ever completed the repairs and refurbishing of this hotel along with the people hired to manage the hotel along with managing contractors should be terminated for a crappy job.

column1: House keeping non existing.
The rooms are poorly refurbished as open wall outlets with wires showing are very dangerous as you will see in my pictures.
The room floor was sticky like folks before us partied on it so we made sure not to walk bare foot in our room
The windows are dirty and have never been cleaned as you cannot see outside clearly
The TV has no remote and does not turn on.
The shower and tub was Janky and not cleaned when we arrived as it had hair from its last tenants all over it.
The toilet well
column2: it never turned off after flushing as we hear the toilet run all night.

column1: Speaking of the toilet
column2: it never flushed properly so of course it finally got clogged. I was able to shut the water off. We called the front desk and the guy handed us a plunger at first.....

column1: I was appalled by the actions of the man but with my wife insisting he reluctantly gave it his best.
As shown in my pictures the toilet over flowed the man insisted in turning the water back on and flushed the clogged toilet himself and flooded the bathroom.
He then offered to move us to an ""upgraded room""
On the third floor.
As the man walked out from the bathroom with plunger on hand as it drips all over the room floor my wife recommends that he not spread e-coli all over the room.
The man advises us to pack our stuff as he gets us another room.
Cons for Room 306
Next to parking garage and you will not get any sleep from either the cars or the busy alley below.
The TV was plugged into a stapled extension cord.
The lamp shade was damaged and old.
The window was filthy.
The bathroom sink from Homedepot.
The toilet was smaller and not better when flushing.
The carpet condition was yucky
column2: wear shoes also.

column1: The Tv work but only 1 channel.
TV remote on/off volume only.
As you can already tell we were not happy being in this hotel as we did our best to make the best out of our current temporary living arrangements.
My advise is if you are looking for a new clean quiet  hotel look outside the French quarters.
If you want location and don't mind all the cons then yes this hotel might be for you.
But
column2: just like all vacations you are gonna end up walking all over so you might as well get a hotel that your dollars gets the most for your bang.

column1: As I would never stay or recommend this hotel to anyone I personally know.";27/03/2017 14:01

column1: CGBOukokYuLEkWPJ4LgiMg;SBi0TYUSIrct8WSTyK6DFg;MUulT4nQqWBKuq0ZX2UZtg;5;4;1;0;"Absolutely loved my stay at the Hyatt House for a girls' weekend in NOLA. From the beginning of our stay at check-in
column2: the staff was so welcoming and friendly. They truly went above and beyond and even upgraded our room to one on the top floor. Anghelique was a true gem and helped us out multiple times during our stay.

column1: The hotel is set up a little differently than most
column2: in that
column3: you have to take an elevator immediately up to another level to check-in (floor 11). The check-in area is a brightly-colored
column4: modern space that also provides complimentary fruit-infused water. On the same floor is also the breakfast area which is quite spacious.

column1: Once we got to our room
column2: we had a prime view of the superdome and pool area. Our room had two Queen sized beds with a large TV
column3: desk
column4: and a little seating nook. The bathroom had a large glass enclosed shower.

column1: The breakfast area and daily spread was a delightful surprise. The hotel provides free breakfast so I was expecting the typical sad array of bagels
column2: muffins
column3: and oatmeal. Hyatt House truly outperformed day after day with their breakfast. First of all
column4: everything is laid out in an aesthically-pleasing way. All of the juices are in glass pitchers
column5: all-white plates and coffee mugs. These are details that I appreciate. There is a made-to-order omelet bar where you place your order via pencil and paper and leave it with the cooks. There's a cereal box display of your usual options
column6: breakfast meats that vary consisting of bacon
column7: link sausage
column8: scrambled eggs (I wasn't fan of the scrambled eggs - too watery)
column9: pancakes
column10: oatmeal and grits
column11: bagels
column12: bread
column13: fruit. As well as coffee and tea options. I can't stress how much the spread impressed us daily. There's also a crew that help keeps the area clean and everything refilled.

column1: As for location of the hotel
column2: it's located near all of the hot spots. Ten minute walk to Bourbon St
column3: Jackson Square. Five minute walk to Canal st. There's also a trolley stop about twenty feet from the hotel that will take you up and down Canal
column4: to the Garden district
column5: etc.

column1: The parking situation is something that we
column2: thankfully
column3: didn't have to deal with. We relied on our legs and uber. I do know that there's no designated parking garage for the hotel and that a valet service is available
column4: however
column5: I did notice a night or two where they had a sign out stating valet wasn't available so I would imagine that could/would cause issues.

column1: If you ever find yourself in NOLA
column2: I highly recommend the Hyatt House!";18/09/2016 20:27

column6: and identically even

column10: eyelash extensions
column11: facials

column13: which I'm excited to try. :)

column1: EDITED on 2/12/12: I now understand the review of DC
column2: who said that they aren't very friendly. After a couple more visits I decided to try the individual eyelashes
column3: and I was really disappointed.

column1: When she led me into the treatment room
column2: nothing was set up and her children's coats and backpacks were all over the table I was supposed to lay on. She just sort of moved everything out of the way onto the floor
column3: had me lay down
column4: and didn't even turn on the lights while she applied the lashes. I could have forgiven all of this is she did a good job

column6: and they started coming off in clumps before I even got on the train. The next morning I woke up and huge areas were missing
column7: I looked completely crazy and had to go through the painstaking process of removal with baby oil (kind of painful
column8: btw). She used WAY too much glue
column9: I don't think anyone has ever shown her the proper way to apply these. I called and she said I would get a credit (the treatment was $25) and when I came back in (with a friend!) she was kind of unpleasant to both of us and ended up only giving me a $15 credit.

column1: I am so bummed because when I first started going I was elated at how fast she was
column2: what a good job she did
column3: and her prices
column4: but now I'm starting to see that she's letting herself get stretched too thin. She shouldn't offer most of the other treatments because she clearly doesn't have time for them
column5: she should stick to manis
column6: pedis
column7: and eyebrow waxes IMO. I think she doesn't have enough help
column8: so she has to rush through manis and leave other people waiting
column9: and the quality of work has gone down plus customers are less satisfied (there was a woman getting a pedi when I came in
column10: and she was soaking her feet and waiting the WHOLE time while my friend and I got our manis. I felt bad
column11: she seemed really abandoned. The prices are good
column12: but they ain't THAT good
column13: I still want service).

column1: PCGS619Jm8BrLpkKSYIYSQ;t1klseTOhjGH6XAPdQ1J0A;zFcE7bQ2oDfwpPgl_PxOTA;5;0;0;0;"This is my all time favorite restaurant in the Tampa Bay area!  I go there with my parents almost every time I go down to Florida to visit them.  We love to celebrate special occaisions here because everything about this place (food
column2: service and atmosphere) is top notch.

column1: The seafood is amazing and fresh.  The chefs really know what they are doing here.  You will not be disappointed!
The staff is super friendly and attentive.  Many of the waitstaff have been there for several years
column2: so they are professionals.

column1: The atmosphere cannot be beat.  If you can
column2: make your reservations well in advance and request a table near the windows that overlook the bay - you can't beat the view at sunset (once when I was there
column3: we witnessed an amazing thunderstorm out over the water)!  Most of the tables offer a lovely view
column4: but the best seats in the house are nearest to the windows.

column1: I highly recommend this place for Mother's Day brunch as well - we've done that 2 years in a row now and they truly offer the most amazingly fresh and extensive brunch I've ever seen offered anywhere.
This place has been and will surely remain for many years to come
column2: my favorite restaurant in Tampa...a true gem amidst a sea of endless chain restaurants that dot the landscape of the Tampa Bay area.";21/05/2007 20:48

column1: CWTupAZF_RJjVAlqbWFlIQ;mjt5940XS2QW5_qLC0T5Bw;c6fWBSm-EHVwyFszTC5Mhw;2;0;0;0;I think we came on a bad kitchen day. Our first time did not match the 4 star rating on yelp and we probably should read reviews. Mac and cheese was overly flavored with truffle oil and disappointing
column2: breakfast sandwich was bland even though it was hot
column3: which was odd. The potatoes it came with were cold and only warm in some spots
column4: and texture was like they had been sitting for awhile. We also ordered the burrata heirloom salad...tomatoes were unimpressive flavor and hard like they were not ripe. We paid 4 star prices for 2 star food. Service and ambience were fine.;11/02/2018 02:57

column1: Q-vPPB-eFpkhtxpe0vVZSw;2fUd0WEE_rEokmz148w2Zw;a62d7e_xXeljJcOUHkJjkg;5;0;0;1;"I decided to try circles because it had such good reviews and I was craving pad Thai. I ordered the Crab Padthai and it was soooooo yummy. At $18

column4: large chunks everywhere. The pad Thai sauce was amazing and it was a good portion overall.

column1: I ordered for pick up and they were so quick! They told me 10 minutes so I left my house right after ordering. When I got there
column2: my order was all ready to go! It was quick and easy and the staff there were very polite
column3: both on the phone and in person. Although the crab pad Thai was all I tried this time

column1: R9wSQ-94slOiQ5ElXFkkUA;qQY_PejzwYQiOG-CaD0jRw;78xyCRB5MUebdAhhNR9qTw;3;0;0;0;"My break down of Claddagh Irish Pub:
Atmosphere: It's spacious
column2: clean
column3: and pleasant. I like that the tables are spread out so that you have lots of room.

column1: Service: Good. We walked in and were soon greeted by the gentleman behind the bar. He said someone would be right with us
column2: but it worked out that he sat us. Our server was a nice woman. Very attentive
column3: and polite. Not pushy nor forgetful. So that's nice.

column1: Food: Here's the rub. We went on a Monday night so my friend and I got the buy one get one on the Fish & Chips special. Good deal. For $1.99 more (apiece) we could add a soup or salad. Both of us got Clam Chowder. I don't like soup
column2: except for Clam Chowder. But I shouldn't have assumed that would mean New England Clam Chowder
column3: as I am originally from N.E. and that's all that exists to me. This was either Manhattan style
column4: or pretty similar. I'm not sure what's typical for Irish places
column5: but I was bummed to not get New England style. So we both ate about half by the time our Fish & Chips arrived and were ready to be done with it. The Fish & Chips looked great. And the chips were interesting as they appeared to be homemade
column6: so props for that. Unfortunately I wasn't really a fan of the chips. And the fish looked great
column7: but it just didn't seem to have any taste to it. I'm not sure if I'm just used to a more fried flavor
column8: or salty taste
column9: but this just seemed tasteless.";28/05/2013 22:44

column11: I've also gotten cheaper - just wait

We ordered the crab spinach dip to start and what looked like would be a decent serving because of the size of the dish ended up being like 4 TBS of dip with more crostini than there was dip for. OK I get it if you are trying to cut costs...but add a little more spinach so peeps don't feel like they are getting hosed on the price.

I had the tortellini with chicken and it was just OK...the chicken I feel like should have been prepped differently instead of a few sparing chunks thrown in. The serving size was decent and I took the rest home

column3: and my orders were taken with attention to accuracy. The price on a basic char burger is only about $3.75 plus extra for cheese and bacon. You can get a double char
column4: which is what I did the first time at the Milpas property
column5: it's the same thing only it has 2 beef patties. To me the single char
column6: which I had at the State St location
column7: is just about perfect unless you really love meat.aAt the Milpas location I had the steak sandwich. I like the burger much better. The steak sandwich is a good size but is not trimmed of all the gristle
column8: and I don't like gristle. I had to pick it out.

column1: The milk shakes are fantastic
column2: nice an thick and full of flavor. My friends had the Albacore Tuna sandwich which was good and about the same size as the steak sandwich
column3: the Cobb salad which was large enough for 2
column4: and the grilled chicken sandwich. All were enthusiastically eaten and they had no complaints.

column1: The Milpas location was a great place to eat
column2: but plan on spending about 10 bucks per person by he time you add in fries and a drink. The State St locations food was just as good
column3: but there were a lot of flies outside; I think it was because of the shade. It looked nice and clean just like the Milpas location
column4: but I found the flies bothersome. No flies at either trip to the Milpas location.";09/09/2017 15:38

I really don't get Midwesterners.....this place was basically empty...while there was a huge line in the driveup of the fast food restaurant ?  Why anybody would eat that artery clogging crap...and miss out on a delicious and primarily vegetarian meal is beyond my limited intelligence and understanding.

column1: YYHZc69AGpF0OcIoBXCKhw;5iuLx3_sSyXz3GXXsgERcg;ChlcxTEoWBQJXJ2Xb2vm5g;3;0;0;0;"Ah
column2: a tale of two experiences.  Unfortunately it was the weekend of LSU v. Florida and town was overrun with Gators fans.  We were seated very late and the restaurant looked like a drunken good ol' boy fraternity reunion.  By this i mean it was loud!!!!  I asked my waiter if it was always this loud or were most of the other tables in fact screaming.  He said it was the latter
column3: but didn't do a damn thing about it.  Oh well
column4: i chose not to leave so . . .

column1: On to the food.  For two we ordered Wood Roasted Oysters
column2: Duck Confit Pizza with Fried Egg
column3: Mussels in Chardonnay Broth
column4: Goat Cheese-strawberry salad
column5: and side of Cheddar Grits.  The waiter and I spoke about how to bring the food out and then to my surprise it all arrived at once.  Yikes.  The problem was rectified quickly though and apologies all around.

column1: Oysters were good as two or three were included in each hole of the cast iron serving dish.  Nice that the broth was not overpoweringly garlic/butter flavor (ala Acme).  So we could taste the oysters and the liquid retained a briny flavor.
Mussels were good too as the broth was also redolent of the sea and the wine
column2: while not being too garlicky and buttery.  Nice and light.

column1: Pizza disappointed a bit as the dough was delicious but the fried egg was pretty well done and there was no yolk to ooze over the duck and crust.  Truffle oil was a nice touch though my wife didn't care for the flavor.
The salad was very good and stood out for its unique dressing
column2: which we inquired about.  The waiter claimed it was a strawberry balsamic.  Didn't taste like it and upon leaving checked the specials board to find out it was a Cane Syrup-Brown butter vinaigrette.  Very tasty
column3: sweet and nutty.  the grits were darn good but i would bet that was due to copious amounts of butter (and maybe cream too).  Not the kind you'd make at home but I guess thats the point.

column1: For dessert we had the banana pudding cake
column2: with drunken monkey ice cream.  Ice cream was very good
column3: cake about what you'd expect.

column1: Would return for the food but the atmosphere was not conducive to a couples night out . . . unless you showed up rip roaring drunk and enjoy screaming to heard.";13/10/2009 16:30

column1: GKY9TFibc1KyAjZyH_EpJg;OLGQ7alK4VKl3YdQk6UF5g;pl4naSXZNCZTKvGBdMELFw;5;4;1;3;"I received a gift card from Rizzieri Salon and wasn't sure what service or location I'd pick. The need for an eyebrow waxing and proximity to the AC Expressway led me to the Washington Township location.
It's really close to both the expressway and 42. It's located inside of Virtua
column2: which makes the GPS directions a little confusing. I had to drive around the parking lot and ended up asking the security guard.

column1: They make appointments and also accept walk-in. I stopped by as a walk-in and was taken almost immediately. The salon was very clean
column2: bright and modern. The ladies at the front desk were friendly and professional.

column1: Lisa was great. Before starting
column2: she asked me exactly what I wanted done. The waxing was done in a chair (versus laying down on a table)
column3: and it was as quick and painless as an eyebrow waxing could be. Before I knew it
column4: the service was over and it was exactly what I wanted.

column1: Pro-tip: your first service at Rizzieri is 20% off. It made this market-price service very inexpensive. They have an ATM onsite if you don't have cash for tips.
I was very happy with my experience and see myself popping in on the way down the shore in the future.";13/10/2016 20:35

column1: We wanted cheap but quality Pho and found it at Nam Phuong.  Pick up was easy - plenty of street parking nearby and they had everything ready within 15 minutes.
For takeout
column2: they put all the ingredients for the pho into separate bags/containers.  Great idea so that your sprouts and noodles don't get soggy
column3: and you still have a lime wedge on the side.  We had various meat (beef

To start we got the Bitterballen which were amazing.  They were more croquette-like than meatball-like...not what I was expecting (in a really good way!). They were crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.  Next were the Holland Sliders.  I have to say
column2: I was not a fan of these.  I think herring may be an acquired taste (one which I don't think I'll be acquiring any time soon).

column1: For my entree I went with the trout and my friend went with the salmon.  Both were delicious but I preferred the salmon.  I loved that both entrees were swimming in a super tasty broth (each broth being different to complement their respective fish). We topped off our meal with a shared slice of almond butter cake.  Holy shit
column2: be sure to save room for this if you dine here!

column1: The chef himself came out to tell us about the specials and pour our beers.  Service was attentive but relaxed & friendly.";24/10/2013 14:02

column1: We ordered a cheese pizza

column1: Bottom line

column1: n1cf6-gOI7MvKE2PvC_rwg;EBc-X5eaVjCRNPNMy0H1UQ;FxOiQuDGEue-Fno5-ZKEow;2;6;0;0;"After reading the excellent reviews we stopped in for dinner here looking forward to Japanese grill. After sitting down we were disappointed to find out that they did not have their liquor license yet. Not a big deal. We were also told that they did not actually have any grilled options yet as this was their soft opening
column2: a fact that was not advertised anywhere else. Again a bit disappointed we decided to try out the ramen only to find out they also did not have any ramen yet. This was odd to hear after reading several reviews describing how delicious the ramen was...

column1: Disheartened and left with a fairly limited remaining menu
column2: we ordered a few starters and a couple bentos. The beef done arrived with good presentation but barely enough beef to cover the rice. The ""Chef's Choice"" bento had a few pieces of fried sushi (which had no identifiable meat)
column3: two small nigiri and an adorable onigiri. Unfortunately the onigiri had nothing inside (again despite previous reviews showing filled onigiri) and we were informed they would be filled next week (??) but were still charged regular price for the bento.

column1: In summary
column2: a lack of upfront communication about menu item availability and unapologetic
column3: incomplete dishes lead to an underwhelming dinner experience. An accurate soft opening menu and frank description of what is available and content of the dishes would be appreciated in the future. Also maybe don't put up signs all over the restaurant advertising your 10hr ramen broth when it isn't available yet.";11/02/2018 04:04

column2: and have been meaning to try it out. I finally stopped by for lunch on a Friday.

column1: It was mostly empty
column2: but got progressively busier as my visit went on. I received a warm welcome from a nice hostess
column3: Claudia
column4: who invited me to take a seat anywhere I liked. She handed me a menu and offered me beverages. I'm pretty boring
column5: I always get water
column6: lemon
column7: no ice. She came back with my water
column8: and along with it
column9: homemade chips and salsa
column10: and lime halves. Squeeze the limes over the chips
column11: then dip. It's ritual! The salsa was very tasty and the right amount of heat
column12: although I'm one who enjoys nice kicks to all my foods
column13: so it may come off as spicy to some. I'm sure they can accommodate if you ask
column14: because they are so nice! And finally
column15: the water actually was filtered

column1: I wasn't ravenous this afternoon
column2: so I decided to order something on the smaller side: quesadilla de marlin. I've had caramelos with asada
column3: and chevindeca con birria
column4: but never with fish
column5: so I ventured! They also serve breakfast items
column6: like huevos rancheros and classic chilaquiles
column7: which run about the $7-9 range and entrees looked about the usual for a mariscos spot
column8: about $14-20. There was even a seafood and steak family platter that ran for $45. My quesadilla was $7. There's something on the menu for all budgets.

column1: It took about 10 minutes for my food to come out
column2: but very much worth the wait
column3: even for a little guy: the quesadilla was made from corn tortillas which is expected from a chevindeca but not a quesadilla or caramelo
column4: but I prefer corn anyway
column5: and they were toasted perfectly to me! The cheese oozed - do not expect this cheese to be Guero's or BK's cheese
column6: there's definitely no comparison possible! And when I finally picked it up
column7: juice began to drip and I was convinced it would be the highlight of my day after my first bite. The marlin
column8: peppers
column9: onions
column10: and tomatoes must have been sitting in the juice for hours
column11: just an incredible medley. I can tell you that there's not one thing that made this quesadilla
column12: it's the entire thing!

column1: While I was eating
column2: I was able to meet the owner of the restaurant
column3: Martin
column4: I believe. Such a warm-hearted guy
column5: he reached out to shake my hand with both his hands! Muy buena gente and only cared about how my visit there was going. They have 2 locations in Sonora I believe
column6: one in Rio Rico
column7: another in Nogales
column8: and this one on Prince is their newest. I wish them the best in their growth
column9: hopefully Phoenix will get one in the future bc La Bocanita's the TRUTH!

column1: I will surely be returning with friends and family and trying out different menu items
column2: and what is more

column4: hands down!

i5CXMP71NtFq_P4l-8LiBQ;9hJmq-SEUsXDOq-8RIOo8g;Ye5nmTmZ7cL7BQshqZeIWQ;3;1;0;0;"So
column2: I decided to try McClures's BBQ tonight.  Its just around the corner from where I live.  It's in the New Olreans Lager and Ale Brewing building.  I placed my order and paid.  Then I realized that I didn't order a drink.  I asked the girl behind the counter for a coke.  She said I needed to order at the bar.  So I went over and ordered two cokes for my friend and I.  The bartender open'd the two cokes and then he told me it was a $10.00 min.  Are you kidding!  I don't drink and neither does my friend.  I was outraged to say the least.  I gave the bar tender a hard time and then grabbed a water from  the cooler up front.  I then told the girl behind the counter that she should have told us about the ten dollar min before.  She said she didn't know about it.  That's a bunch of bull.  She said they were a separate business.  Very disappointed!  I do have to say thought that the ribs are very good.  That's the only reason I gave it 3 stars.

column1: 2PW1Z1HJMnaWgOR1tv8NUA;QRxCaKtXM4uWDvExvU6X2g;VImm_9zCKblqG4NwtnKj5g;2;1;1;1;"You know you are getting old when you start out a restaurant review with: I liked this place a lot better 10 years ago.

So let's pretend there wasn't a time in 2003 where Mojo had ridiculously good hot wings and access to the widest selection of brews west of I-65. Those days are gone and Nashville's dining and drinking scene have improved dramatically on both fronts - go us!

I stopped by recently for lunch with a friend. I'm not a food preparation expert but I'm pretty sure that you can't actually make crawfish etouffee and rice in less than 3 minutes. While I was pleased (in an existential sense) by the ultra-quick delivery of our food it really had that ""fresh from the microwave"" flavor and texture.

The main goal of the Mojo Grill's seating area seems to be making you wish you were on the other side having a beer.  Given the insane scalding temperature of my micro-utfee (see what I did there? Sorry.) I wished that I did have a beer to restore balance to my taste-buds.  But sadly for me and this review
column2: it was 11:30 am on a Tuesday.";18/03/2013 18:02

0kztOJdpR1XNYdiry2qTow;_az9nTJGymkQOrIpNIENGw;30rM6JGz_4cqjeBJZ93thA;1;5;4;0;"Positive Review: ULTA has a very nice selection. Their ""name brand"" products are of fair quality.   But I'd have to say it's their SERVICE that will keep me from returning ever again.  I'm not a huge consumer of these products
column2: but maybe 2-3 times a year I'll drop a $100 each time.  About a year ago I received a % coupon from Sephora.  I had a few other errands to run in the same center as ULTA so I brought my Sephora coupon  along and asked if they'd honor the competitor coupon for the same products.  ""No-"" was their curt answer.  There was no offer or suggestion of maybe what they ""could"" do otherwise to earn my business. Just
column3: ""No"" and a stare.   I left
column4: and went to Sephora
column5: who earned my money. Out of convience
column6: I had other shopping to do in this same strip mall
column7: once again.  I grabbed a cart and knocked off each errand along this outside mall while loading each purchase bag I made in the same cart (I know I was cart-double-dipping-lol!)  I also was carrying my 10 month old son in this cart as well (multi-tasking!)  I was ready to give ULTA another try.  As I was browsing the new fall nail colors
column8: a somewhat stern blonde employee quickly approached me and asked me to please leave with my cart.  She explained that although she saw I was pushing an infant and was hauling other bags that their ""shelves were not designed nor sturdy enough in the event I pushed into one with my cart"".  Maybe if she had offered to hold my bags behind the counter
column9: or helped me with my purchases while I used my hands to hold my son
column10: I would have stayed.  But again
column11: there was NO effort made to keep or earn my dollar.  There was no apology for the situation.  Not even a half-ass compassion attempt.  My happy little boy
column12: wallet and I walked our butt out of ULTA for the very last time.  (While passing a woman and her baby in a stroller- so how is THAT exactly less of a shelf hazard than the cart I was pushing???)

column1: Especially in todays economy it's no excuse to be this poor with customer service.  Thank goodness for capitalism. And thank goodness for the Sally Beauty Supply next door to ULTA.  Not only was my purchase less expensive there but  they were very helpful in helping me (and the cart I was pushing!) find my needed products.";08/10/2010 01:26

column7: which is perfect for a quick corporate headshot. He dropboxed me the photos that same night

But you still get to KEEP all of the others ones in that dropbox folder (which is good just to have) because he's awesome and doesn't brand them with a logo all over them or anything. My only tip for someone getting this package is to make sure you take ample photos ! In a few of them
column10: my hair was not to my particular liking (crazy girl

column14: crazy girl about my hair) -- but with his talent

The studio is adorable and there's a full bathroom with a full length mirror there to touch up hair/makeup if the Philly weather kicks your butt on the way in. 6q6z6faE7qlPDe65omXqSw;TeHp5f1KY_7Mh-swUWSjuA;16tjKOvMw_nOgNViq2LwOQ;4;3;2;2;"""Shut the Cluck UP!"" That's their saying =)  Woe 50 people deep in line and I queue up.  Some are locals with work badges trying to get some lunch. Others are taking selfies at every corner and some are nice retired kin folk offering me tips and trivia about the place. I met some real nice folks in line. The line moved quick and I didn't see the menu until I was at the register.  The worker never rushed me and said ""thanks for making it to Hattie B's."" He knew I wasn't from there.  The line grew longer and the crowds were packing in but the attendants were kind and kept asking the kitchen if my order was ready.  Good job buddy! This is just another reason why I love Nashville.  Nice people
So I ordered 3 wings and you can choose what level of ""Hot"" you want. Southern which is no heat to Damn Hot!  I just went with Mild
column2: a touch of burn.  It was just enough spice for me.  My sides were Red potatoes and some Southern Greens. It comes with slice of bread and pickles.  The bread to calm the burn I'm sure.

column1: There's tables and picnic benches inside with lots of window lighting.  The guy behind me ordered up the Damn Hot and two beers and he was sweating like he ran a marathon.  We just looked at each other and just started laughing.  If you come to Nashville try Hattie B's.  Don't forget to take a bunch of pics by the truck out front.";19/05/2016 18:40

column3: however there is some awful water problems behind the 7-11 and the water is not safe for the consumption of people or loved dogs... I placed an order on the 4th of April and have a confirmation e mail that assures me delivery by 11 am on the 11th. That is today! So at noon I called customer service and after waiting 20 minutes to speak with someone
column4: I was greeted with an agent who was clearly more interested in the conversation she was having with her co-worker than she was with assisting me. She was not able to help me or explain to me why there has yet to be water delivered. She then transferred me to her supervisor Katrina who was also apparently not able to tell me anything other than the delivery will ""probably"" take place on the 13th as she does not have access to the service drivers schedule. Sparkletts and Alhambra are apparently owned by the same company
column5: just an FYI. I JUST WASTED 4 WORKING HOURS waiting for a delivery that will possibly be here in 2 days. Wow.  0 Stars and a big fat F...";11/04/2016 19:44

I ordered a old fashioned and the pulled pork sliders.  The old fashioned was supposedly the best ever.  I'd rate it a 3.5 out of 5.  It tasted hot
column2: like cinnamon hot fireball style.  I prefer a nice bulleit or traditional bourbon taste.

column1: The pulled pork sliders were pretty tasty.  The buns a little over toasted but fresh and great flavor.  I wish I tasted more cilantro in the slaw and I wish there was more meat-less bun.

column1: WakKfk_1aP2qNmJ4iUBNQg;r1dcnJa0c3e651EqAtAfKA;ZHyJeUegajPdETnQlrtP6Q;1;2;1;1;"Service:  Great.
Facility: still sub-par
This IHOP re-opened a few days ago after ""voluntarily"" closing down for two months to make health code related repairs.  Building is cold
column2: not sure the heat is on.  Overheard staff say a pipe had froze over night and they had no water and that the owner was aware (for several hours).  However; no plumber was on site.  Eventually I heard a staff member say that they were going to close for the day due to no water.

column1: Not sure a manager was on duty.  I hardly ate my food but no one asked if anything was wrong with the food.  Did I mention the syrup on the table was frozen?  Frozen.  I went to pour the full bottle of strawberry syrup on my pancakes...and nothing came out.  The server noticed and then gave me some heated up syrup in a paper cup.

I thought that since the heat was most likely off and no water that maybe my meal would be comp'd or offered a discount?  I wasn't really expecting a free meal (food was good...was too cold in the building)
column2: but the offer would have gone a long way. Staff is working the best they can with what they got.  With that said
column3: I'm pretty sure doors shouldn't have opened  today with no water.

column1: I had expected significant changes to the interior

column1: _J8voxRtfVNSx2YKcspL3w;SlHwh0cyJ7BRHQJUI74CbA;06NHXjVHiGKNpZ2XeajVkA;5;1;0;0;"As many other yelpers have stated
column2: I've been dying for this place to open since I moved in around the corner. They finally opened during the course of the week leading up to Mardi Gras
column3: and I couldn't be more excited for it.

column1: Walking into the Magasin
column2: you'll get a very upscale
column3: trendy vibe to the place. Everything is sleek and new
column4: and quite impressive. I'm a fan of their lighting
column5: but that's another story.

column1: I was salivating at the menu upon first glance. I settled on their Pho my first go around
column2: and I was so very satisfied. Their presentation is flawless
column3: and their amazing food just makes the whole experience even more delightful. Yes
column4: they may only have one size to their Pho bowls
column5: but to be honest
column6: that could be the least of my concerns. I've since gone back and tried numerous menu items - among my favorites are the Spicy Beef Noodle Soup
column7: the Grilled Shrimp Spring Rolls
column8: and the BBQ Pork Vermicelli Noodle Bowl. Tasty
column9: Tasty
column10: Tasty.

column1: At the moment
column2: they're still in their first few weeks of being open. They have a delightful owner (who even let my roomie and I be served before they opened for dinner the other day!)
column3: and staff who are very eager and apologetic for mistakes made. I haven't had a problem waiting for my food
column4: as all of the times I have gone there
column5: my food has been brought to me in under 10 minutes. I've had to wait longer at numerous other restaurants
column6: so I don't see the wait for food as an issue.

column1: Cost wise
column2: Magasin is super affordable
column3: with most meals costing under $10. I love meals that don't break my bank and Magasin caters to these needs.

column1: A few tips - Magasin is BYOB (no corking fees)
column2: they do take-out
column3: avoid the busy hours of the day (i.e. 12pm
column4: 6-7ish). I haven't had a problem yet rolling in around 5:30
column5: right when they start up dinner
column6: or a little after the lunch crowd.

column1: To make a long story short
column2: this is my new go to Pho shop. It may not be like those Pho shops on the westbank
column3: but I've fallen in love with Magasin
column4: and will continue to visit this darling shop frequently. I've been going back continually
column5: and quite frankly
column6: you should give it a shot.";01/03/2012 08:30

column4: I'm assuming Miguel

column7: but the mac and cheese was not good. It tasted like boiled elbow macaroni with a little cheddar cheese sprinkled on top. Very bland. The blue cornmeal cornbread had a distinct peppery taste

column1: ewF502vFPZ--O0J-vQblHw;_ufG-6QfPQyOg8wrH-6e2Q;MgQbdvwKXEJC-LvySLlabg;5;1;0;1;"Didn't know this restaurant is part of the Original Joes chain as I noticed the menu was similar.  Excellent food

column1: Met friends here for brunch on a weekend right at 11 a.m. which is when they open.  I was quite surprised at the amount of people showing up at this time.  The restaurant was clean and quiet so great for conversations at your own table.  It is located at Southgate mall but with no access from the inside of the mall and has a huge parking lot.

The brunch menu items sounded delicious and mimosas were also available.  Two of my friends shared the banana bread French toast and the Benny and they were able to get it split in half on to their own plates from the kitchen.  The homefries looked so good sprinkled with what looked like seasoning salt.  The dill dip for the fries was very tasty as the gravy (I tried both).  The teriyaki chicken bowl came with lots of sauce so one friend asked for extra rice
column2: it was an additional $2.50 but she got lots.

column1: Our server was very attentive and checked on us often and refilled our drinks without asking.  The service was great here
column2: very happy.  I will definitely be back!";02/01/2017 04:59

column1: hG1BQBeoRPOfkm4PgtlB-A;sVr6_v-lwixu3VREOO9XpA;q2_iNoyvPrT2pUElUJPzBg;3;5;2;2;"Somehow it seems like a struggle for me to get to the west end. Soda jerks is right at one of those intersection
column2: lol
column3: and the atmosphere is rather west-endy too. The typical 'familiar' North American chain restaurant feel.

column1: The burger that I had though
column2: was juicy and tasty.  They have a lot of options for the build your own burger (BYOB) pamphlet. Of late
column3: I've noticed PB&J burgers on various culinary streams so I builty-my-own peanut butter-jelly
column4: with bacon
column5: sautéed onions and brie (cos
column6: dont' we all agree that brie goes great with fruits and nuts?) - burger. The patty was juicy and the ingredients seemed fresh. I wasn't crazy about the sesame bun
column7: but can live with it.

column1: The poutine on the side was sub-par. Somehow
column2: I need to grow up
column3: learn that good poutine is a rare find in Edmonton
column4: and shut up about it. So I am... NOW!  We tried a variety of shakes and boy do you need a crazy metabolism to digest these heavy shakes. The peanut-butter chocolate shake was crazy delicious and can't think about anything that'd make it better (maybe a shot of Captain Morgan?). However
column5: their speciality shake of white chocolate and avocado was pretty okay. Avocado seems too mild
column6: in my opinion
column7: to have it with a bold and sweet white chocolate.

column1: All in all
column2: it was a fun experience. If it had the pull of getting me back there some time
column3: I'd give it a 4 star but sadly it doesn't. Some good things
column4: in particular a juicy patty
column5: but some ordinary things too.";21/02/2013 20:16

column1: 4b5PCvsgPfLpmhKA30INmw;bBvyPVIc8YF8ac4FomNlxw;KXecZki-_3N7afs6HKWM3A;2;1;1;0;"Meh...  a hipster location.  It's a trendy
column2: hipster

column4: it's just weird to see the 2 worlds meet. I think I just need one Asian guy in the kitchen or something so it at least feels ""authentic"". The food was ok
column5: but it seemed like they care more what it looks like than how it tasted. I don't need another experience here.";19/12/2016 18:12

column1: #NOME?;2BVaa-ruSpr5zlEt-0x-dw;2KWdqoTYBTpBq-Rlb4sR5w;3;1;0;0;"The Charlie Chaplin built Montecito Inn is a treat. Nice little well-appointed clean rooms with pleasing design and everything functional.  Good bathroom

column3: as I discovered later they have all of the Chaplin movies on hand for you to watch on the in-room DVD! HBO and such provided on the box in the room as well as a great little digital radio which I thought was a nice touch.

column1: The building is very solidly built and just over 100 years old.
We had great fun soaking in the outdoor hot-tub Jacuzzi and swim in the pool.
My only complaint is that the front desk guys are not very helpful
column2: they appear to be quite miserable and nasty. Hence the shave-off of stars.

column1: When we arrived

column4: it's a shame but there's the 21st century for you... Anyway... The hotel was clearly half -empty on a Sunday
column5: with 4 cars in the parking lot so there was plenty of options to choose from as far as rooms. Sure enough the front-desk guy say ""I have the QUIETEST room in the hotel"" and proceeded to put us into a room right above the intersection. So
column6: the night and morning was noisy.  Why did he do that and why does he take me for an idiot? It remains a mystery...

column1: Hotel pic gallery can be seen at: http://www.montecitoinn.com/gallery";19/05/2009 17:56

column1: 03gbGk-FZO0B-LSXwKKzsw;nOp8C8NjBSNpjf-VoHOQgg;ej2kU6KU2TEL7uY_EB_zVQ;4;0;0;0;I would probably give this place 3.5 stars but I'm bumping it up to 4 because of the ordering system and the plethora of sauces they offer (I loves sauces!). This was my first time at this location but I've been to the one in Harahan a few times. It's always pretty good but not amazing. This time I ordered the zapp'd chicken which is chicken breast breaded in Zapps potato chips and fried. It was HUGE! I'm talking I only ate about a 1/3 of it. It was good and super crispy. I got the spicy potato salad as my side. I liked it but thought it was a little salty. My husband got the Angus burger and fries and also thought it was good but nothing special. After we left though he said that he hated that the food was served on those plastic melamine plates. He thinks it's gross seeing cut marks in the plates from previous patrons and he doesn't want to go to a restaurant and eat off of plastic dinnerware. I kind of see his point but it didn't really bother me too much. All in all this place is good with lots of options but there are definitely better burgers in town.;13/07/2014 14:09

column1: c904aYBQlWMlxDYswbYUeQ;IwDBZfpm4vgTm9L6aF3pqg;qPLq9U11nnGOpj54KkyJUw;5;0;0;0;"the hubs and i spent our day venturing around town and decided to browse in a few furniture stores
column2: just to ""look"". after leaving two other stores even more confident we were just looking
column3: we entered haverty's. and left A LOT poorer. but super glad we did.

column1: approaching us when we walked in was who ended up being what would be produced when the stars aligned
column2: and she was named deborah. we told deborah the gist of what we were growing for and she gave us our space until we needed her. no crrepy stalking.

column1: here's the deal: we are adopting two older children from china
column2: each with special needs: one has only physical needs and the other cognitive delay. we are in the midst of setting up bedrooms and fixing a new guest room (since our previous guest room is now one of the children's bedroom)
column3: and also
column4: the table in our breakfast room is not what we want when they come home. we also need a table for them to do homework and crafts at. we also personally were wishing and dreaming for a headboard and footboard for us (we haven't had a real bed with said headboard and footboard in the 2 years we've been married).

column1: we found the daybed with trundle for the guest room
column2: and began talking to her about our story
column3: and the adoption
column4: she told us about how she had lived abroad and worked issuing visas for newly adopted children as well.

column1: we shared with her our plight of our completely different design ideology and she spent well over an hour with us helping us decide on the perfect balance of function and aesthetic.
when we left
column2: we had the perfect headboard/footboard for our bedroom
column3: a daybed with trundle for the new guest room
column4: an awesome small dresser for storage for the new guest room
column5: and our dream table/homework craft area.

column1: all around a great experience
column2: where we didn't feel like chum in a water full of sharks.";03/01/2015 22:14

pzQuKawmx8XeOYAjtvgqIg;KvoHp9A3TgaiVWj4SZpdAg;c1cHkfHOySbevqOfvshUiA;5;1;0;1;"I've shopped at a lot of Liquor stores and ABC stores (not that I drink a lot) and out of all of them - this store ranks among the top.

column2: qualities and price points.

column1: There's a craft beer section which features Florida brewers and many from outside the state.
The cigar and liquor sections go on for days!
Their prices are the same or better than most supermarket sale prices.

column1: YCHjptksRbRLbldCK1UzxA;1CmhdHhJHokf2mkemRiY3g;sEf8VsIbhGwSnKte1IBm-Q;1;4;0;0;"After reading about the phenomenal review on yelp

column4: which was great. It is tucked away in the first floor of an apartment/loft complex. Parking for Estelle is minimal
column5: they have about 5 spots total for customers. So
column6: we parked on street (note: must pay meter via coins

column1: The food was simply bland
column2: dry
column3: and a tad unedible. And I am not saying this because I already have a breakfast place I am loyal to. I had a bacon/egg/cheese sandwich. You can get it on their own roll (aka dry thick sour dough like bread) or bagel. I could only eat half of it. I was amazed -how can you mess up a breakfast sandwich? The eggs were not fluffy
column4: and they added some weird herb to it to give it an ""off"" taste. There were two small pieces of bacon
column5: and barely any cheese on it. All together
column6: I'd rate a 1.

column1: My date got the beet
column2: cheese
column3: onion omelet. It came with homefries
column4: with his were in need of some serious seasoning
column5: and wheat toast
column6: which was literally was like eating grains. He did enjoy his coffee though. Coffee situation was odd though. Although we had a server
column7: you had to go up to the counter to pour your own. Not necessarily a negative
column8: just different. Have to give props for having unique omelet options
column9: such as trying to use beets. But the eclectic ingredients in the end do not make a good end product. I will not be returning here.";13/02/2011 16:27

_vvkpRGYpTYIFN4lp-zoPQ;WhrKP7f2ZOVCwgzTvLOmoQ;LmKpHMXSsm36viJOGVodFw;5;0;0;0;If there was a way to give the Botanical Garden 10 stars I would! It's literally a core shaker. Pictures and descriptions can't do it justice. I believe it's open year round. I've been there on the hottest of hot humid days and it's still a pleasure. There are different areas that feature gardens you'd find in other countries. There is a rose garden. There's a garden just for hostas! There are several indoor areas featuring plants from desert and rain forest regions. The landscaping and maintenance are unmatched. There are structures that are beautiful and artful and stunning architecturally. It is a huge park! Birds and animals are there. There's also art and people to answer questions. Signs to tell you more about the gardens. I have to say I don't like the tram driving around. It gets in the way and you sometimes have to literally jump aside. The driver does not yield to people on foot and they are loud
column2: going places they should stay out of. But this is the price you pay for such an earth shattering experience. There are also concerts and other events. Make an entire day of it if you can.;07/04/2017 21:56

column1: RhT4-IiOKiuTbQcw3-LchA;bO3-kdkMQXBgfSWChOZYSA;#NOME?;5;0;0;0;Excellent experience. Pete is very knowledgable about the area and provided great guidance on which wineries to visit. fTM-fqZMzfA-OR3a3FyA1g;j7gM2jTyQu3EIXVDvZSQ8Q;UIlrtflU_DOagc4YyrQ2Uw;3;1;0;0;"I have been to the Supper Club three times now for dinner and have had 2 great experiences and one below average one.
First experience:  About a month after it opened on a weekday night.  Dined with another vegetarian friend of mine.  We both ordered the Papardelle and it was amazing.  Perfectly cooked.  Note
column2: my friend is a true Italiana and was still impressed with the food.  Our waiter was flamboyant and silly but overall helpful.  There was singing from the moment we arrived until we ordered dessert when they took a break.  The mousse cake is DELICIOUS and I still dream about it.

column1: Second experience:  June 2012
column2: Saturday night.  A friend from out of tow and her musical loving children took me out for my birthday here.  I ordered all of the same food and it was all still delicious
column3: especially that mousse cake.  I was called up for a birthday shot and there was singing again
column4: throughout the night.

column1: Third experience:  September 2012
column2: Saturday night.  A friend heard about the June experience and wanted to go.  We arrived at 8pm and had to ask to be seated somewhere that wasn't behind the mirrored post.  When we asked to sit in the main room right in front of the stage
column3: we were told the tables were reserved.  NO ONE SAT THERE ALL NIGHT.  Our food and service were great
column4: again the papardelle.  My friend ordered the Grouper Special and reported that it was good.  We asked when the entertainment would be begin and were told ""in 5 minutes"".  About 30 minutes later
column5: at 9
column6: we were entertained by 20-30 minutes of music.  It was great but then they took a ""brief break"" which involved the piano player walking around drinking soda FOR AN HOUR AND A HALF.  My friend was determined to stay for a second set to hear our fabulous waiter
column7: David
column8: sing.  At 10:30 we were treated to another 15 minutes of music and then another ""brief break.""  I was not interested in waiting around any longer.  While waiting
column9: the lovely proprieter of the establishment came around to ask how the food was.  He handed us a card
column10: which we thought was a coupon
column11: and were excited about.  When we realized it was his business card
column12: we were disappointed and confused.

column1: The food is good but the entertainment is the reason to go.
All in all
column2: I would go here again and would recommend it to others but now with a caveat just in case people don't have 3 hours to spend sitting around to wait for the entire reason they came to the establishment in the first place.";10/09/2012 15:22

column3: it just didn't seem right. So
column4: I pulled up my iYelp and saw the sign for this place and saw that I just needed to walk a few feet down the way to the Butcher sign.

column1: We had originally come for the bacon pralines but decided to get a little lunch/snack while here. After all
column2: they boast mac and cheese which my boyfriend and I are both huge fans of.

column1: So
column2: we ordered the mac and cheese and the duck sliders to share. We tried to order the pralines but were told they were sold out and next time to come back earlier (we arrived at 11). Not enjoying pralines
column3: I wasn't too upset except that this was the whole reason we came. My boyfriend
column4: on the other hand
column5: was devastated. Two of his most favorite things in the world
column6: bacon and praline
column7: were denied to him. And we knew we would never get back to this place
column8: let alone EARLIER
column9: due to the things we already had planned.

column1: The duck slider was good. Cheesy
column2: salty
column3: toasted
column4: and delicious. The only let down was the size for the price. We both really enjoyed the mac and cheese except we both decided it was more of a cheese pasta dish as it had so many additions that we couldn't classify it as a true mac and cheese. But
column5: we both also agreed it was one of the best cheese pasta dishes we have had. Also a let down for the price though.

column1: If I could have gotten my boyfriend a bacon praline and not spent close to $20 bucks for two sodas and some snacks I would have rated this place higher.";29/06/2011 20:15
sUANGfK6TcgrcmLrZmd6RA;VMLDVK6ANh-CnDxQNIAEEw;oF3QPsczR9ZiXPK89tdJaA;5;2;7;2;"I tested my stomach boundaries on this place. I always knew I was capable of more but now I'm sure!
Obi-wan-Kenobi (Steve E.) was nice enough to introduce me to this place. Once again
column2: some of the best places I found in Tampa are in a strip shopping center very unpromising and over delivering. Unless recommended by a friend or Yelp
column3: there is no reason for me to come from Riverview to 2202 Waters and try some Chinese food...but it was so good!

column1: We ordered one appetizer: Salt and Pepper Calamari. That could have been my meal! It was so good. The batter was crispy and the spices were perfect (green onions
column2: red pepper flakes and other bits of deliciousness). Then we ordered three entrees: shrimp fried rice
column3: black pepper beef and shrimp with Chinese greens. Steve kept saying that we ordered enough to take home and eat the next day
column4: and I agreed. When they served the food on the table I thought that we definitely were going to have leftovers for the next two days...but I gave the first bite and my paradigm shifted.

column1: In every dish I had this savory feeling that the only adjective that comes to mind is: right! The salt was right!
column2: the spice was right! the crunchiness was right! the brightness on the greens was right! many delicious Chinese places I've been to are greasy...the grease was right! a lot of rights make perfect in my opinion.

column1: Yes
column2: we had leftovers
column3: not as much as I thought when I saw the plates but we had enough to make two small boxes to go. Steve assured me that he was going to have that for the next day. I
column4: in a very naïve state of mind
column5: thought the same.

column1: We happily paid the bill  (around $40 for everything) that I thought it was more than fair for the great experience with my new friend
column2: and we proceeded to go to the Got Tea place a couple of business down in the same shopping center. We parted ways happily
column3: I went to a work appointment and I got home at 11 pm.

column1: Little I knew that the box that I stuffed at Yummy house had learned my name and whispered it in my ear at midnight. Like responding to a mermaid call
column2: I got up and finished what I started a couple of hours earlier. No reflux
column3: no nightmares
column4: no regrets....just happiness.

column1: I am taking the people I love to this place!";14/03/2014 04:35

column1: WrJRRzy5RsadUeCONG3j2Q;gQFxuoXWvEPIakUGPomqYw;wmByH6-0XAgLxLMUzWourA;4;0;0;1;"A Mexican and a Muslim walk into a Museum and are immediately greeted by a Trump supporter. I know this sounds like a joke
column2: but read on...

column1: So my guy and I walked into the museum around 4pm on a Saturday. We were in a rush because we knew we only had an hour to walk in the museum. We were told to stop by and get a map at the front. There was an older gentleman there who greeted us by asking who we were voting for. Not sure if that question is asked to all that walk by those doors
column2: or we just got lucky. We didn't want to answer as we figured
column3: being in Tennessee
column4: we were most likely not voting for the same candidate. We brushed off the question and he asked again. We made a joke of it and answered. He mumbled something under his breath and then laughed and said
column5: ""I'm just kidding
column6: not you guys."" He did this a few times before asking us why we were voting the way we were. I wanted to make him aware of our backgrounds and II jokingly told him that Trump is trying to get rid of our people. Again
column7: he mumbles something under his breath and said ""he was just kidding."" He then proceeded to say that we were already in the country anyway and that his concern were the immigrants. At this point
column8: it was no longer funny and I just wanted to get the map so we could go on our way. My guy quickly cut him off and asked for the map. The man finally gave us the map with a few directions and we were off. This experience is the reason I deducted a star.

column1: Once inside
column2: I forgot about what had just happened and got lost all the information the museum had to offer. The videos
column3: the displays and the newspapers of that time
column4: really help you understand that period in time. While it is interesting
column5: it is all very sad and am so glad a lot of changes have been made since then. I am obviously familiar with the Civil War
column6: but being there put me on another level. I wish we had given ourselves more time to roam three floors. There is so much to see and you will find yourself losing track of time because you are so wrapped up in a video
column7: on a portrait or on an actual artifact.

column1: I truly enjoyed everything this FREE museum had to offer
column2: but the older gentleman at the front should maybe just stick to greeting people and not give his political opinion.

column1: Yeah
wF0dPMQb6tGLCO7DXTJo-g;GMY_0bC9JsKGvw9v_sRIiw;GG-3p0TNexuyMYqy5ygpzw;3;0;0;0;"A bit over priced
column2: but three stars because they have a great selection. I look at it as I pay more for the fact that I get socialize my dog while shopping for his needs. Almost gave them 2 or 1 stars because of the staff/services.

column1: The staff are okay. A bit pushy to sell you a puppy starter kit. Some are very nice and helpful
column2: others are just interested in your dog. A bit misleading also
column3: sold me what I was told was a ""bull tendon"" that's great for chewing on. Bought my puppy another one and actually read the label - it's a ""bull pizzle"". I'll let you look up what that is
column4: but I'm a little annoyed that was generalized as a ""tendon"".

column1: Will never utilize their services again - was told their puppy play time was for puppies and free
column2: after I got in ""the ring"" I found out there were 9 year old dogs and a $10 a person charge. There were about 10+ dogs and 15+ people in the little training area they have - very crowded for dogs that are not familiar with one another in my opinion.

column2: as they were not itemized in the description. She stated everyone knows that's how this spicy roll is made. It is the first time I had ever had it that way. And I had asked I without due to allergies. I had been very clear. Instead have been being polite
column3: mistakes happen. The manager audibly sighed at me and walked away leaving my plate. The matter was not handled and no resolution was offered. I was simply dismissed. It was my fault after all. We sat for more than 15 minutes. When my boyfriend went to find our server eating dinner. I had not touched my dinner at this point. The server did not care. She did offer something else. She even stated I would be charged for the untouched sushi. My boyfriend had to state she didn't touch it. Just take off the bill. This is my first time yelping. The experience was that bad. The customer service was nonexistent. Horrible!;01/04/2015 13:22

column1: eVkZcBYGzdxzwgcy6HyT8g;Ls2aG3aBEGvEV5SLWAmJEA;wLLQNryYRoXZUiAZT4yPCw;4;0;0;0;"I've literally lived down the street from this place for the last 3+ years and only just tried it the other night. I ordered takeout online through the Yelp app which was pretty awesome. I had never done that before either. Ordered and paid right through the app and it gave me updates as to when my food would be ready.
Only downside is you don't know what the specials are...
I ordered the ravioli and the rice/prosciutto appetizer. Both were super delicious. The app was 2 big pieces. Nice size but a little on the pricier side.

The ravioli were 6 giant round ravioli. At first I was like that's it?? But it was totally enough for me to have 2 meals. Both the app and the ravioli came in a kind of blush sauce and it was delicious though if I were to have eaten there I would have asked for an extra side of sauce as it needed a little more in my opinion plus I would've liked some to dunk my bread in (they give you a nice hunk of really yummy bread).
My only concern is that I thought I read in other reviews that entrees come with soup or salad...I definitely didn't get any of that.
It ended up costing me $20 for my app and entree. Not bad but not great. I think I will try to order during happy hour next time.

Oh one more thing...there was a yummy looking picture of gnocchi on the website but I didn't see that anywhere on the menu. Some of my concerns probably would've been cleared up had I ordered in person or on the phone but I just loved the convenience of online ordering. I'll definitely go back.";26/07/2018 17:09

NECK1-359ZNu2M39l_qS0A;3YJ2PeLugInGmmOWVzlUlA;F5hMvrCBhqpHX74D2FgZCg;4;0;1;0;"The Noodle has been a go-to when friends are in town and want something other than the standard boom-boom-boom night clubs of Meridian Street (I'm too old for that - lol).
I can always count on great music - often 2 bands to wonder between. And these aren't just bands-for-hire. These are musicians in love with their craft and with performing.

The place is always hopping; the people-watching is definitely included in the (very reasonable) cover and worth the price of admission alone. The wait staff is fun and friendly without being gimmicky.
The food is pretty standard
column2: but that's not why you go there. Go there for the history (read the story on the menu)
column3: the booze
column4: the sounds and the people. Just go there!";24/02/2014 13:49

k2EFJ2AG9sJDpry_vySs_g;KFFIyUxC0TQjx__OYlmhnA;CqpbkSMqjeJrtc_3uC-z0A;5;18;0;2;"I have been to Ursula's multiple times over the past few years to try out their various services.  I am a fan of all of them.
Makeup lesson - like every other girl around
column2: I've obviously been wearing makeup for years and thought I knew how to put it on.  Who hasn't tried to follow those diagrams in magazines which tell you how to apply eyeshadow for ""day"" and ""smokey eyes""
column3: right?  Well it turns out I wasn't clueless
column4: but I definitely learned a trick or two which really makes my makeup look great.  Also
column5: she doesn't push products on your at all during the lesson
column6: but you definitely might want to buy a few of the things
column7: such as foundation.  This is also like a professional foundation matching session.  Recently she changed her brand of foundation and the one I'd been using was discontinued.  After I purchased the replacement
column8: I discovered at home it was too dark.  I contacted Ursula and she immediately arranged for me to come back and get something that would make me happy.  The one we chose was even better than the original and I left there super satisfied.

column1: Facial - what can I say about Elina and the facial that hasn't already been said below?  It's a one-of-a-kind experience and Elina is obviously a pro.  Try it at least once.  There are differnet combos
column2: but go with the one with the scalp massage.  Of course that's the best choice.

column1: Massage - I am pretty sure they don't have these anymore
column2: but I got a few from Elina maybe a year or two ago and they were wonderful.

column1: Brow sculpting/shaping - You are going to have to seriously grow your brows out before trying this one.  No joke
column2: don't touch them AT ALL for a few months and then go visit Ursula.  Mine are looking great and she is definitely an expert on the subject.

column1: The only downside is that it's sometimes tough to get in or get an appointment.  There is no regular secretary
column2: so you have to either email or call and then wait for their reply.";28/05/2013 22:22

column1: 1rMMDIs498C2Ff9cBA-gzw;5e_2-Kyq8Oca5IgPXzhQ0A;FNP4tlM-KYf--vTk_Gf9nQ;3;2;0;0;"This is a conveyor belt sushi place where you grab what you want off the conveyor belt and each plate has a price. For lunch
column2: you get all you can eat sushi for $8.99
column3: but there's a catch. The red plates
column4: which are the most expensive
column5: aren't included in that price. And conveniently for the restaurant
column6: most of the good sushi is on a red plate. For dinner
column7: however
column8: you get all you can eat
column9: red plates included
column10: for $17.99. And trust me
column11: if you like sushi
column12: you will eat much more than $17.99 worth. And if you don't
column13: they only charge you for how much you ate.

column1: In terms of food
column2: it's alright. Peter's Sushi in Brentwood is MUCH better. This place is like high end fast food sushi. If you care more about quantity than quality
column3: it's a good place for you. It could also be a good place for a first date because it's fun to grab stuff off the conveyor belt and you don't have to awkwardly order with someone you just met. But if you know your sushi
column4: you won't be impressed with the taste.

column1: Try the all fruit sushi. It's the best.";31/05/2016 02:44

column1: I decided to go there b/c I saw a coupon in the Santa Barbara News Press for $30 for both a mani/pedi.  Wow!  great deal considering my last mani/pedi here ran me like $54!  Regular mani/pedi ladies
column2: nothing special
column3: no flowers
column4: no acrylics
column5: nope
column6: just a plain mani/pedi.

column1: So I sorta knew where Artistic is located
column2: which
column3: is in a strip mall next to an Albertson's and a Rite Aid?  or was it Long's or CVS?  I can't recall
column4: but a drug store of some sort.  so I rolled up Sat morning
column5: about 11:30
column6: walked in and to my awe and total surprise
column7: I walked into the 80's.  yah
column8: seriously
column9: everything was a shade of pink
column10: the chairs were this nasty flesh colored plastic with these ""crushed flowers"" seat cushions.  can we say N-A-S-T-Y??  really.   the nail polishes were located right at the entrance and I started looking at the nail polishes and this guy comes up to me and i said
column11: I need a mani and a pedi
column12: thank you.  He looks at me and says something.  I wasn't sure what so i keep looking for nail colors
column13: then ANOTHER guy comes up to me and says if he can help me and I'm like
column14: yah
column15: uh
column16: i need a mani and pedi?...  *didn't I already tell someone this??

column1: so he tells me to go to a chair and so there I am and i can't say that i feel like the place is totally clean.  it's sorta has this nasty film stuff on all of the seats that i didn't want to put my purse down...
I guy starts on my pedicure and of course the first thing he asks me ""are you chinese?""  dude.  why does it matter?  I mean
column2: i know i'm like the only other asian person besides your compadres here
column3: but still does it matter?  so i say yes and yes
column4: with a little aggravation.

column1: another gal comes up and starts on my manicure and clearly her language ability is a little than the guy doing my pedi
column2: so i ask her where is some good vietnamese food in town and she tells me about Saigon In and Out.  eh.  which
column3: ended up being ok.  see my other review.

column1: so anyway
column2: i can't say that i recommend this place
column3: and the irony... my mani and pedi was $30 WITHOUT the coupon.  uh... okay?....  The only reason i would go back b/c it's was cheap.
