V3OxD_bbxi_a7KcwHs7AgQ;pppIHoA8b8B8Wd5t72sDxA;jEasa4Sbzy4NdLyzPPgQyg;3;5;1;1;"The best part about this brewery is the prices. This is one of few places in center city you can get craft beer for less than five dollars. This place is mostly clean and well kept
column2: and very nicely air conditioned on hot summer nights
column3: something I was grateful

column1: for the night I went.
Along with their own beer they do serve wine and spirits as well
column2: with a reasonable cocktail menu to match. I happened to just stick to beer
column3: and from what I experienced their beer is generally quite typical.

column1: I'll start with the bad; Dark Money
column2: their saison
column3: is extremely forgettable. It is not too spicy or salty like a typical saison
column4: and while it is tart it is not a great specimen. Their oatmeal stout
column5: Belgrave Crescent
column6: starts out well enough but ends on an extremely and uncharacteristic bitter note that left a lingering terrible taste in my mouth.

column1: There is good as well though. The Goldenrye has a nice flavor that is very crisp and has pleasant mouthfeel. Sticky Icky
column2: their double IPA
column3: was probably their best offering. It is slightly sweet but not cloying
column4: and has the perfect amount of kick an IPA should have without being too bitter.

column1: I would come back here. That being said
column2: I'm not dying to come back here and probably wouldn't go out of my way for more of their brews. If you're in the area and like craft beer
column3: then by all means check it out. There isn't anything extremely unique here
column4: but you might find a decent brew or two on tap.";01/09/2016 14:59

column1: It started at the managers reception (free drinks and appetizers
column2: woohoo)  I ordered a beer which arrived in the dirtiest glass I have ever seen.  I was not paying attention and took a drink
column3: I almost threw up a little.  There were still bits of dried on food from someone who had been eating and drinking.  Makes me feel ill thinking about it.  The appetizers were dodgy looking cheese cubes with some tortilla chips.

column1: On to dinner.
20 minutes after we were seated they took our food and wine order. 5 minutes later they came with the bread. 20 minutes later they came with dinner. 10 minutes into dinner they came with our wine. Oh
column2: my colleagues glass came with the obligatory lipstick smudge.

column1: All of the delay and only half a dozen people in the restaurant.
A very underwhelming experience
On the weird side
column2: they had all of the rooms around the outside of the building and in the middle they had created a stream environment
column3: including their very own sord of ducks (look it up

column1: If you want to stay at an Embassy Suites in Phila

column1: The lemon pepper wings are the kind of thing you push people in front of trains for
column2: but I'd understand if you did some unspeakable things for a little parm-garlic action. The boneless wings are awesome and typically lack the nasty gristle of other alternatives
column3: but you'll occasionally run into a crunchy rock of breading with no chicken inside - a minor inconvenience for such tasty food.

column1: Unfortunately
column2: our fries and wings came lukewarm from this location

column1: When the food is fresh

column1: 4iJjhkQIifjxKMPjsVPO-g;r06yC-hURWN1Fkx7C4OzLQ;WTWhKHqkK_uwwSIFJK392g;4;3;0;0;"As a new comer to state side boutique hotels I try to judge fairly without comparison to overseas counterparts or more recognized brands from my domestic travels. With that said I have to say that I was impressed with my stay and the level of service I received from The Latham. An additional advantage
column2: they're pet friendly!

column1: I became concerned that I would miss the check-in window due to my late arrival and decided to call before making the drive to Philadelphia. I was assured that my late check in would not be an issue and upon arriving just before midnight I was greeted by a friendly and efficient doorman who was eager to assist with my bags and valeting my car. The front desk staff was kind and welcoming and the hotel provided flavor infused water in the lobby (the little touches that make a difference).
The Latham's Rittenhouse Square location is ideal; close to great restaurants
column2: shopping and convenient to Center City. I found the rooms to be clean and spacious with complimentary bottled water and a well stocked complimentary Keurig machine. The iPod docking station was a great addition making charging a breeze. One of the highlights of my stay was the complimentary car service and the driver
column3: Roman. Having the convenience of the car made traveling on a challenging weather day a breeze. Not only is the service available to take you to your destination from the hotel but you can call when you are out to schedule a pick up. Roman was courteous
column4: professional
column5: incredibly friendly and provided a native Philadelphian's view on the ins and out of the city.

column1: The only downside during my stay were intermittent power issues. Most of the hotel lost power during the first morning of my stay and upon arriving at the hotel that evening power was lost again. I must give credit to the staff who handled the issue expertly. I went to the front desk during the first power outage to ask where in the neighborhood I could find coffee since I couldn't take advantage of the in room Keurig. The staff at the desk provided complimentary coffee from the restaurant without batting an eye. Later that evening when the power went out for a second time shortly after I returned for the evening I questioned the situation. The staff apologized and explained that the issue was not isolated to the hotel
column2: which became evident after looking at he building across the street which also had no power. They took it upon themselves to credit my room for the valet parking during my stay. An incredible job handing a difficult situation!";04/01/2015 05:42

column1: g3OHqJnDOC8X9GYhr7WFYA;O-by3CpTAbaWYC2mPNahuQ;H55RMGDIoKWWxpvQGAEwsw;1;0;0;0;"This clinic is a joke. I went in on Saturday to get tested for strep throat.
The one nurse / receptionist was really helpful and nice but the other one was useless.
I got called into the room
column2: the doctor started talking to me and then just walked out while I was in the middle of a sentence and came back with the nurse. He told me something about my age and him not being allowed to be alone so that was a red flag.

column1: He took the swab and looked at my ears and told me to call in 3 days for the results that was that.
So I called Monday morning to see if they got the results yet and they said no
column2: try calling back ""later than now"" so I called at 7 pm and got a voice mail saying they were closed but their office hours are from 9-9.

column1: So I called back on Tuesday and they still didn't have the results. So I asked what I should do because I'm not getting any better and the receptionist told me to go see a new doctor. So I did ... and guess what. He looked up my file and found the results for the strep test. So unless you want to be seen an ignorant doctor and incompetent ""nurses"" go elsewhere.";27/06/2017 23:58

u344DwuOzcuTHCwCFmUoEg;T8ChPPrwUYwGY2irzNo2JQ;Y6DlWDqu-c6dACziAf6GPA;5;9;0;0;"We passed by this restaurant on the way back from Palm Harbor and decided to have diner.  They seated us on a large round table with a nice lazy Susan to share meal.
Our server informed us that they just have a new management and promised us that the dishes are more authentic Chinese. After browsing through their menu
column2: we decided to order  some authentic dishes: grouper with spicy XO sauce
column3: seafood fried rice with spicy XO sauce
column4: wasabi shrimp
column5: crispy tofu with garlic
column6: baby bokchoy with garlic sauce
column7: sweet and sour chicken
column8: sizzling beef with black pepper
column9: seafood tofu claypot
column10: and beef chowfun.  Yes
column11: we were hungry!  In case you are not aware XO is a cognac brand.

column1: We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food there.  Everything tasted good and authentic.  The dishes were not too sweet or salty.  I personally found the crispy tofu
column2: beef chowfun
column3: grouper with XO sauce
column4: and fried rice in XO sauce to be really  exceptional.  The wasabi shrimp is OK.

column1: So yes
column2: we will be back in the future!";31/05/2016 03:09

column1: IOg9KfDZa9CrHHD5gJtYHw;3tBluoSyAoMct4vPb25uug;KpapS4o3byLjgyN3S9KPCg;4;4;2;3;"First off
column2: it's a hospital. You come in expecting the worst and hoping for the best.

column1: We came in to the ER Saturday morning and were seen right away. Yes
column2: there are renovations going on and yes
column3: it isn't the prettiest. However
column4: we were seen almost immediately. The staff was friendly and as attentive as possible. We were in and out within 3 hours. The total work was about 45 minutes

column1: YxRlaE9QwQ37FGQ3TW7QLg;jqTa-RtGU26q3TFTmMZOAw;EEWjIIs6N-34yaAXI7lHJQ;3;1;1;0;"So maybe my expectations were flying high
column2: with all the personal recommendations and the hype coming into this dinner
column3: but if have to say that my expectations were not exactly met.

column1: I'll start with the good. The wings. Borderline legendary when it comes to West Philly Wings. I was almost chewed out by some folks when they found out I live in West Philly and I hadn't had the wings yet. They are good. They come dry
column2: slightly salted
column3: and nicely fried. They don't come off too oily or battered and have a nice crispness to it. They are solid wings but I like a little sauce and wetness personally. 4/5

column1: The hot and sour soup was pretty good too. Had enough sour and mild spice
column2: with a nice mix of bamboo
column3: mushrooms
column4: carrots and water chestnuts. 4/5

column1: Now the not so good. The sesame chicken was more breading than anything
column2: and it's not a good thing when you bite into the food and can't tell any textural difference between batter and chicken. Whether they had better quality chicken before and they're just skimping now
column3: I don't know
column4: but what I do know is this was not good. So not good that we couldn't finish it. I'm not claiming to be a faux Chinese food aficionado but no thank you. Won't be ordering this again here. 1/5

column1: The scallion pancake was also disappointing. It looked and tasted like something we get from the frozen food section in the Asian supermarkets. At least they provided an original sauce that had a nice flavor (soy sauce & garlic). 2/5";05/03/2015 01:27
rJLJA6Ry7x1Q5zR5A-HuVw;hWGY8i7qaMYdkVhQezXgGA;85e8Uyn8tIyEZCqBP80rqA;5;0;0;0;"Excellent Mexican food.   I would definitely come back.
My wife and I shared 3 dishes and I recommend all of them.
The Queso Fundido Setas was not like the normal nacho looking melted cheese plate that I'm used to.  That's why I normally do not order Queso Fundido.   But the charred corn
column2: pickled onion
column3: and mushrooms sold me.   It came with hot tortillas which I used to make cheese tacos.   This dish would be good for 4-5 people.

column1: Mexican style corn.   It comes with 4 small pieces.  Great size appetizer for 2 people.
Shrimp enchiladas (2 enchiladas).   The only downfall is that it was actually a cheese enchilada with 4 perfectly cooked shrimp on a skewer on top of the enchiladas.  The enchilada was excellent
column2: but we wouldn't have ordered it with the Queso Fundido.";03/09/2018 01:48

column1: bNZABhoR752UOw04Bt-9RQ;1m_ojYc0zuNjBzBAimmTyw;Esf3-D_44pArPd9GqysoCg;3;3;0;0;I love
column2: love the baked goods in this bakery. The décor is elegant
column3: staff are efficient and cheerful. My only reservation is the customers. It is always crowded. Even tough I love kids
column4: there are too many over the top carriages and unruly children. The people can also be very unfriendly. I was asked by a huffy woman to leave a table for four because she was having her staff meeting. I was sitting at a table for four
column5: the only one available. I did not realize

column1: PR9doODzPcCSMjrs3JZS1w;Rrcdkp1Rtx_tTA0FivjE3g;xUAxWsdyk6GKAAou23wSQg;4;1;0;0;This tiny little Thai/Vietnamese restaurant in Blue Bell is a hidden wonderland of delicious food.  It always amazes my husband and I that this place is not packed - even on a Saturday night.  I am risking it becoming overcrowded if a lot of people start to flock there
column2: but it would be great for them to have more business.  We love to eat Thai food and this restaurant rivals any Chinatown place. The Pad Thai is scrumptious and enough for two.  The Cashew Nut chicken is a favorite as well as the Tom Yum soup.  Just the right amount of spice.  We also love the Basil Chicken fried rice dish. The service is friendly and the prices are great.  Please give this restaurant a try.  It's in a little strip mall by the Broad Axe tavern but don't be turned off by that.;18/01/2015 14:10

OqFcZryJX9H98MI2CwFR9Q;shNmc8ypfFPJgvYNPO0sqg;akNpPdFsHk0mvbqkmPrXWg;5;1;0;0;"We were very impressed and pleased with the service provided by Saki of SK Heating and AC.  As first-time homeowners who are very new at all this home-maintenance stuff
column2: we were worried about being taken advantage of or talked down to
column3: but that was so not the case!  Saki made us feel very comfortable
column4: explained in lots of detail how our system works
column5: answered our questions
column6: and gave us helpful advice that I think is also going to save us money down the road.  He is a wonderful communicator.

column1: I had called him around 9:30 in the morning because we'd been meaning to have our central air system inspected due to an odd noise it had started making recently.  I figured we'd have to make an appointment for a number of days out
column2: but he was already out on another service call
column3: and said he could be at our place in an hour or two
column4: if we'd like.  He gave us a call half an hour later with an update on his ETA
column5: and arrived 15 minutes later.  The price he charged for the inspection was remarkably reasonable
column6: especially given how much time he spent explaining everything to us
column7: and we plan to ask him to come back to have the system cleaned after it warms up enough that we switch from heating to air-conditioning.

column1: With the typical worries and learning curve that come with owning our own home for the first time
column2: I am excited that we now have our go-to guy who we will trust for regular maintenance as well as any emergencies that come up in the future with our heating and air conditioning system!";01/04/2015 15:41

column1: SGcpydF19qP9_jB9YWqPRw;kA528bHw7c2dwAmqvk63oA;2qHkwqao9GyxnDXHzCv4JA;2;3;0;1;"Maybe prioritizing your to-go business while leaving your dine-in guests high and dry isn't the best approach to brunch. Not only does it make the experience incredibly obnoxious
column2: but it hurts your waitstaff. No one wants to tip when they sit for 45 minutes+ for a couple eggs
column3: especially when they get no updates of effort to alleviate the situation. By the way
column4: ""it'll be up as soon as possible"" doesn't help.

column1: This experience was a little weird
column2: in that shortly after writing my initial thoughts
column3: the owner came out and apologized for the wait and let us know our food would be out shortly and it would be free.

column1: Now
column2: the food was dynamite. Really lovely. And yes
column3: the wait was brutal and the lack of info for so long of it was unfortunate. But I actually feel like taking care of our entire check was a bit of an overreaction. People will wait for good food. You just have to make the wait enjoyable. Offer a free cupcake or coffee or other treat. Costs less and keeps everyone happy to be there.

column1: The food will bring us back and I'll update the stars (assuming the experience improves). Till then!";14/07/2016 19:06

qO7V7JONxW9JrUJiCmp8Hw;Vct4fKoGE9k-7tNwSsY8Cw;RLlOK2fL6xU1sfIPiP2QBw;4;3;1;1;"I came to New Orleans for my cousin's wedding and this is the first place I ate with my family. The man who drove us from the airport to our hotel recommended it to us and I'm glad he did. It was less than a 5 minute walk from our hotel.
You can tell this place gets packed on the regular because we waited about 25 minutes to be seated on a Thursday night. It's spaced out well and there is plenty of seating.
Service was honestly great. They are all very attentive and although it was very busy
column2: they had so many people working that they were able to manage it well. Our server was very friendly and she came to our table at least 5 times though out our dinner. She also gave us suggestions and there is really not a single complaint I can make about her service.

column1: Before you order
column2: they bring these really good red potatoes that they cook in the same water they use for boiling crab and they are seasoned with the same seasoning that is used on some of the seafood. These potatoes were definitely unique from any I've had before and a cool change from having bread before a meal.

column1: For my meal
column2: I ordered the combo dinner that brought charbroiled oyster
column3: shrimp and catfish. You also have the option to have it fried
column4: which I think would've been better but it's okay. It also comes with a plate of fries
column5: a little coleslaw
column6: cocktail sauce and tarter sauce. All this seafood was just what I was looking for and the meal as a whole hit the spot.

column1: Overall
column2: I have to give this place 4/5 stars because even though the quality of the food isn't amazing (3 or 4 stars)
column3: they make up for it with the price
column4: quantity
column5: and service. If you're in New Orleans and looking for a good place to stuff yourself with seafood without breaking your pocket
column6: then come here. If I ever visit New Orleans again
column7: I will definitely come back.";30/09/2016 20:28

column1: i2tYJ0j5I-6NWOPSGJMJIA;wX8vrInWJPR0Gf0o9fKnNw;qYe7k9E0OJrQPJYGiDIw-A;5;0;0;0;Perfect. A true dining experience. This really is a hidden gem in Edmonton. I was reminded of the best meals I enjoyed while living in France. There is obvious care and attention paid to every detail here. It's also a beautifully designed restaurant. There's a romantic ambiance. We liked that the large window into the kitchen was a feature of the dining area
column2: on display

column1: The servers were friendly & efficient

column4: I didn't touch the plate at all

column1: We started with the beer cheese and it was disappointing at first. The cheese appeared to be a bowl of cold cheese wiz with some garnish on top. However

column4: but not as spicy as he expected with the name gumbo. I had the Burgermeister and oh my it was delish! I had fries as my side and though they were great

column1: Why not?
Remember the four of us were very hungry and perhaps thinking along the lines of ""QUANTITY"" in lieu of ""QUALITY""

We were greeted by the hostess but before taking a table we checked out the buffet... obviously we weren't in the right mindset to know what we were getting into.  At that moment we all agreed it looked and smelled wonderful.  We accepted a table and made our way to the buffet...
No one finished their first plate and I was the only glutton for punishment that decided to make another plate.  There must be something we like
column2: right?  NOPE
column3: I was very incorrect with that assumption.

column1: Perhaps someone slipped us something earlier and we hallucinating to think it looked and smelled good.  Maybe our hunger just got the best of us.  Or we just simply screwed up

column3: but these were a bit too creamy with not a lot of texture. The shrimp were small and nothing to write home about. My friend had the fried chicken. column1: flaizseg0ywSmLtfntcVAg;BzI_ymnLZJC2KY1autQeeQ;6Ty-KKWq6hLZYW8DWEHYvg;5;0;0;0;"Pat O'Briens is SO MUCH FUN!  Not only are the drinks incredibly strong and DAMN tasty (The Hurricane = A Slushy Red cup of Alcohol and Loving coolness in the Gulf heat); but
column2: the Piano Bar is such an enjoyable and different experience (especially after a cane or deux)!

column1: Consisting of a bunch of bars with two huge patios and pianos
column2: Patty O's was one of my most memorable experiences as a tourist in a foreign city.  At the Piano Bar (where i spent most of my time)
column3: two amazing artists duel by means of audience requests written out on napkins in the dark.  Everybody in the severely dim lighted audience gazes and sings along together with the women at the piano playing renditions of random requests.  Mirrors above the pianos magnify the music and the entire experience.

column1: They offer some sort of discount
column2: where you can keep the signature Hurricane cup and pay less for the bill-doesnt really matter; just go
column3: REQUEST
column4: SING

column1: OYjGhKLQ9GQyE3iYiGxdRw;JCllOAD7kboeUBAjLTTF_Q;wj8XtPyuREj8_0GQz3LZ6w;5;0;0;0;"Curb appeal of zero.  Don't let that dissuade you - inside it's a gem.
Portions are big and food quality is TIP TOP.
I rolled in around 9:20 for dinner on a whim.  I was shocked at how nice the venue is.  I sat at the bar
column2: ordered a cool one
column3: and went over the menu.  Looked good
column4: but then the chef

column1: The bar is facing an open kitchen.  Not an open kitchen across the yonder - It's close
column2: in direct line-of-sight.  Very brave for an open kitchen
column3: and I saw nothing there that made me regret seating
column4: which is rare for a production kitchen.  Nothing was held in chafing dishes; everything is made fresh to order.

column1: Food is much better than the hub
column2: and although prices may be comparable
column3: the portions and quality are far better.   I had a mushroom soup (VERY good
column4: and for the quality of ingredients and cooking
column5: a bargain at 6$)
column6: and a Las Cruces Salad (or santa fe? I can't recall - the food coma is setting in).  The salad is an unrestrained orgy of fresh fruit and lettuce
column7: a very fresh raspberry vinegarette
column8: topped with chili-crusted grilled chicken.  The chicken was PERFECTLY cooked
column9: very tender
column10: very fresh.  I'd murder to find a mango that perfect at a grocery
column11: and they seem to have them on hand
column12: along with fresh drupes
column13: strawberries
column14: and stonefruits in spades.

column1: Wine pours are generous
column2: service was swift and knowledgeable
column3: and friendly.  Soup came with a quarter loaf of fresh
column4: lightly toasted sourdough and european butter.  (They didn't toot their own horn about the european butter - it was a pleasant surprise.)

column1: Although I sat at the bar
column2: the seating in the back looked good romantic.

column1: Only drawbacks are:
1. I didn't see any big tables that would accommodate a large group.
2. This place is soon to be very popular
column2: and it'll mean lines.  For now
column3: get in while you can.

column1: An entree off the ""daily specials menu""
column2: a bowl of soup
column3: and a beer totaled up at $25.  You bet your sweet buns they earned a 25% good tip.

column1: Cheers.
~Mike
If you have a date
column2: bring them here for date night.  If you don't
column3: rectify the situation STAT so you can bring somebody here for date night.  Bring a friend
column4: bring a stranger.  Bring your multiple personalities.  Just get yourself in the seats!";29/05/2013 05:48

column1: 2mdLQdq4GlwE2B-vdE016A;WfQCjeLy2BzDNiez737lrg;vG2fn6N79dHUp7rrYOeT_w;2;1;0;0;"This review is about their staff... I'm not sure if I should be mad at the nurses/ receptionists or Dr. Jessica Williams. Total Women Health & Wellness is a very clean environment with very nice staff (hence the two stars). My insurance changed in January so I could no longer afford my low dose birth control. I asked to be switched to the generic (which the nurse made me look up on my own and spell to her over the phone). They prescribed me the regular dose
column2: so then I submitted a request for my brand name medication to be approved for coverage that Dr. Williams had to sign and fax. It explained what happened when I tried the regular dose
column3: so she knew
column4: unless it was thrown away after they faxed it back to my insurance company. That was declined so I called back and said ""Here's a small list of medications my insurance company will cover. Please prescribe me a LOW DOSE option of one of these. The most important part is LOW DOSE."" Somewhere down the line of that message reaching Dr. Williams ""low does"" was omitted and I was prescribed the regular dose. I vented to my pharmacist about it and he said ""They DO make a low dose version of the generic drug she's prescribing you... it's new so maybe she doesn't know about it. I'll call her and recommend it for you."" As a doctor myself
column5: I was so disappointed with the way this situation was handled. I do the research on what medications are available
column6: and if I'm unsure I call a friend who's a pharmacist. Then I call the patient myself and make sure I understand what they're asking for (i understand my field is a little less demanding than ob/gyn... but still. I never spoke to the doctor once throughout this whole ordeal). I was VERY unhappy with the customer service here and I'm debating on finding another place to go. Aside from the kind smiles and clean environment
column7: I wouldn't recommend going here.";17/01/2016 16:03

Walgreens is right across the street and since they've done their renovation is actually quite nice.  Not sure when I'll go back to this one again. Rudeness. column2: it's not Chicago or New York or Los Angeles...it's Greenwood
column3: dude. Their house salad dressing is one of my favorites and their volcano roll is prepared differently than I've had it at most places and it's the best.

column1: I've always thought that the hibachi thing was a bit on the gimmicky side. It's something similar to expecting the people at Papa John's to answer the phone with ""Allo...disisa a da Papa John's howa can I helpa you"". Expecting the chef to do the onion volcano seven times a night and be all smiles is bordering on mockery to me and its unrealistic. Give them a break.
It is not the best representation of a Japanese steakhouse in the state and the staff can be a bit cold at times

GrM7RaBNzM97GD4HUe6l8Q;cyCg_Z_CVrxMjzkP2LdVCg;oyuClKvOF8xJtouTaISCAw;5;1;0;0;Best cat care ever! I have had 5 cats in the last 30 years. When I moved to Nashville 10 years ago my 16 year old Oriental Shorthair was very traumatized and developed IBS. The first vet I took him to was so cold when she told me there was nothing to do but put him down. I then took him to Nashville Cat Clinic. I was so impressed with their kind concerned attitude. They did not downplay the seriousness of his condition
column2: but did give me some hope. Due to their care and several medicines he did live 6 more pain free happy months. When I did have to make the horribly difficult decision to put him to sleep the caring doctors and staff were wonderful and helped to make his passing peaceful. I now have two rescues and for the past five years they yearly go to Nashville Cat Clinic. Everyone there is so nice and they take great care of my babies. Their prices are very reasonable also. I have lived in 4 different states in the last 30 years and their prices are much lower than in any clinic where my cats have been patients. I highly recommend these wonderful caring professionals.;19/08/2015 06:04

column7: really great picks for excellent prices.

column1: 4A2LBdIX_BG8XzBcIK2waQ;wzfRM-aut9_K4mLEpQFSwQ;kaW1wIGEVtLtAEIgHm_PQg;4;2;3;1;"I am a bit bias to The Mack because it is the first place I went when I began my love affair with South City. The Mack is one of my all-time favorite places
column2: mainly because it is like a sports bar/dance club/townie bar all rolled into one.  The mixed drinks are all served in pint glasses
column3: which is dangerously fun. My favorite drink there is the ""Ninja Water
column4: which consists of water
column5: berry vodka
column6: and a splash of cranberry juice. Why do they call it the Ninja Water? Because these sneak up on you like a ninja. Pace yourself
column7: I have fallen victim to the ninja water a few times.

column1: If you like bar food
column2: then the Mack is a good choice. If you are feeling like splurging
column3: opt for the fried pickles
column4: which are fried to perfection and served alongside a creamy ranch. The Mack also has an incredible buffalo chicken sandwich which is fried and served on a hoagie with pepperjack cheese and ranch. Dang.

column1: The girls that work at The Mack are so friendly and they create awesome drinks. I love to run up to the bar and say
column2: surprise me!"" and they always do. Check out their shot menu above the bar for a list of nearly 100 different shots that they know by heart! This place is ideal for bachelorette parties that want to hang out without getting harassed.  Anyway
column3: chances are if you stop by the Mack
column4: you might see me. Say hi!";03/08/2013 17:01

XRTDUSG-KzeU8dEhDisE5g;yF5d7_UzvWroVju3rrrVtg;mc9V_wG4QyRYew9_S8R44A;5;0;0;0;"One word ""Awesome!""

We couldn't get a reservation (our fault for trying to book last minute on a Saturday night) so we called and asked if the bar was busy at happy hour time. The friendly lady on the phone said it wasn't
column2: but at 7PM (when happy hour ended) the bar would be packed. She was right! We got there around 5:30 and decided to enjoy a couple appetizers and happy hour drinks to take advantage of the happy hour discount. It was dead when we got there. We left close to 8:30 and the place was slammed packed!

column1: The bartender we got was very helpful
column2: friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and Seafood as well
column3: so it was great chatting with her about selections and what makes Eddie V's so popular and good.

column1: We really loved the menu.... It was unique and had so many great seafood items on it. They offered some nice looking meat (steak and such) options
column2: but the seafood was amazing
column3: it was hard to pick something! So
column4: we let our bartender pick; she suggested the Red Fish and the Seabass. Both were prepared and plated perfectly! Portion sizes were huge too! The Seabass was the thickest we've ever seen and it was done perfectly!

column1: The shrimp cocktail was really nice! Their ""atomic horseradish"" (which came with the shrimp cocktail) was incredibly tasty and sooo hot! Only suggestion I would have is that they're should give you an empty ramekin to custom-mix your cocktail sauce.
The drinks and the wine menu were just as amazing as the seafood menu! They offered so many good wines by the glass! Their wine bottle selection has all the greats and then some!
They have an incredible and unique dessert menu as well! Most places have ""typical"" desserts.... Not EV's
column2: they had some unique options that made it very difficult to choose just one. Their Bananas Foster Cake was outstanding!

column1: This was our first visit to an Eddie V's. We live not too far from one in the Northern VA area
column2: but have never gone... We're looking forward to going there now! When we travel
column3: we rarely go to a chain of any kind
column4: we prefer local flavors
column5: but this was truly a delight and well worth the visit!

column1: If you want a great dinner and are looking for a nice place
column2: don't look past Eddie V's.... Stop here and enjoy!";07/03/2016 01:35

column1: FRVq_f-qMRWwPjplUl_Crg;IlRmSTn19xM2Vi7xtjzAhw;vl4uDnmI6lM9zBcAR--84w;4;1;0;1;"I recently read about Deke's on one of the area food websites.  It's close to home so I figured that this warm weather would be perfect for some outdoor dining and some BBQ.  My trusty dining companion and I schlepped up the hill and saddled up to a picnic table.  While it took a few minutes for someone to actually tend to us
column2: it was quite the experience from that point on.

column1: Deke himself came over and chatted with us
column2: explaining what meats were available and what he personally recommended.  What was most impressive to me was that he wasn't necessarily just telling us to order the most expensive item on the menu - he asked us what kind of food we liked first.  In all of my dining experiences I have never had the chef sit down at my table and ask about my preferences and then make a recommendation based on that.

column1: Our server was a little bumbling
column2: I will admit
column3: and that's part of the reason for only four stars.  He knew the menu
column4: sort of
column5: but got a little tripped up on his own suggestions.  He was nice enough
column6: and I think with time he will get there
column7: but that wasn't our experience.

column1: We ordered the chicken and ribs combo as well as a side of mac and cheese.  DC took on the challenge of eating the half-chicken while I dove into the half-rack of spare ribs.  DC's chicken was amazing.  One of the juiciest pieces of chicken I have ever had.  I thought it was a little charred on the outside
column2: and I could do without the tub of extra sauce on the side
column3: but otherwise it was divine.  To me
column4: the side sauce tasted almost like watered down molasses - not all that pleasant.

column1: My ribs were also quite good.  They literally fell off the bone and had a great smoky flavor.  Also a little charred on the outside
column2: but still amazingly good.

column1: The mac and cheese was really good as well.  The serving size was a little small for the price
column2: but the flavor was good with a little kick of heat.  The only issue I had was that there was a layer of melted cheese on top which made the first few bites a little greasy.  Without that melted cheese
column3: I would have been much more impressed.

column1: As others have mentioned
column2: the cornbread is sweet and moist
column3: and i would welcome that as a bar snack at 1am.  It is delicious.  The drinks
column4: however
column5: do add up.  While there is a special on the menu where you get six tallboys for $12
column6: if you only want one beer with your meal it is about $5 for anything other than bud light.

column1: In all this was a great meal.  I would definitely go to Deke's before I went to the other two BBQ places in Manayunk.  When you can see the man outside next to the smoker
column2: and he comes over and chats with you about what's on the grill
column3: it all adds up to a great experience with some damn good food.";27/05/2011 13:35

column1: uwIsr3q5g56tXKpMyELbqQ;L8LoKsZ9zncFoqqf5RiYgA;83KdaW9JNrCnlaNl_u7NiA;4;4;3;4;"Look at me
column2: venturing out to the 'burbs again. I went to Fuji a couple of days ago with my current crush and her BFF. The restaurant is tucked away in a strip mall but you forget about the locale as soon as you're seated and your wine bottle(s) uncorked. It's a BYOB and I'm not sure if I should be proud or embarrassed to state that the three of us went through three bottles of wine and one of sake that night. We started off with edamame (I made an exception to my ""no green food"" rule and was pleasantly surprised) and pillowy
column3: tender shumai. As we were finishing the last bite of appetizers
column4: a giant sushi boat docked on our table. I'm not even sure what all we ordered
column5: but I think I mostly ate the maguro
column6: hamachi and unagi nigiri. Everything was fresh and expertly prepared
column7: and for once I was able to nibble my sushi without it falling apart. (I refuse to stick the whole darn thing in my mouth at once. I'm delicate like that.) And to top it off
column8: the staff waited patiently as we (the last patrons in the place) got all sorts of tipsy
column9: not rushing us out even though it was after closing time.";30/04/2008 20:21

column1: de7sl0T74qSGSMIkjLDjiw;I06gY9An4o81XpejLWD9DA;HJ59vXwm0gsS-w6lY9MEXA;2;0;0;0;"I once liked Pei Wei. The Innovative modular menu and the Americanized Chinese food which was not in anyway authentic but which was appealing. Unfortunately they've gone down the road of pop culture far too much. The last time I went I had Dan Dan noodles which I've had in many restaurants all over the world. Basically it's a slightly spicy ground beef and noodle dish. Pei Wei's version is made with chicken I know that I've had it there before. Only
column2: in its latest iteration it's sweet. This dish is never sweet. And in fact that's the case with their whole menu everything has been sweetened and more sauce been put on it. There are some other touch I don't like for instance if you want water they give you a very small glass. And then there are your fellow diners at the self-service setup station many of which will stand there for a long time hogging the entire setup completely unaware that there's anyone else trying to get in any of the condiments or beverages.

column1: All in all the food is no longer good and the dining experience is not pleasant.";19/06/2018 14:21

column1: QD9lJEopd2rkmv20SRhcsA;8jjjhTDBqTsXCok4DvGHGg;wImCKPqb1FvOIBPhXpUZTA;5;10;0;2;"I've been to this theatre four times
column2: twice in the regular theatres and twice in the VIP theatres.  This is easily my favorite Cineplex in the city.  In both types of theatres the seats are large and comfortable
column3: and the sound and picture quality has always been excellent.

column1: I especially like the VIP area.  There is so much leg room I can stretch out or cross my legs without worrying about hitting the seats in front of me.  The seats are set up in pairs
column2: so it is great for a date night.  I love the ""loveseat"" feeling of the pairs of seats
column3: and it feels like a real luxury to not be crowded next to people you don't know.   I wouldn't recommend it for a group of three though
column4: one person is going to end up feeling separated from the other two.  Both times I've eaten in the theatres
column5: the food has been very good
column6: and not overpriced.  If you want a better menu
column7: order in the area outside the theatres (where the bar is set up).  The menu is whole booklet rather than a single laminated card
column8: and you can ask for boxes to take your food into the theatre if you can't finish it on the plate.

column1: Buying tickets on cheap Tuesday makes the VIP much more reasonable
column2: and I feel like the VIP extras are worth the money.";10/04/2013 17:16

column1: #NOME?;Ve2A-T6C-r_3hbiIkvusXg;dTgkIBVWavTBqxcJqPPtVA;1;0;0;0;"Had The worst experience today for my daughter's birthday party. When we arrived the place was extremely hot inside. When I asked if AC was working they said they had two camps right before us but  that AC was working; after the first 20 on the first area and asking again what was going on they admitted AC wasn't working and they had called the company but haven't get there yet. After a horrible almost an hour on the bounce areas kids (and parents) sweating and everybody going to the party room to drink water (that I had to request to be offered not that they offered by initiative)  finally went to party room for pizza and cake that was another hard time the room had not air what so ever coming in the moisture of the air made the floor slippery kids were falling. So after 2 hours of torture the y pass me the bill no discount what so ever no apology no nothing. Manager said only owner can reduce bill and I couldn't walk out of the place with my things (gifts and food leftovers) spoke to owner who told me if I didn't want to pay the bill they will call police. So yes police got involved and no Bounce u did not offered any discounts no even by the fact police told them they should care about customer service and get to and agreement. Thank you for ruining my daughters birthday!! Never again and none of the 20 guests that attended will give you their business since I emailed them the details of the situation.";13/08/2016 02:46

j3fo6CJbaDHFCq_8FFr1Vw;RYeY30XyjFQ7B4sITi8iag;9xPOQKtIDVaI_fN3ns35LA;5;1;1;1;"Fat Dan's deserves a 5/5 stars because there is not a thing that I would change or want more from them. My boyfriend is a Cubs fan so he was pumped that a Cubbie bar is now in our neighborhood. So I decided to join in and discover a new watering hole in walking/stumbling distance from my apartment. The beer selection is great! I love trying new beers and Fat Dan's keeps their tap list from becoming a stagnant chalk board or repeats.

Another thing that I like about Fat Dan's is how they serve their food. It comes out on a big piece of butcher (maybe) paper and the servers hold the corners so that it serves as a tray for just long enough to get the food to the table.
Any place with outdoor seating will tempt me. Fat Dan's does just that. I am also looking forward to enjoying the big garage doors even in the winter.";14/07/2016 20:33
dIDL9HjwKDvpjCpFIOWo3w;Y2_jD0gLsZrV3ZUmez9l9A;dl0k_EKOOSwsN9DOXMrznA;1;3;0;0;I have used this company for several years
column2: without there being any issues the past couple years. There is usually some difficulty during holidays. Tonight
column3: I called for a taxi and after about 10-15 min I receive a text that a taxi is 10 miles away. After about 30 min of receiving the text
column4: I called back to check on the status. The cab was cancelled with no notification. So I reordered a taxi and was told it was not busy tonight and that a cab would arrive in 5-20 min. After waiting another 20 min
column5: I called in to check on the status. I was told the taxi was 1 minute away. After another 10 min of waiting
column6: I called back to check the status and was told the cab no showed. Again with no notification. My boyfriend then ordered a taxi
column7: which did show up
column8: but after waiting over 1.5 hours
column9: my plans completely fell thru. One of their dispatchers
column10: Jennifer
column11: called and left my boyfriend a message about how they called and called and the taxi was waiting. I called the dispatcher about what was going on and to cancel the taxi
column12: who again said that they tried to reach me for the current taxi. I let her know that I had been waiting for so long and that my plans are now cancelled because of the wait. Of course there were no solutions or recourse. I called the taxi back and let him know that I no longer needed their services after waiting for so long and poor communication with the dispatcher. We also tried to reach Jennifer about her message of them calling and calling
column13: to let her know this was after me trying for over 1.5 hours to get a cab. I was prepared and took out cash earlier
column14: in case I ended up in a taxi that at the end of the ride surprisingly(shadily) charged a surcharge for using a debit/credit card. I was a bit apprehensive about Uber but now I will try Uber from now on. Perhaps they will provide better communication and customer service. Thank you county yellow cab for ruining my night.;30/01/2016 06:08

MBVJ_QQgazmmjf7DJalf0A;E-rsiTokCKMtbPLGZHHiTA;VqXqBWHiiVJ9ysfQ3kDbLg;1;3;0;0;"I can say this was the worst experience ever
column2: and the employees are just as worse as the Owner/Manager ""Anthony"".I don't even know where to start and let's start from the beginning. I was there 08/02/2013 and I called from the beginning and was coming from Orange County to help my sister in law move back from Santa Barbara. Thought this was going to be an easy experience
column3: but guess what... Uhaul made it the worse experience! I called in to purchase a hitch and have it installed. they said they would be able to do it and have me out that same day and with a box trailer going one way... The moment i got there around 12pm the place was full with customers and there was only one person in the back counter and it was some young white male which was dressed very tacky! he had a string holding up his sagging pants and did not know anything. (Assuming he was a new associate)

column1: By the time i got to the front of the line I told them about me and they said ""You are crazy if we can have the hitch installed today?!"" That got me really frustrated and they said there was 2 cars having their hitch installed and said they can do it the next day! I explained i came all the way from Orange County and missed work for this
column2: I cannot wait another day for this to be installed
column3: especially after i made an appt. Then he show me the hitch and said here you go... WTF??? Then it was all scratched up and paint was missing on some of the hitch so i was over that guy and another guy (Younger mexican guy
column4: assuming who was new also who helped him) I asked to speak to the store manager or the owner. Then Anthony came out 15 minutes later and i told him sorry if you were on lunch or were busy. Then he commented rudely saying ""yeah i was and i really don't want to be up here right now?"" I wrote all of this down at that moment and remember every phrase. (I am a supervisor for a customer service center :) ) Then Anthony gave me an attitude as well saying we can't do anything for me and all his little employees were just laughing and watching us bicker about my situation like it was a comedy show. I felt be little and felt like an idiot! He told me that he can have it installed the next day or even Monday. (2 days later) I even offered if I paid them extra they would install it that day. He laughed and smirked and gave me this jerk response saying we don't do business like that? Then i asked where else can i get this install because its simple and 6 bolts. It would take no longer then 20 - 30 minutes to install. (Watched it on youtube) Anthony made a comment saying you don't know what you are talking about and it takes hours to install? ( gave up at this point with them)

column1: Then i was done with them and we both agreed to give me a discount on the hitch since it was badly scratched and paint was missing on some of it. Then he said to get it installed elsewhere. I just paid for it and said i will be back and i had to drive all around town to find somebody to install it since Uhaul over promised something they couldn't do!!!! I then found a friendly place around the corner which was their competitor. They installed it in 25 minutes and got me on my way!

Now i got back to the Uhaul location again and dealt with the younger mexican college student this time which i am assuming is new also. This took me about 45 minutes to get back to the front of the line. I then asked I have a reservation for the 6' x 12' box trailer and then he said no you didn't? OMG! I said i was just in here and you guys had it on hold with my hitch trailer! Then he said i remember you and will give you a box trailer that is for somebody else and that just came back. I told him i don't care where he gets it from and i just spent the last couple of hours finding a place to install the hitch since you guys weren't able to do it and lied to me! I then pulled around back the enter way and he got mad at me saying to go through the exit back way? I then told him why? He commented that it is easier to stay away from some of the cameras? I don't know what's going on at this point
column2: but i don't care. This place was shady from the start
column3: but there is more!

column1: When I hooked up my 2001 Acura MDX to it he then said let's do the paperwork. I didn't think about anything at this moment
column2: but went back inside since there was a line out the door and i wanted out of there. I then Was about to sign and they commented that everything was okay on the box trailer and i said I don't know since you didn't let me inspect it. I then told him i like to inspect the box trailer before leaving and he said ""Fine"" with an attitude and terrible body language.

column1: There was a few hits and scratches and he said don't worry the other location that you are dropping off in Orange County will inspect it and he said it will be okay. I said sure? Then he said ""Yes"" don't worry about it and just tell them it was there already. I am dropping it off tomorrow and see what happens. Seems shady !!!!!!!";03/08/2013 14:53

column1: You can sit at the bar or at the hightops
column2: booth
column3: table

column1: I got the Ultimate Fish Sandwich (blackened) and it was delicious!  It satisfied my craving for fish.  The french fries are steak cut (my fiance said they looked like fried apple wedges).  They weren't great
column2: but they weren't bad either.  One of these days I'm going to be strong enough to substitute out fries for something healthy
column3: but it is not that day yet.  My fiance got the Chicken Marsala and got pasta instead of the mashed potatoes and asparagus it comes with.  This was a great choice
column4: because the pasta (I think it was spaghetti) with the sauce was to die for.  There was a slight sweetness to it that I loved.

column1: Although this place is easy to miss

I also enjoyed some bourbon barrel aged beer that was absolutely awesome!   I think it is $14 a glass and well worth it.    My wife had a rasberry pear cider that was recommended by Kim

column1: Ka4moQS1l3EFghOnlPdeWQ;BVoZpA7nsDNKlpbyI0PxqQ;S2E4evy30DRWn66RbZZbTw;2;1;0;0;I decided to stop by Cha Cha's for lunch before attending the Ray's game. As I was perusing the menu a waitress gavel a friendly greeting and invited me to sit anywhere I wanted. I went out on the windy outdoor deck and sat down. This is where things went bad. I sat for 15 minutes and
column2: even though numerous wait staff passed me

column4: grilled with fries. It was quite good despite a lack of seasoning. The beer I ordered was cold and refreshing. column1: My friend and I both went for ""Double Downs"" (two meats and two sides).  I had the pulled pork and chicken with pinto beans and sweet potatoes. He had pork belly and brisket

column3: but I don't really like baked beans.  No matter

column1: Sauces come on the side in sweet
column2: original

column1: Beers come in Mason jars with handles!

They also have iPads to play with at select counters and tables. What's more fun than eating frozen yogurt? Playing fruit ninja WHILE eating frozen yogurt
column5: clearly.

column1: This place is cool if you're 22 or 8 years old

column2: quaint spot with excellent food. The tuna sandwich is scrumptious and I had a cinnamon sugar doughnut filled with a homemade vanilla filling. I don't even like doughnuts with filling
column3: but tried it because the guy helping me highly recommended it. Like he suggested
column4: it was unbelievably good! My only problem was the parking. The only parking I saw nearby was a lot that charged $24.00?! I decided to run into the bakery and order to go in order to avoid this crazy high charge. When I mentioned it to the people taking my order they recommended I go to the car and move it. He said the parking lot is highly monitored and that I could get a bid on it immediately. Sure enough when I got back to my car there was a guy walking around checking all of the cars. They were so kind as I was with my differently angled daughter (who doesn't walk) to actually meet me out front to get my order
column5: but the poor parking options is a deterrent for sure and the only reason I can't give this place 5 stars!;04/10/2018 16:19

column3: and since he left so has the efficiency of this pharmacy. Today
column4: I decided that after nine years it was time to try a new pharmacy location.

column1: Store: I asked the pharmacy to ring up three items with my prescription. Since my prescription wasn't ready
column2: I did some light shopping. Low and behold
column3: one of the items was overcharged. So I went to the customer service station by the check stand. And waited...and waited... I asked a cashier if she could please call someone to the customer service desk and she said she would be there in a minute and seemed annoyed that I even asked her for assistance.  While I was at the register an older lady parked herself at customer service. Finally a manager came up and started to assist the other lady. I was a little more than annoyed
column4: as she just assumed the older lady was first. When she couldn't easily solve her problem
column5: she came to assist me.

column1: Long story short
column2: this Safeway use to be my place for groceries and prescriptions. It is sad to see the decline in the friendliness in this location and lack of overall customer service. There are other grocery stores and pharmacies that actually value your patronage and this is not one of them.";15/04/2018 19:04

I brought the Fish filet back to the restaurant and was served by the rudest worker. When I told her what was wrong she yelled out with an attitude
column3: ""Can y'all make a fish without black stuff in the box?!"" The manager was standing right at the counter and never acknowledged me or my problem. They were so busy having loud conversations with their friends visiting the restaurant. I was so upset that when they gave me the sandwich that I didn't bother to check it. I guess they figured they'd teach me a lesson because when I got home one of the cooks had stabbed my bun about four times with their finger. I got in touch with the owner and she pretended that she couldn't figure out who was working there that day. Really??? At your restaurant? Ok. She offered me a small credit to go back for another meal but I never went back. I had spent $10 to $12 in that place. What a joke. column2: here is my opinion of Provence. The food is good but not earth shattering. The coffee is good but not earth shattering. The desserts are pretty darn good so I really have to give them props there. However

column1: cC4sf3etnZj9QNnAI_uaXg;BHMjELic2tES4Zr_nTyRog;AJ1-2fZZWPgpq40CmZapTw;4;1;0;1;"Just what my husband was looking for.  My son and I were on the search for ice cream and he wanted a good coffee.  Found this place on Yelp and directed him to it
column2: then went for ice cream for the rest of us.

column1: The place was modern and edgy
column2: not warm and inviting like I consider many coffee shops.  I think I felt that way because the design was mostly done in wood and metal
column3: and a little concrete
column4: very little color in the mix and no comfy chairs
column5: or bubbly handwriting.  The menu board describes where each coffee available was from and the flavor notes in each with prices displayed beside them.  The cheapest poured coffee was somewhere in the $4+ range for a small cup.

column1: I'm not sure we were greeted when we walked in because I was too busy trying to decipher the menu board which was less the lattes and specialty drinks and more focused on the pour overs and espresso.

My husband chose a 1&1 which was an espresso shot in a small cup of pour over coffee which came in at $5.  I didn't realize pour over meant they did it right when you ordered so it took awhile to get his cup ready.  The coffee hit the spot for him and was just what he was looking for.  I like a decent cup of black coffee but it was too rich and bitter for me.  I think he would frequent the place if it were close to home and the price wasn't so much.
They are a ""mission"" shop raising $ to dig wells in poor countries
column2: which may explain part of the cost.  But $4-5 for a small cup is quite a lot
column3: I think.  I wonder if charging less and having a basket for donations may benefit their project and their shop more.  It may drive more traffic to them anyway.";07/04/2017 23:47

GtK4ozF_Po2kjH-0JqvlTQ;GU0uHdWoekRWOqtMYlbsSQ;nfDNbJ3eWwudtQCyp2EpSw;1;1;0;0;I've been to Roberto's for years and have always had wonderful meals with exceptional service
column2: until tonight. Server was slow
column3: inattentive and sloppy. Our food was brought out and placed in the main thoroughfare between the bar and dining room. It sat there for a good 5 minutes with lots of people passing by as our server chatted with the table closest to the tray of food. She then proceeded to pass our table and check on a table in the back of the dining room. Then she went to run the check of the first table - next to our cooking food with loads of people walking past. Then she comes back and starts to deliver the food. When I brought up the fact that our food had been sitting there
column4: she failed to apologize just said I didn't know it was there. I refused my meal
column5: 5 others with me took their meals which were already cold. Later a hostess offered to prepare me a new meal and when I declined and asked for the check she left. If you can believe it
column6: we still had to wait for our check. Worst service and even worse attempt at service recovery from the hostess/manager. I'm sad to say I will not be returning to Roberto's
column7: I will miss many of his wonderful dishes. But at the end of the day there are many better restaurants with better service in the city and I won't waste my time at Roberto's again.;14/05/2017 02:07

column1: QlZ3OoaxFtL91HJrACW-rQ;9B7V3xkmkSmnbsrzkNQNJA;FQskkrIuNMKRCQJuokI8gQ;5;2;1;2;"How good is the ice cream at Jeni's?
It's ""only-in-Nashville-for-twenty-four-hours-but-stopped-by-twice"" good.
It's ""close-your-eyes-while-eating-their-samples"" good.
It's ""ruin-all-other-ice-creams"" good.
It's ""start-coming-up-with-ridiculous-ideas-like-opening-up-a-franchise-in-Louisville-just-so-you-can-eat-their-ice-cream-all-the-time"" good.
During our two visits to Jeni's
column2: my wife and I tried five different flavors. The Pumpkin 5-spice was okay. The Riesling Poached Pear Sorbet was good. And the Salty Caramel
column3: the Pistachio & Honey and the Milkiest Chocolate in the World were AMAZING.

column1: Loved the fact that they give you two ""half-scoops"" so you can enjoy multiple flavors. Loved the fact that they make their own waffle cones and waffle wedges right there at the shop. Loved the genuinely happy service as we tried flavor after flavor after flavor. Loved the fact that they have mastered the balance between an amazing ice cream base and out-of-this-world flavor combinations. Hate the fact that ice cream has effectively been ruined for my wife.";09/10/2012 14:26

NOT friendly and knew basically nothing about their drinks etc.  SLOW SLOW SLOW.  This place is to be just one more small business to fail.  The folks working who I assume to be owners had no personality and not friendly at all.  One would think when you have a new business and it is dead and clients walk in you would say ""welcome""!!  ""How can we help you and thanks for coming in""!  NOT a word!  Strawberry smoothies if that is what you call them were ice finely blended with some strawberry syrup or something. column1: fxEoLJp5wTyw2sc5dmktrA;1IjOtLxxU9aUdXHwBCu1kw;7LJ5P0iUzkoe48fWKlArQg;1;6;0;0;"Terrible customer service.  I got a Group-on to try out the mani/pedi before my graduation.  When I called Kelly was booked out for months because she allowed too many.

I called hours before my appointment to see if I could cancel because I'm am extremely ill.  They did not call me back until after my appointment started to tell me that I needed to cancel 24 hours in advance and they would not honor the group-on.  If they would have called me earlier I would have gone in anyway instead of losing my money and appointment altogether.  So why didn't they call me back in time?  Because Kelly already filled my appointment with another customer.  So she lost no money or time but did will not reschedule with me or honor the group on
column2: because she simply didn't want to.  If she really wanted to gain new customers with the group-on why did she treat me so poorly?  I'm not a group-on I'm a customer.";03/08/2013 18:34

column1: yHysRi0k5M4wO5o8MD4_7A;iqli1JO6WoNmRpb2FUKAZw;_mL3Bf0XwDLKvguY8vWr3w;5;0;1;0;"I LOVE International Market!  This Thai owned family restaurant has been around 30+ years.  My family used to walk down the street to eat here as a child.  The food is delicious and still reasonably priced in an age where everything seemd to be skyrocketing.  Although their delicious papaya juice is no longer ""on tap""

column4: the eggplant
column5: and bamboo shoots are some of my favorite dishes.  You can now even order specialty dishes from the kitchen in addition to ordering from the buffet classics.  For dessert

column8: or a fortune cookie!

column1: The atmosphere here is casual and colorful with art
column2: instruments
column3: and import items displayed on the walls

column1: UVAHUbZsodWYNySlNtY-DQ;qzD17n4aofqv5dSg9OV7sw;Nm-4YHhit9Z0x8yMo5oS1w;5;0;0;0;"Sullivan's pulled out all the stops for my husband's birthday dinner!
It was our first time dining here and we decided to give it a shot for the special occasion. Everything was awesome. We each ordered a special which included a salad
column2: entree and dessert. Both salads were great and very nice sized portions. The market greens salad is dressed with a vinaigrette that I will definitely remember. Both steaks were very good with yummy sides as well. The au gratin potatoes were my favorite. Finally
column3: dessert! Both the cheesecake and the bananas foster bread pudding were to die for. We left feeling like we needed to be rolled out the door. During dessert they offered to take our picture and even put it in a cute little keepsake frame.

column1: Would I go here every weekend? Probably not - it's a high end steakhouse and my budget nor my appetite can handle that. But for this occasion it was absolutely perfect and we couldn't have picked a better spot!";18/07/2017 22:12

I3W7MnIYIjatoTIVYBrV7g;ZYRoZKE8lS4_rdicrxZVCQ;6Dl208HmUExucqpRMFxBvg;5;3;0;3;I am writing a review to set the record straight. I was at Kindness this morning for brunch and it was very busy. The staff was dealing with parties of ten or more (one was 18). We came in with a party of 3 and were seated immediately. We were given waters and a menu. After receiving our drinks our waitress took our order ( I can't remember her name
column2: but she had multi colored nails). We got our food within 20 minutes and everything was spot on!  My only complaint is NOT about the restaurant
column3: but the other customers that couldn't wait for their food graciously. Come on kids

column1: UUumggj9esV-qJV2juRl8Q;0B9izUXi_Z4hcbUkm96wnA;23qa5SsahSsVhqAVmX6aow;5;0;0;0;Never had a bad meal here....today we tried the new beet salad...beets were warm...delicious...the chili was hearty and meaty..not soupy...a little heat...filling and great!....next came the cuban..YUM..and the sweet potatoes chips were hands down the best we've ever had...the arugula and prosciutto salad was pretty basic...I wish there was more prosciutto and shaved parmesan  considering the large amount of arugula that came with the salad. column1: 4yBebkWZgYpXQlsvdLWKeQ;x-aHM9y-vc5l2-XK4G6z1A;oG295sC_isxfKmarlPrD4Q;3;1;0;0;"We stopped in for dinner here before going to the comedy club (Side Splitters) next door. It looks like your typical Irish pub/sports bar. There are lots of TVs around and there is also an area for live music.
I had been to the Maloney's in downtown Tampa for drinks before and had the wings so I figured it would be similar.
My husband and I shared a sampler app platter that comes with chicken tenders
column2: potato skins and cheese sticks. It was ok. The strips are small but good
column3: the potato skins could use some salsa with them
column4: the cheese sticks were good. We did get to try two wing sauces with this platter though
column5: the car bomb (which is hot) and the Asian ginger (which has an awesome flavor.) My husband ordered two 5 piece wings so we could try to more sauces
column6: he got medium and hot. The hot was good
column7: I did not try the medium. I would say that the wings were the best thing here and I would recommend getting them. The sauces were all pretty good
column8: the Asian ginger was the best
column9: and the wings were cooked perfectly.  I also ordered a French onion soup
column10: it was just ok.

column1: Service was really good. Our server was very helpful with recommendations and was there when we needed her as well as very friendly.

This is a good place to stop in before a show or if you were going to Painting with a Twist (also in the same plaza). I also saw that they have various specials running during game days so that would be a good time to stop in as well.";02/01/2017 16:19

dQ7ofy5Jkfav5N3RUi0GDQ;JHuOJlqv3TmDgMrSvAgPtA;fAh1DvXplLu66urTBWSjaQ;4;2;0;0;"My wife and I decided to try Acero on a saturday evening. The restaurant had an intimate atmosphere despite the modern design - a trendy sort of place you would find in Soho NYC. The restaurant was busy and booked so we opted to eat at a bar that had a full service menu. There were lots of interesting items on the menu and there's an economical option to order 4 courses for 30$.
So that's what my wife and I did. I started off with the Acero salad
column2: which is essentially a reinterpretation of a caesar salad with egg and artisan salami-  It was delicious. And the dressing was light
column3: not overwhelming. My wife had the meat and cheese plate
column4: it was good
column5: albeit small in portion.

column1: Next I had the spaghetti
column2: wonderful
column3: but a tad salty. The noodles were freshly made and cooked perfectly
column4: al-dente. My wife had an egg ravioli
column5: which was mouthwatering delicious and velvety rich.  For our entrees
column6: I had the safe yet perfectly cooked flank steak
column7: topped over some spinach. While my wife had the scallops. Both tasted fine but nothing to brag about. For our desert
column8: we both shared our panna cotta topped with fleur de sol and caramel while my wife had hazelnut-stuffed figs.

column1: Service was superb and very attentive. We'll have to make it out here more often for date night.";22/11/2010 03:11

column1: QSP3IVYBxCZEdpnzCM-M4w;iR7UkCWH3_ecGaAftAdfgA;skWRxQU2LwbYQK0Dl_FqYw;1;2;0;0;"If I would've written this review when I first stayed here 2 weeks ago
column2: it would've been 5 stars. I stayed tonight and the experience was completely different. The front desk seemed very uninterested in helping us out. I had booked this hotel because of the outstanding customer experience the first time around. They provided a dog bed
column3: dog treats
column4: a pee pad
column5: dog bowls
column6: and a dog toy for my dog. This time around
column7: nothing. I had booked a room on March 16. I specifically wrote that I would be bringing my dog. When you visit the aloft website
column8: it states how dog friendly the hotel is and how they provide these perks for your pet. I checked in on March 26. An entire 10 days later. I checked in and nothing was ready. I was told they didn't have any dog beds. Turns out they did. So someone brought up 1 dog bed. My dog still had dog bowls missing so I had to call the front desk to ask for dog bowls. They brought up 2 bowls. Still missing the treats and toys. At this point
column9: I'm just tired of calling down for things. The room also wasn't vacuumed. There were crumbs everywhere that my dog was about to eat.

column1: I was also told that the keyless feature on the app wouldn't work because they were fixing the system. I didn't see anyone fixing anything. The front desk people were busy texting their friends on their cell phones. I am a SPG member and am now questioning why I would want to be a member when I'm treated this way. Not sure I would even book a room with this treatment.";28/06/2017 00:49

vMkyOzRm7-gGCiuTOEGGyA;y_8VzpDT4e08FB0p_0moLA;AU96AZqukZSl8TXchbLM9A;3;0;0;0;"My call was for a leaking water heater.  The technician arrived on time and diagnosed the leak from the bottom of the water heater which is not repairable.  Fortunately
column2: I am covered with a Sears service contract which covered the replacement of the water heater.  Unfortunately
column3: that's where the good news ended.  The service tech called in and got replacement authorization and said that  another Sears representative would call me within 2-4 hours to schedule the replacement.  He also left me a ticket number and a 1-800 number to use if I did not get a call back.  Of course
column4: I didn't get the phone call so I called the number he gave me.  After being transferred 4-times over 45 minutes
column5: I was directed to a Sears store which where I was informed that my water heater was not in stock and that it would take over a week to get one in.  Then they would schedule someone to put it in.  So
column6: from the time I initially called Sears to the anticipated time to get the problem fixed is more than 2-weeks.  This means that Sears finds it acceptable for my family to be without hot water for over 2-weeks.  I find this simply unacceptable!  Sears also makes it impossible to elevate issues like this to anyone within Sears management with authority to resolve issues like this; seems like NO ONE in Sears management is willing to get involved when things get difficult.  Again
column7: simply unacceptable.   (Perhaps this is why Sears is going bankrupt?)  This review would be at 1-star except for the excellent initial tech who came out.  He was competent
column8: efficient and caring.  He deserves 5-stars.";25/07/2016 11:13

column1: SO8G-R3kCdpgpwbKIQRG9w;wEwCtLPiErwqJYLFP_Ru7Q;xEnNPPOeoKCfyaOkUX0tFQ;1;7;0;1;"***Zipcar is very misleading stating ""gas
column2: insurance and daily millage is on us."" ***

column1: I rented a car using zipcar October 20
column2: 2015 and was involved in a hit and run. I was not in the car at the time and filed a police report. When I came back to the car the car mirror was damaged. I contacted zipcar to let them know and they said that the claim would be followed up by a phone call. I never received a phone call
column3: I emailed them checking in on October 27th 2015 letting them know I never got a call but did not hear back. During my initial call letting them know of the accident they told me that there would be a hold on my account until it was resolved but ""if I was able to rent a car then everything was fine."" I naturally assumed everything was ok and since after the hit and run I did use their services. Six months later I get an attempted charge saying I owe the $238.00. I was never called or asked to talk about the claim even after attempting to let them know that no one followed up. Before this event as far as I knew I would be covered especially in the event that someone besides me damaged the car. I have loved using zipcar but if this is how they run their business then why would anyone ever use them? You are basically not covered at all and running the risk of paying high fines for damages you did not cause. I was also never sent an itemized invoice stating that the charges from the auto repair company or what I owed. Which I think is more then fair if they are asking me to pay for damage I did not cause.  This company should not be operating at all unless they offer real insurance coverage to every driver and for every rental. They are misleading in making you believe that you are covered but you are not.";11/04/2016 23:18

column1: hSxgv-ZzlX4b7E5SBTggDQ;JyzLjUFEIW3epNlHI6Oa6Q;YuvnCZ8b9nNRs0Bu2PbG8Q;5;3;1;2;"Stopped by this little gem on a recent Friday night after some shopping errands. column1: I ended up having the Thai Noodle Salad off the sides menu with chicken added.  I was a little apprehensive at ordering a side for my entrée
column2: but the server assured me it would be a pretty decent portion size and she wasn't wrong.  It was enough to fill me and have leftovers.  Although
column3: I asked for chicken to be added
column4: it wasn't just cooked/broiled/grilled and thrown on top.  It was actually marinated and very flavorful and incorporated into the dish quite well.  I was pleasantly surprised by the drink and food offerings at Craft Bar and will definitely be back to try out more of the menu!";13/05/2017 12:12

column1: ANAEkDc7ZCbG0O_bh-v5xQ;cDUH9iq-zp8rSxS4mXYQDQ;9j1yT205wwkY7Mta2cldZw;5;0;0;0;After having a bad experience at a nearby salon I gave Westchase Nail a try.  I went on a Sunday morning shortly after they opened.  There were three people working and one other person waiting ahead of me.  I did not wait long before I was sat at a station with my feet soaking and my massage chair turned on.  I did not have to wait more than 10 minutes or so before it was my turn.  My tech was very throrough.  I have some rough feet due to a lot of running so my feet aren't pretty.  Before my polish was applied I had a sugar scrub applied to my legs below the knee
column2: lotion massage
column3: and a hot towel applied.  This was all part of the basic pedicure price
column4: not any upsale.  My polish was applied perfectly.  I was walked to the dry station and the machine was powered on for me.  I was not pushed extra services or rushed to pay immediately.  While I was not handed an alcoholic beverage like the other salon
column5: my pedi cost $5 less and included the sugar scrub
column6: lotion massage and hot towel.  I would rather have that any day.  Westchase nail has definitely become my new place for pedicures.;18/09/2016 17:36

column1: HOmnp9p6t63SsScyn6PqlA;96f2e36vpRvMBEZ92xiwIQ;IcqvNEGpi94KcvpS_wUBRQ;3;0;0;1;"We stumbled upon The Tap after a wonderful evening of Monumental Yoga. to be fair

This worked well for us for a Tuesday but I can see how this could be very challenging during a busy weekend and having people hover near a table waiting for you to leave.

column1: Service was slow and it took a while for someone to greet us and get us menus.  The food was good
column2: nothing extraordinary but decent bar food.  My biggest complaint would be that my fiance ordered a Beatbox Samuri. We joked that you pick your beer like you pick your horses at the track
column3: 100% based on the name alone.  The menu indicates it is a lighter beer however the beer that was served to him was a very dark brew. When he questions this
column4: the server said the menu wrong and that someone didn't do their job.  While it was funny
column5: it was also a bit concerning that she was unable confirm that he had the correct beer and basically said someone else didn't do their job so it wasn't her fault. She did offer to get him another beer but he was more concerned with the incorrect menu if that was the case.

column1: We'd definitely go back as it was a nice
column2: laid back atmosphere and the food was good. But I wouldn't wait an hour or stalk a table for it.  My fiance loved the beer so he will be back. column8: of course no other united employees could or wanted to help. An HOUR AND A HALF later
column9: still NOTHING! Finally at the two hour mark

column1: -6kOVi4ZHmTMHeK0VU0KHg;OEVoTnYwZLtkb3c_sXI3kA;DI8gsbZobj9YhkyHJA-uMg;4;1;0;1;"I would give this place 5 stars for the quality of their baked goods. They are top notch. The lady that answered my phone call however was very rude
column2: and that is why I rank them 3 stars only. It is really very simple (I hope that someone there in Management sees this!)
column3: always treat the customer with respect. The customer does not care if you hate your job
column4: or you are having a bad day
column5: or if you are mad at your husband
column6: or if you are very busy. If you don't like providing customer service (for whatever reason) then find another job. Smile and greet customers and give them the level of service that you would like to have. When I recently (today) called for a cake order
column7: the rude lady on the other end of the line kept interrupting me. She also rudely ""corrected"" me several times about their cake. I finally had to tell her to please let me finish what I am trying to say. That finally snapped this she-witch back into reality. Put your desire for excellent baked goods on a scale with your desire for excellent customer service. If your desire for baked goods is heavier than your desire for customer service go to McArthur's. They certainly excel in the craft of producing baked goodies..
column8: if however customer service is of extreme importance to you then avoid this place. I personally do not tolerate bad customer service
column9: and may have to look for another bakery.

column1: **Update: Within 3 hours of me posting this review
column2: their General Manager contacted me and apologized for the bad customer service. The fact that they cared enough to do that prompted me to update my review from a 3-star to a 4-star review. Again
column3: their cakes are excellent!";15/08/2013 20:24

column1: fdJA18qmRpudqq1kzpIFWA;tA1U-XSh9woo73eQmWGyAQ;i2WiqWwv3H9DZJ8uaqwPDA;4;1;1;0;"The 2016 YELP Review #228:
I have been disappointed here many times but
column2: never when the server has been Ron.

column1: LEAD IN: With my job I have traveled around the world quite a bit over the past 30 years.  I have seen some good places
column2: some bad and some really ugly ones... I have eaten in all three.  My first BJ's experience was in Portland
column3: OR when my boss took treated a few of us to dinner. I noted that they had 57 things on the menu that I liked.... and I am a healthy eater
column4: my unhealthy friends call it finicky.. whatever. I was sold on the place.

column1: Back to Clearwater
column2: FL.   I came here on a first date and my waiter never forgot me or my date.. further more he memorized what I had to eat each time... Now let me say
column3: my visits aren't several times in a week... I get deployed for long periods of time
column4: so this makes Ron's memory all the more impressive.

column1: The menu has changed a good bit over the years but
column2: they still have an amazing selection... enough to keep everyone content... even the finicky guy.

column1: Big enough for a party
column2: plenty of TVs
column3: restrooms are always tidy
column4: parking is plentiful but since it is at a mall near Whole foods
column5: other restaurants that are open after the mall closes and the movie theater.  Parking can be a serious hassle at times.  Having a parking garage in the south/southwest side of the mall would be quite beneficial... even if it was only two floors.  Just an attempt to park double the cars in the same footprint would be nice.

column1: I would recommend this restaurant to others and although this location has messed up my meals 5-6 times and other locations did too... such as Citrus Park
column2: Beaverton
column3: Portland (2X) and Downey
column4: CA (Read my review of that last one) I give  them 4 stars based on Ron being the most flawless server I have experienced ever.

column1: Thanks Ron!
Respectfully I Remain
John (that works on the Missile Tracker)";25/07/2016 08:53

XwRxzfrpwV_Psvc2oP_hFw;UtFIqoqOuUu6GZ1TbPawCw;y1ZPi7c6sSkWdE1p2vUo-Q;5;0;0;0;I love that they offer gluten free crust and dairy/soy free cheese. Yay! I can have pizza again. The topping choices are vast and delicious. The staff is super friendly. Love this place!;04/08/2016 13:38

column2: at both old and new locations. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Tucson. Their portion is big and the cost is about average. We always get the Stuffed Scottish Salmon with Risotto which is a special menu item. Other items that I recommend to try are the rack of lamb
