column1: 9Q9OO23piv28bQhXkaumeQ;AW0qpdOwMSKN7PN7DAUP9w;ci_PNLOL9cM2igVCM1H7Jg;5;2;0;0;"Bottom Line: Outstanding food that is different.

Had lunch at Caplinger's today with 2 business associates. I have been here multiple times during the lunch hour as is always busy but not ""long wait busy"". They take the order at the counter and then bring the meal to the table. It was about 15 minutes from entering the restaurant to getting the food.
Caplinger's has a wide verity of seafood and sandwiches that  are not going to be found at many other places. For example
column2: I ordered a shrimp Po boy that was outstanding. (See attached photo) Not like a New Orleans Po Boy exactly but really great none the less. They also have lobster rolls. There are several sides on the menus to choose and today I had the red beans and rice. They were good but I would recommend the fried Okra that I have had in the past.

column1: The prices in my opinion are very good based on the quality of meal you get.
Very good good
column2: nice atmosphere
column3: and good service. We will keep going back.";27/04/2018 21:03

FzO4ujSpqSCWdzrlF-qyrQ;Kl7RbNm-2OnFWEuWx1ASfg;ewv_qVqj8oNG6KQITZ-Ebg;2;1;0;0;"I hate to do this but I can't leave my mark of approval on East Buffet after my last encounter. Met a friend a couple days ago who was craving Chinese

column3: and we both walked away feeling not so great.. I'm amazed at how the quality of a place can change in such a short time. Maybe I caught you at a bad time
column4: but dinner is like your primetime! None of the food was fresh

column6: right smack in the middle of what should be dinner time.

column1: And with that East Buffet provided a sore reminder of why we do not normally eat at these kinds of places; just not worth the mediocre

column1: I went to see Hunger Games on the Imax a few days ago. I've seen other movies on the Imax screen here
column2: but it's been a few years. The tickets were fairly expensive (we pre-ordered the tickets ahead of time on Fandago and spent $40 for 2 tickets). However
column3: the theater is huge
column4: and so is the screen! The volume was a bit too high for me
column5: but my mom enjoyed it (I've always thought she was hard of hearing
column6: guess this proved it!). The screen did offer some fantastic close-ups and I did enjoy it more than a normal movie screen- but I'm not sure the discrepancy was worth the extra price.

column1: There aren't any close bathrooms behind the ticketing post- there are bathrooms at the end of each hallway. I had to use the bathroom in the middle of the movie
column2: and it involved a sprint down the hallway to minimize missed movie. And while I was using the bathroom
column3: I realized that about 20 ants were running around my feet on the bathroom floor. No exaggeration
column4: and I was slightly grossed out. The popcorn was a bit dry but still good
column5: and like all movie theaters
column6: the sodas and food is ridiculously overpriced.

column1: Overall
column2: it's the only Imax screen in a normal movie theater nearby- so if that's your preference
column3: this is your choice. Some will find the benefits (bigger screen
column4: louder sound
column5: more fun movie experience) outweigh the downsides (more expensive ticket cost
column6: far away from bathrooms). I'd only watch certain movies on this screen
column7: and the rest I'd opt instead for a normal theater.";30/03/2012 14:37

column1: JGDxKkHFohKCBSi_X-fOIw;a0wsmlkKLtMDUdMWHhzilA;bENW5-F2aplQsTdPI8wDBA;2;1;0;0;"The whole moving process started great and ended great
column2: however the lack of professionalism from the office/scheduling side of things was entirely unacceptable.  When I initially asked for a quote via email I was met with a very prompt response.  Based on the flat rate fee and the very positive reviews on Yelp (I scheduled back in November 2012 prior to the two other negative reviews showing up)
column3: I decided on using Skybox.

column1: About a month before my move
column2: I received information from my new landlord regarding insurance requirements for the moving companies coming into the building.  I emailed Matt with these requirements at which time he essentially told me the property manager understood nothing about moving insurance and there would be an additional $100ish charge for this insurance requirement.  After more back-and-forth
column3: it was determined that he would go to the insurance agency that week to have it situated (this was a Thursday
column4: December 27) and would email me with the updated information.

column1: After a week passed with no response from Matt
column2: I sent a follow-up email (Thursday
column3: January 3) to ensure the insurance would be correct.  Matt responded that he was waiting for other insurance papers to build up to make one trip and ""I'll definitely get over there this week.""  ANOTHER week passes with no insurance certificates so I emailed Friday
column4: January 11 (two weeks from my move date) asking if he had gotten the papers and to let me know if it wasn't possible so I could find another mover before my move on January 25.  After no response again
column5: I finally called on January 15 and Matt seemed clueless on the phone saying he was just getting to the office and would call me back in 15 minutes.  I had to call AGAIN about two hours later since he didn't call back.  I finally got the certificate that day.

column1: Then comes moving day...
They were scheduled (per emails
column2: which I saved) to show up at 9am on Friday
column3: January 25th.  9:30 comes and I've heard nothing
column4: so I call Matt again.  He's ""just getting to the office"" (see a trend???) and will get back to me.

column1: At a little before 10 I get a phone call from Scott (one of my movers) saying they're on their way and that Matt had my move scheduled for the 28th (even though ALL of the emails I have state not only the date
column2: but also that it's a FRIDAY... the 28th is a Monday...)

column1: Scott and Derek show up in a very nondescript GRAFFITI COVERED truck.  No where on the truck did it say ""Skybox Movers.""  If it were friends of mine doing the move for pizza and beer
column2: I wouldn't have minded; however this is supposed to be a ""professional moving company""?  I was completely embarrassed thinking that would be the first impression my new neighbors got!  (Thank goodness no one seemed to be out)

column1: The only reason this company gets two stars is because of Scott and Derek--they were professional
column2: courteous
column3: and expeditious with the move.  Not once did they complain that this was supposed to be their day off or that it was too cold (under 15 degrees in Scranton and had started to snow by the time they finished).  Another huge plus:  so far I've seen nothing that's been damaged or broken!  Tip to Scott and Derek:  You guys are great!  Find a new employer!!!!!!";27/01/2013 21:23

column1: d7i8fMex2jSm9nfesR4KYA;#NOME?;FNP4tlM-KYf--vTk_Gf9nQ;2;5;2;0;"Eh. I think Sushi Train's problem is that the train is too long and the menu is too big! The sushi isn't BAD...it's just not that high quality. I've been here twice and did the train the first time and the hot dinner menu the second. My train dinner was just OK
column2: but was pretty fun to pull stuff off the train. It ended up being kinda expensive for mediocre sushi
column3: but I had a nice time.

column1: I opted to try the hot dinner meal the next time and asked our waitress for details regarding a specific tofu menu item (Ma Po) and all she could tell me was that it was a tofu dish with spicy sauce. No other details. So I went for it (was this a mistake? maybe). And
column2: just as she told me
column3: out came a plate with tofu and a red
column4: gelatinous spicy sauce. It was like an entire grocery store block of medium-firm tofu chopped up on a plate with sauce. No vegetables. No frills. Just tofu. With sauce. The tofu was just heated
column5: not pan fried or anything so it was really soft which some people may prefer
column6: but I certainly do not. It was definitely edible. My boyfriend gave me his mushrooms from his Yang's spicy chicken to give me some texture to my mush pile. It just really wasn't my favorite
column7: but it WAS cheap and a huge portion (comes with rice
column8: salad and soup too!)
column9: so there's that.

column1: Additionally
column2: I never got a water refill. The waitresses were nice and all
column3: but really couldn't give us ANYTHING when it came to our menu questions.  The restaurant is huge
column4: which I think might be a detriment. I wish that the train were just a small feature of a great Japanese restaurant
column5: but sadly
column6: that isn't the (refrigerated
column7: sushi-filled) case. Sorry
column8: sushi train
column9: I probably won't be back.";03/08/2013 18:21

The actual tour guide licensing office is administered to by professional women -- it usually runs well --they require you get a FBI background check  and take the history test which requires a significant amount of  background knowledge.

oK4jPjjNeotS_TNTsWa4SA;uGIcGoilutbpzubYvWe9cA;83KdaW9JNrCnlaNl_u7NiA;1;3;2;0;"Worst Japanese/Korean Restaurant in Montgomeryville!  I would not go there again even if they were to offer a FREE meal!
First of all
column2: avoid going on Mondays and Tuesdays for their half price Sushi.  Be prepared for long waits and bad sushi!  We have been there several times (maybe we are gluttons for punishment) and consistently had bad experience.

column1: Twice we had to wait for an Hour before we were served food.  When checked the status of the order
column2: the owner just sneered at us told us that they were busy. No apologies or even basic courtesy and just rudely being told that they were busy asking us to wait.  The place is busy on Mondays and Tuesdays with their half price rolls which is understandable
column3: but service is the main component that defines a restaurant and that kind of response is unacceptable.  The sushi rolls are mediocre and not worth the discounted prices!

column1: There are many fine Japanese/Korean establishments serving quality Sushi in the area.  There is Kumo right across the street which offers 1) Better Sushi/Sashimi  2) Fresh Seafood and 3) Excellent Service.  Besides Kumo
column2: there is Ooka in Montgomeryville/Doylestown/Willow Grove with great ambience and dining experience along with Umai in North Wales.  Even Noboru or Minado Buffets which mass produce rolls serve decent Sushi!   Just 10 minutes away in Plymouth Meeting is Bluefin
column3: which is excellent.  And there are many others.  Its time Fuji owners take a look around at the competition and get their act together.";08/05/2013 01:55

column1: YcdwwSu7MjyWo-0yanWv_g;9J0FEQI5v2mWLUSmUuSVyg;ci-kujWfHzsg5zCcqYZLKA;1;1;0;0;"Heard great things about lucky strike in other cities was really excited to go. Not sure if it was his first day or not but if so he shouldn't have been alone taking care of customers. We waited 25 min in line just to get a lane mind you there were only two people in front of us... there was not

Many people there so I couldn't really understand why service was so lax. Then our lane wouldn't work and it took another 20 minutes for them just to get someone to look into the problem for us. Manager didn't even come over to our lane to remedy the situation. Majority of staff did not know what they were doing. We waited 45 minutes and didn't even bowl
column2: eventually after waiting all that time we asked for our money because we couldn't wait any longer. Staff had attitude when we expressed our frustrations. Extremely disappointed will not be back unless they decide to fix these issues";28/06/2017 02:46

column1: N7JafUMvMTyecJliRe7APQ;zwkrwVbryRpaeMdWJ07xdg;akNpPdFsHk0mvbqkmPrXWg;5;2;0;0;"Believe the glowing reviews: Saki is the best.

column1: So I'm scrambling to get someone to help

column5: and bam! We're booked for 2:30 that afternoon. Incredible.

column1: He called to let us know he was running a little late -- very considerate! -- and showed up just when he said he would. He diagnosed the problem
column2: had the parts on hand
column3: tuned up the unit
column4: and voila -- everything fixed
column5: just 5 hours after we contacted him. Cold air.

column1: Price was completely reasonable
column2: and he couldn't have been nicer. Highly recommended! I've got my HVAC guy now
column3: and will definitely be calling SK Heating & Air Conditioning in the figure.";08/08/2017 12:58

column1: 8EsSZKvcENOJx3-xyt25eA;V4KUFOs8M23uj61VKVNKAw;Cx2HsovaJGPXBBuMOmPxuQ;4;2;0;0;Since I am allergic to anything that has fur we can only have small cage animals as pets. My daughter had a pet rat named Lilly that was almost 3 years old. A few weeks ago we noticed her not grabbing her food with her front paws anymore and she couldn't climb up her walk to get her food. Then we noticed reddish brown liquid on her nose and legs. We thought it was blood but found out it isn't but a liquid that they have and comes out when they are stressed or sick. Well we started hand feeding her and giving her water with a dropper. We then noticed 2 lumps under her front arms. Having had a rat when I was younger I knew it wasn't good and that they were probably tumors. I called another vet to ask about putting her to sleep and they wanted $75.00! That is more than the rat cost. So I looked up rat doctors and found these guys. They only charged us 24.00 and we were allowed back there while they gave her a sleeping gas to calm her down. We then left while they did the injections. They wrapped her up and put her in a small box. They were very kind and gave us plenty of time to say good bye to our little pet. I would pick them to take any other pets we may have in the future. I just hope its for a check up and not what we had to do that day.;10/09/2012 20:03
PEOSH93vkLdhqS9LkaXVfA;WrmUzCpfiwU7_kW5MEDqyA;9xCprW96TZFLajnnN-w8Pg;3;1;1;1;"This place is fine
column2: but I had some pros and some cons
column3: so I think 3 out of 5 is fair. Now this place was super busy

It's popularity probably lends to the fact that it's really had to find parking in the tiny lot in front of or behind the store. It also had a long line
column5: but not really a clear pricing menu. There's a coffee menu and one on the ice cream
column6: but none in the baked goods area. And I really don't like being the person who gets to the register and asks a bunch of prices then contemplates what to get
column7: so I'd rather just get 1 thing even though with proper signage I could contemplate and consider more while the line chugs.

column1: Speaking of which
column2: I feel at most bakeries
column3: you order near the counter
column4: then I find it helpful if I want one donut or macaron or cupcake
column5: I can see all my choices at once. Here
column6: you trudge past the case and order at the register
column7: which at a busy time takes forever
column8: and since there's no sign near the register
column9: you just have to remember all the options and flavors so I said one and the guy walked off before I could even say anything else. Oh well.

column1: So I got the salted caramel cupcake

column3: the frosting was sweet and I'd say there was too much frosting due to how rich it was. It was nice but a little on the pricey side. I think you're paying for the ambiance and it is popular

column1: #NOME?;P-7VidyXqOGd6zBnT85pDA;LFUndZacUo5keXKHNPk-vQ;3;0;0;0;"Mexicans in Tucson all seem to have their favorite places that they insist are absolutely the best in the city. I worked with some Mexican women who insisted that Rosa's was

column4: and wasn't really that impressed. I've been back a couple of times since
column5: and still don't really get it.

column1: You can get better Mexican on the south side but
column2: for where it is
column3: this is up there with Guadalajara
column4: and
column5: I think
column6: above Casa Molina. Good
column7: but not great.

column1: It's a small place
column2: and I've had really varying service. It seems to be better at lunch.

column1: The salsa
column2: for my tastes
column3: has too much onion and cilantro
column4: but maybe I'm a stupid white boy.

column1: South side Mexican food is also cheaper. Your dinner will run about $8 for a regular plate.
I got an asada chimi on one visit
column2: and the grease made it taste awful. So
column3: buyer beware: Rosa's chimis

column6: meaning that they're not canned.

column1: If you want really good Mexican

column6: etc.) Come to Rosa's if you're in the area.";21/05/2009 14:10

fqsdFE1vAMADc31sfkmHWA;0qWgfjxEUdcJqOnkb3KmJg;oC91lprbbfzw7DOYiYln7Q;4;1;0;1;"Busy
column2: busy place - both at lunch and dinner! Always a good sign
column3: right? Packed for lunch so we came back for dinner during a recent visit to Clayton. We were seated right away
column4: luckily
column5: because then the crowds showed up and there was a wait!

column1: Large blackboard in the bar area displays specials
column2: events
column3: seasonal beers
column4: etc. Their libation menu is pretty extensive and the craft beer aficionado in our group was impressed with the offering of local drafts.

column1: A couple of us started with the soup of the day - roasted tomato with crispy cheese curds. It was delicious - yes
column2: even the crisp curds. Not even close to canned cream of tomato
column3: thank heavens. It was thick
column4: and rich
column5: and tomato-y with a hint of a smoky flavor coming through. Yum.

column1: If a place is going to call themselves ""5 Star Burgers""
column2: they better rate those 5 stars
column3: right? Well
column4: if these aren't 5 stars
column5: they are pretty darn close. Nice variety to choose from so deciding on which one to try can present a problem.  Lamb? Bison? Turkey? Beef? Veggie? But we faced that challenge head on and decisions made. The Potsticker is a grilled pork that comes with a Vietnamese style slaw (never knew there was such a thing!) and a peanut-hoisin sauce. Since it's  pork
column6: you don't have the option of having it prepared any way except thoroughly done. Oh well. End product: very good and the hoisin sauce added a whole new dimension. Dad's Green Chile Cheeseburger came prepared exactly as requested - medium - and again I say
column7: it was perfect! Picture perfect
column8: in fact. Topped with crispy hatch chilies
column9: pepper jack cheese AND green chile mayo! Ya gotta like green chiles to like this burger. Wonderful! Each bite made the taste buds jump for joy.

column1: If you aren't in the mood for a burger
column2: or meat just isn't your thing - there are hot dogs
column3: fish
column4: grilled cheese and salads to choose from. We did have one who opted for the beet-apple salad. Sadly
column5: the julienned beets weren't pickled so lacked flavor
column6: and the caramelized apples were mushy. Moral: if you go to a burger place
column7: don't order a salad. Lesson learned.

column1: Although the shakes
column2: fountain sodas
column3: floats and ice cream all looked yummy and tempting
column4: we stood firm and decided that would have to wait until our next visit.";13/05/2015 03:06

column1: l-7OHgbNegUFec3djJiLxQ;jsaN4TDygu76AGTiB3PpBA;IewtlXlD78Ew1-pz4e0sUw;4;1;2;0;"a solid spot
column2: however

column1: Anyhow
column2: wife has finished her meal & im still waiting for mine.";30/01/2016 18:45

column1: TQsuMcexOnJmZIjH8MW_Vg;GJUP_9KUzyLs47QUWDxFhA;UMqxcGl-Wh14TQub8IwO0Q;5;2;2;0;"Still an amazing five stars!
Two weeks ago
column2: I was driving to work and was at like 65 mph when my car started making this scratching kind of sound at the front. No sputtering
column3: blocking
column4: rumbling noises...just a weird scratchy sound. I got to work
column5: consulted Google
column6: and called my friend who's a mechanic about all the dreaded possibilities it could be. He told me to stick with diagnosing people and he would take a look at it if I ever decided to come up to Chicago. (If you don't see the humor and irony in this
column7: you don't know me very well.).

column1: Fast forward. So I really wasn't as worried because the noise never happened again and my car needed some maintenance anyway so I was planning on bringing it in sometime this month. But today
column2: I started my car down the street and looked in the rearview mirror to see this trail of fluid. Condensation? Fluid leak? I don't know. I'm not a car doctor. But coupled that to the weird scratching noise that may have indicated power steering or braking problems (thanks
column3: Google!)
column4: I was worried enough to drive back home and call Sears. I mean
column5: I drive fast
column6: but I'm not THAT stupid; last thing I want is the steering out at 80 mph.

column1: The conversation went like this (and yes
column2: I do sound stupid):

column1: Me: Hey
column2: so I might have a leak. I'm not sure. There's a trail of fluid down my street.

column1: Mechanic: Ok. What color is it?
Me: Uh
column2: I'm not sure. It just looks wet. But I popped my hood and this container that has pink stuff looks low?

column1: Mechanic: Hm. Well
column2: just bring it in. We'll look at it.

column1: Me: Like right now?
Mechanic: Yep.
So I get there
column2: and there's like four other cars in the bay
column3: but they put my car in right away. They take a look and tell me everything is a-ok
column4: but that it's time for my oil change and the power steering fluid is a little low. No leaking though. OH
column5: and that pink stuff is supposed to be at that level because it's coolant and circulates. I mean
column6: who would have thought?! ;)

column1: So thanks
column2: guys
column3: for not laughing at me. And thanks for getting me in right away. And thanks for being all right with me running out in the bay in flip flops asking  where the coolant level should be and what other weirdo containers I need to look at if I ever need to do something like this again (which I feel like is the equivalent of coming into the OR in flip flops). I'm sure I'll be back with more car symptoms in tow.";05/12/2012 00:54

column2: for the longest time I wanted my first review to be a great restaurant. Unfortunately
column3: the service provided by this company has forced me to write a review. On the way to the airport
column4: we had to get picked up at 5 for a 10 am flight. We then got a call to sit in a parking lot for 30 minutes for a pick up that didn't occur. Never once did the driver apologize
column5: nor did he even care: ""well I'll never make my NYC now..."". Hi
column6: yeah
column7: excuse me
column8: why don't you get us to the airport before you're worried. On the way home. We were supposed to have our own car
column9: instead we got taken out to jenkintown. Our 35 minute ride home turned into a 45 minute ride to jenkintown and an hour ride back to Levittown. Needless to say
column10: id rather park at the airport then give them more business.";08/12/2013 01:29

column1: 5wQbBdbp4jfshy5H0BYzfg;lAW03ccfMEuRZiDqvVgc0w;kA-yHIy_W_O3n5tMhW1zyA;3;3;0;0;"Dots is interesting - it's a liquidation store with mostly clothing but also random liquidation (think AEcor Urban Outfitters sassy books/novelties).
Located just south of the Edmonton city cemetery and literally behind (north) of Oliver Square.  It can be a little tricky to find the first time.
I have friends that have found some fabulous treasures here in the clothing liquidations but I haven't found that hidden Easter Egg yet.
The layout is kinda like a thrift store but way less organized.  You need time when you come here to sort and sift through the garbage to find the gems.
Also
column2: sign up for their email online for advance notice of sales and coupons.

column1: It's a fun little liquidation warehouse but it could be improved significantly with better organization and layout.";21/01/2018 13:51

It took them too long to get us chips

column1: QemYgmoQTFcfBfsCxVLZXg;vx0Hkm2dPnawQBGCso3__w;j_udZkQ0VG4xpJr8MVZn9w;1;2;2;1;"LIVING
column2: CRAWLING PARASITES IN MY FOOD!!!

column1: It had been about 5 years since I've been here and thought it was time to go back. My
column2: how the mighty have fallen! Started with a round of oysters. THERE WERE PARASITES CRAWLING AROUND INSIDE THE OYSTERS!!! That in itself is absolutely unforgivable
column3: but let's set that aside for a moment and discuss the rest of the food.

column1: The bread was cold. The fish had a couple bones still in it. The shrimp didn't have their shells peeled all the way. Defeats the purpose of eating at an upscale establishment when you have to keep sticking your fingers into a mouthful of food to dig out stray bones and shells. Food was barely warm. Everything was drowned in lemon butter. Literally. Both my and my date's plates were food sitting in moats of half melted butter. Everything was over cooked and over salted. If these were 10.99 dinners from the local Logan's
column2: I'd say ""meh
column3: not very good
column4: but I guess you get what you pay for""
column5: but at nearly $40 a plate this is ridiculous.

column1: And what was the manager's response to the living marine parasites that were crawling around in the oysters? ""Sorry about that
column2: we'll take them off your bill. How about a dessert?"" Are you effing kidding me?!? How about ""We're so sorry there were PARASITES IN YOUR FOOD! Dinner's on us and also next time as well so you'll give us another chance to not serve you food with LIVING PARASITES in it."" I paid $90 for that. I should have thrown a fit
column3: made a scene
column4: and stormed out
column5: but I just wanted to get the hell out of there. Unbelievable. Goodbye forever.

column1: Seriously
column2: pay 20% more and go to Oceanaire a couple blocks away. Heck
column3: pay 90% less and go to Golden Corral
column4: they at least don't have parasites.";04/01/2015 01:18

column1: CHXfgRCg3ipx7a56MP4dxA;O3YxmB4kmgJVsCZDy8C4SA;J0upe5MQ5X9MkchhS_Aotw;5;0;0;1;A nice casual upscale and very intimate dining experience. You have the option between Classic French or traditional Vietnamese cuisine. I always go for the Vietnamese just because it's a little cheaper and so full on flavor. You can get a decent bowl of pho without having to go all the way down south philly. I always order the pho deluxe and the spring rolls with a plum sauce. Both are excellent. The broth is always hot and they are always very generous with the meat. The spring rolls are vegetarian
column2: don't let that make you think they lack in flavor because it's the opposite. The best spring rolls I've ever had! Love this place

column1: 2syaCnAGTapVbm_sPzd2_g;irJKUrPxs5Z5fTvya-JVyA;TvLkdljMUHE2Yt-T_4OEWw;4;3;0;0;"Rescued Furnishings opened about a month ago.  The brick and mortar store is adorably cute!  Upon walking in

Perfect place to go when looking for a housewarming present or special on-of-a-kind home décor item for the person that has everything.

column1: 9igiuVD5y91nPoWliznkuA;cfNcpHJ8ALBRTzf2PpeHVw;YU5Nm4VeOGuZJm-R3-EV1A;4;4;1;2;"Quick stop at the airport before flying away from Indianapolis!
Trying to opt for something healthy
column2: I ordered a simple turkey sandwich...and at the last minute
column3: thinking aloud
column4: said
column5: ""I'm deciding if I should order a side of mac 'n cheese."" The Shapiro's employee's eyes widened and she nodded emphatically
column6: which was the push I needed
column7: so I caved. And thank goodness...

column1: Perhaps it was just that I was exhausted from lots of traveling over the previous weeks
column2: perhaps I was just starving
column3: but that mac 'n cheese was the best decision I've made in a loooong while. Gooey
column4: cheddar cheesy
column5: and the ultimate necessary comfort food at that moment. I ended up eating the entire side of it (which was quite generous
column6: I might add) and only got a little ways through the turkey sandwich
column7: which I saved (and which was also generously portioned).

column1: I know lots of people are complaining about the prices here
column2: which didn't really phase me; in fact
column3: I'm trying to remember the last time I bought airport food that was NOT overpriced. The sandwich was $9 or $10 I think
column4: though it was large
column5: with lots of turkey in it...and the mac 'n cheese was actually a pretty large serving for only $3 or $4. All good in my book.

column1: Yes

column1: DnG8w_ma7TCbXKckqspvTg;bnVzSHI48lEHPaEzZNIqJg;KvVpS-XrkYcWW9fJTmnewA;3;15;7;3;"I have a lot of trouble ranking this place.  Though it is massive and has a ton of different ""fun"" things to do
column2: it's kind of overrun with out of control children.  Also
column3: it's outrageous to get into
column4: ($15 unless you are a citizen of Maryland Heights...ridiculous!).

column1: So
column2: now to describe this fine water park of sorts.  Aquaport was the first of the big pool renovations in St. Louis.  Now
column3: it seems every municipality has their own fancy pool.  Since Aquaport has been around the longest
column4: they have some really different things.  Of course
column5: they have the lazy river
column6: which as I said is overrun with children.  Just try to relax in this thing.  I once even asked the lifeguard to please tell this incredibly obnoxious group of boys away from my friend and I
column7: and he just stared at me like I had six heads.  Great job keeping those kids in control buddy.  They have some decent slides too
column8: fast to slow and the lines are never that bad.  But the best part
column9: they have the big toilet bowl.  Basically
column10: jump in and start swirling around the tube like water in a toilet until it dumps you out the small hole in the bottom and shoot into the pool below.  Talk about water up your nose

column1: 0_5HlscNDPuCtoZHjiRh9w;vLxpEHKZFzv8LYY5eeGjTg;9WCzvpbGzcs4AVYSThNYag;4;1;0;1;"I am only reviewing this as a wedding ceremony/reception location.  I have never visited the museum or seen the sights so I can't comment on that side of things.
I was in a wedding that was hosted in this location in October.  First of all
column2: I highly recommend that if you can afford this an option
column3: it is ABSOLUTELY amazing!  They do one wedding a day
column4: so you are the ONLY bride.  My friend did an outdoor wedding next to the canal.  It is one of the only outdoor canal locations in the city.  Although there are bystanders walking through
column5: no one was rude or in the way.  We all walked down a LONG flight of stairs...what an entrance!! Amy looked stunning waltzing down the steps.  It was fabulous and breathtaking.

column1: A cocktail hour was also hosted outside after the ceremony was over and the reception was inside in a large open space with plenty of seating and plenty of room for a dance floor.  It was INCREDIBLE.  The staff was on top of things
column2: well organized and incredibly friendly and helpful.  We got ready in a room that overlooked the ceremony location
column3: so we could see people coming in and taking a seat.  It was very cool.

column1: They set up everything Amy requested just as she requested it.  They were professional
column2: courtesy and extremely organized.  I definitely recommend this as a fabulous downtown Indy location.  It was also nice having everything in one place.

column1: There is ample parking
column2: cabs will swing by to pick people up and plenty of hotels to choose from.  All great benefits for a perfect wedding combination!";09/12/2008 17:45

column1: There's so many Burgers in the 'Burg and this has become my relaxing spot when I don't want the bustle and prices of The Avenue or Engine No 9 but still want a good Burger at Five Guy's prices. column2: but to ask diners how they can help.

column1: ... BUT ESPECIALLY FOR THE GLUTEN FREE BUNS

As someone who is ""allergic to everything"" I love how they have a pretty decent gluten-free Bun (or as good as GF can be). Most Burger places offer 'gluten-free' Burgers by just plopping the Patty on a bed of Lettuce... seriously?
WHAT ABOUT THE BURGER ITSELF?
Often the grilled toppings get a bit of that typical
column2: grilled robust flavor lost in the grilling process and sometimes the fresher toppings are a bit droopy instead of crisp. But overall
column3: this place treats it all--Banana Peppers

aNKFC2qN9FCbObKIjOuAcA;5MrX71l3UmGquEY0FMIowQ;E9xPHrBM4W3tgSJeSlsQgA;4;0;0;0;Love the idea of the conveyer belt sushi. I've been to a few in CA and WA and now having it in my city is what's enjoyable. They offer different types of rolls
column2: full menu of Nigiri and sashimi
column3: as well as traditional Japanese food such as teriyaki chicken
column4: steak and udon noodles. With the conveyer belt you just grab which rolls sounds appetizing and what your eyes desire which is pretty convenient. Each plate comes with an average of 4 pieces which allows you to try all the different types of rolls without looking at a menu for what's in it or a picture they love to provide at some places. Came to dine in and hour before close so some of the better rolls weren't rotating when we got there. Perk is they did allow us to order which rolls we wanted that they didn't have on the belt. It was good sushi but I'm sure at a busier time it would of been that much better! They do offer Happy Hour Mon-Thurs from 3pm-5pm with rolls starting at .99 cents. column1: FYfkP-kA--fVQ8XUeEwrWQ;-8onB3ocqDXC0FtxH7-fPg;q-L5F5EGsl4QrstFx5ycxg;5;0;0;0;"I see the bad reviews
column2: and I am shocked. I met with a man named Brian after finding him through Craig's List. I decided it was time to remove three huge Bradford Pears from my front yard. They were very close to my home
column3: and right alongside our electric wires. The trees were at the end of their life span
column4: and hurricane season was approaching
column5: but it was not urgent. Even so
column6: Brian got back to me the same night
column7: a Wednesday
column8: and came out to do an estimate Thursday morning.

column1: There was a Maple in the backyard I had planned to tackle myself
column2: but Brian lumped that into his estimate
column3: as well as the removal of some branches on another Maple that was lying on our roof and shed. We were quoted a lower price for agreeing to keep the wood.

column1: The work was done in its entirety by 1 on Monday. The crew cleaned up everything
column2: and even chopped the firewood we were keeping into small pieces and piled them into neat stacks.

column1: Brian and I did discuss the cash payment and agreed that no money would be paid until the job was done. That seems to be the issue with many of the negative reviews. In addition
column2: we did not have the stumps ground. We were going to pay for that service
column3: and Brian did tell us that someone else would be coming another day to do so
column4: but our gas lines run under the front of our house
column5: so we decided against it for now.

column1: I'd definitely recommend E-Z Tree Service.";28/08/2017 19:41
u48MkLHz166YeBjPDYQUhA;gO03HDa_tQ-NIQyR5fC4Mg;cdrMvOVFFBSwYHb3s06U9w;2;2;0;0;Welcome to SEPTA - Philly's main mass transit system owner - home of dark
column2: grungy
column3: un-air conditioned
column4: rarely heated
column5: minimal sound absorption stations and vehicles
column6: rarely cleaned
column7: hardly any ADA compliance - or when it does exist not setup properly
column8: limited signage
column9: limited crowd control mechanisms like escalators
column10: magnetic strip monthly payment cards you can only buy in Center City and limited Regional Rail Stations
column11: no credit cards or NFC on vehicles
column12: tokens required - those metal coins 1980 has called for and asked be returned
column13: and minimal on-time performance. They also obscure transit maps with Regional Rail lines. Don't believe me
column14: go to SEPTA_Social on Twitter and run an analysis on their tweets. But
column15: what would a highly negative review be without suggestions? Quick wins? Signage at the window level of the MFL and BSL interior that allows anyone with 20/200 or better vision to see the signage (see DC). Blind person walkways (raised paths for those with blind-walking canes to braille boards at a specific levels across-system (see Paris)
column16: minimize procurement and maintenance costs with one or two standardized tiles on station walls (see DC)
column17: automated recordings for Subways / Buses with meaningful instructions that can be easily heard (put up sound absorption and run some audio engineering - who the knows where Bus 31 goes ... give landmarks) (see London)
column19: train Countdown boards and on-time performance technology (see Copenhagen
column21: automated teller and NFC (see NJ Transit)
column22: and increase revenue with increased distance reach by having bike racks on trains (see Western USA). Long-term wins? Escalators at stations to help the elderly (see DC
column26: removal of most ADA ramps at Regional Rail stations and replacement with elevators ... most disabled/elderly can't make it up ramp/steps without help (see DC
column29: re-configured MFL seating for easy movement at rush hour (see London
column32: train barrier walls at stations (see Copenhagen)
column33: upgraded Trolleys that are ADA compliant (see Ghent
column35: enclosed platforms for MFL and NHSL.;28/07/2015 12:15

v2IdKK5tBp9YI0G9OOqzdg;a_uzkoCjAxMIrLeVRqxb-w;wbDRmtxaKRpBOjutvV6TEA;5;1;0;1;"This place was absolutely amazing!!! The atmosphere was incredible- a fun blend of modern and retro with low tables and love seats/chairs to sit in. The entrees are all a la carte but the sides are big enough to share! The 18oz ribeye is by far the best- it had the most amazing flavor! The truffle whipped potatoes are also definitely a must have. And no meal is complete without dessert and I must say- the only way to go is with the S'mores cake. It's a deconstructed s'more basically with a decedent chocolate lava cake with marshmallow and chocolate filling
column2: and toasted marshmallow on top
column3: and graham cracker ice cream on the side ( yes I did say graham cracker ice cream!). Take a spoon full of each part and prepare to be taken away to dessert paradise.

column1: The restaurant also has some cool features
column2: say a coed bathroom? Yes this place does in fact have a coed bathroom!! You walk in one door and there are a line of doors on the right-hand side labeled L and M.... pick your door and there you go. What an experience! Also when you're steak comes they bring out a tray of at least 8 different varieties of steak knives for you to choose from. What a fun way to make eating a steak an exciting experience! I will definitely have to go back!";26/06/2012 16:48

column1: 6MKd56Oul1_n01vCrIZ7-A;dootbuF6YgSygb32DIqwQA;wm5mQ4cSpvko9WlCq07RFw;4;3;0;0;"Lets just say that after a UYE I was hooked. This place is about 5 minutes away from my office
column2: and the most delicious Mexican food I've had in a good while.

column1: My tastebuds have been so used to chipotle that I forgot what an actual burrito tastes like. My advice to you- BELIEVE THE HYPE.
Nothing could top the look on my face when that chorizo burrito with mole sauce came out to me. (If you've never had mole sauce it's worth trying but mind you it can be spicy)
The service was great. Servers promptly came to our table often to ask if we needed anything- refilled water etc.
I've have been here twice after the UYE (no shame) and I really cannot imagine what I would change.
Free margaritas and sangria? check
Amazingly fresh food? check
Variety? check
Gigantic portion size? check
friendly service? check
A crazy affordable price? check

The only thing is that there isn't much of an ""ambiance."" I couldn't say ""come here for date night"" or ""office happy hour"" confidently because it's such a tiny place with no real atmosphere one way or the other.
Part of me wishes they had a bigger area or fancy decorations
column2: but personally- I just think that's all part of El Limon's charm.

column1: Great food
column2: affordable prices
column3: at a low-key location.";12/11/2014 14:22

_4ximArTPx9qaOaTltFuOQ;hwB9QTmjZRd48mbGPcnw8Q;vJsTzkbgYdcLdCB4rnBv6g;5;5;1;2;"Am I the only one who walked in here and thought I had the wrong address because of the coffee and chocolate on the wall? Hahaha.
Seriously
column2: though
column3: I came here for a wax procedure
column4: as my regular place was closed for renovations
column5: and my two back-up places were unable to accommodate me
column6: as their waxologists (yep
column7: I just invented that word) were on vacation.

column1: I must say
column2: I was a little hesitant about their organic theme. I always just kind of assumed that you needed chemicals for anything to actually work. You're probably guessing where I'm going with this...but I was wrong!

column1: So
column2: i walked to Tierra Mia (or is it Mi Cumbia? A little confused about the name...)
column3: which is a few blocks off Rittenhouse Square. I almost would have missed the brick storefront
column4: since it's in a little residential neighborhood. I was immediately greeted by Sebastian (yes
column5: that's his name! Love it...and he's really cool--I spoke to him on the phone when I scheduled
column6: and then forgot the time of
column7: my appointment.) He offered me a drink
column8: which is almost always the sign of a classy establishment. The place is a little small but definitely cozy and comfortable. A minute later
column9: I met Karina
column10: who is their waxer.

column1: She was very sweet and friendly
column2: but the best part of all is that a procedure which usually hurts a whole lot didn't hurt nearly as much as some of the more expensive Rittenhouse Square spas. I think they use some kind of soy wax
column3: which I assumed would be painful and possibly ineffective
column4: but I was so wrong. The procedure was super-quick and pleasant
column5: and it was about $30 less expensive than the ""high-end"" Rittenhouse places.

column1: All this to say
column2: I found my new wax place! =D I'm still a little hesitant about getting a mani/pedi here
column3: since it sounds like it's a little extra work with the type of polish they use. But considering everything they use is food or smells like it
column4: I don't know if I'll be able to hold out for too long.  My favorite part may be is that it's not so busy and rushed as a lot of RH places. I'll definitely be back!";16/07/2012 13:16

E0LKVYvpl9jV9pbM7muUHA;zgwYJ9gpwtOlzxA0WWj4jQ;SBsw-TEUyeJ30VI9KDJVPQ;1;1;1;0;"I read some reviews and I am confused
column2: I think things at Fresh Harvest have changed.   We went here for an early dinner at 4pm on a Monday night while on our vacation.

column1: The station are kind of far apart
column2: here is all description of he food...

column1: 1.) The Chinese food section had four choices
column2: some Sort of beef lo mien
column3: a fried round dough item and two other unappetizing beef choices. All look like they sat for hours.

column1: 2.) There was a seafood section with small pull and peel shrimp.
3.) there was a spot in the middle w lobster tails
column2: shrimp skewers ( but you had to pay for those! We paid $27 for this buffet!)  this station also had generic veggies like mushrooms
column3: peppers and onions that you could get stir fried
column4: there was no meat or noodles to add.. It was strange.

column1: 4.) there was a salad bar. Tiny little buffet dishes ( like if you took enough lettuce for a salad you would take the whole dish  ( remember this was $27)  nothing special just some veggies and one cheese
column2: no tomatoes or feta or meat options.  There was a tomato salad with sliced up string cheese instead of fresh mozzarella. Completely ghetto.  Supermarket salad bars are 5 times bigger with more choices.

column1: 5.) There was an Italian section that consisted of some really oily warm noodles and some pizza ( the pizza was the only thing 'sorta' good in he whole buffet.)
6.) there was a sliced meat section
column2: the turkey was essentially sliced lunch meat.. When they cut it
column3: it was like ten pieces of turkey slices from a deli all in one chunk.

column1: 7.)The dessert bar. I could not find any good food for dinner
column2: and honestly the dessert bar 'looked' good.. So I got a pudding
column3: a cookie and a piece of cheesecake. The cookie was hard and chewy and tasted like plastic
column4: the pudding was not edible ( would not feed it to my dog) and the cheesecake had a 'play doe' consistency
column5: so I played with it..

column1: Honestly I am not crazy picky
column2: I am pretty easy going

column4: and the service was spotty. If you go this casino

B95qz3FmXQ0YP8w52NFC6w;ip8gr8uqBJeS68ZbwARQKw;M_EpyAH1CZZVlhxfYBLOqg;2;2;0;0;The stars are for food only.  I was in a party of 6 + a toddler who arrived on a Friday night with a reservation.  The upstairs was about half filled when we arrived.  Our waitress came to take our order and we asked about the size of the pizza.  She suggested that we order 1 app and 1 pizza per couple.  So my husband and I did just that.  She took the orders but did not write anything down.  While waiting for food
column2: two members did not receive their ordered drinks and had to remind the waitress.  The waters were only refilled once
column3: when we had to request after several of us had already finished the glass.  Then when dinner came a different server delivered the pizzas to us but our ordered pizza was not part of his delivery.  Turns out the waitress put the wrong order in. So we had to wait for another pizza to be made.  By the time it was delivered
column4: not only were we starving but the rest of our group had already finished their dinners and the toddler was ready to leave.  The waitress delivered the bill and stated
column5: since you're a party of 6 the tip is part of the bill.  That felt like insult to injury.  She messed things up and she still gets a pretty big tip for doing minimal work
column6: poorly.  It's one thing to make an accident

column1: Idy8qG3np5vmCSk8ELkTLw;sno3tiBNBTvGMUgu3dF2EQ;Og7J2O_oWXcCiQVRgn4x5Q;1;1;2;0;"Well starting to think I made a bad choice in transmission shop.  They did a good job on transmission about 15 years ago for me.  But took car in to get transmission and clutch fixed.  They over promised on how long it would take.  First is we will have it out on Friday.  Dropped it off on Wednesday morning .  The test drove and called on Wednesday afternoon to to tell me yep the transmission is making a noise and they would have to pull transmission.  Tell me something I didn't already know.   Friday I had to call to get update which was they found the problem and working on getting parts.   Monday I had to call to get another update as they said 1 day in rebuild shop and 1 day to reinstall.  Said still waiting on part but should have it down by Tuesday afternoon.  Had to call tuesday and  still waiting but should be done my wednesday.  Yep you guessed it I had to call again on Wednesdays and thursday to get update.  No suppose to be Friday morning.
I realize that part supply is out of their hands. But at least provide customer service and provide updates
So while apart I said you might as well put new clutch with it out.  Charging over 700 for clutch.  A 300 dollar part that takes 30 minutes to install with transmission out.
But not a lot you can do because you can drive off without the transmission.
Hopefully they we exceed my expectation when I get the car back";14/07/2016 20:24
eVQh-BkzSQlOpmjc-UNmAw;Lx6Y3WLaRcZAQSTEJ-3gRg;ICKBm4PJE7K0LPdEVahbUw;5;0;0;0;I actually had an excellent experience with this location. Friendly staff

column2: some clarity

column1: I have eaten Burt's Burgers twice now and this last time the company impressed me so much I decided to review! We were in for the week due to my wife having a minor surgery. Neither of us felt like cooking so we ordered from the ""Doorstep Delivery"" guys. I had the ""Double Barreled BBQ Burger"" The first time we tried the place (ordering the same way) and I was BLOWN away with the flavor! That burger even after delivery was hot and fresh. It had a homemade feel to it
column2: even more so that the widely successful Burger Chain with 5 in their name.  This burger is topped with wonderfully sautéed onions
column3: mushrooms
column4: cheddar cheese and REAL bacon strips and a layer of good southern BBQ sauce. Holy crap! Did I mention how good that was?! When you take that first bite you just know it's perfectly crafted. No condiments needed
column5: promise!

column1: This time around I ordered a Blue Cheese burger. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. You can really mess up a Blue Cheese burger if you are not careful
column2: melting big hunks of cheese is not ideal. This was perfectly executed. The onions once again were also perfectly cooked. My big pet peeve anywhere is when you get onions that are ""sautéed"" and they really aren't. You know what I am talking about. Half cooked
column3: half raw or big chunks of not so carefully sliced pieces that easily fall off your sandwich (of any kind) these are NOT that. These are the kind of onions that seem like they were slow cooked and carefully sliced and simmered. Match them up with perfectly melted blue cheese which seemed to seep into the nooks and crannies of this wonderfully crafted burger and you have what I like to call a MAN meal. (Sorry I know its sexiest but you'll get over it) This place for me makes the kind of burger that will make you pound your chest and make guttural and inaudible sounds while you eat it. It's THAT good.

column1: Now a few words about the level of service you'll get. After more than an hour and a half had gone by since I ordered
column2: we had to pick up the phone to find out where our food was. The delivery folks said they had picked up the order and were on their way to my house. Sensing something was not spot on
column3: we called Burt's. The food was still there and had been made for us over an hour ago. No driver in sight. The nice lady at Burt's said they would remake the entire order for us AND they would take care of calling the delivery folks to find out what was up. This level of service was really impressive since it wasn't them we were actually dealing with. If that is any indication of the service overall
column4: this place is probably amazing to dine at as well as order for delivery.

column1: Now a small negative
column2: my wife had ordered the California chicken sandwich the first time and it turned her off so much she said she would never order ""that again"" it was really quite dry and not very tasty.

column1: Overall this place with top notch service to burgers you will tell your friends about has my vote. One of these days I might have to venture out and actually eat there. If I do
column2: I'll write up another review to let you know how that was as well. In the meantime
column3: do yourself a favor
column4: get a burger from Burt's
column5: you deserve it!";29/12/2013 01:12

They're using the same thai menu but my favorite dishes seem to have lost their mojo. The once succulent chicken satay is dry and rubbery. Tom Ka with shrimp doesn't taste fresh at all

column4: the broth and meat are flavorful enough but I've received wilting basil and browning sprouts. The sushi tastes better cooked. I haven't trusted their raw fish since my tummy turned a few times. Come to find out
column5: they have 36 health code violations -including failed parasite deconstruction. I really want this place to turn around and succeed.;10/01/2018 00:20

column11: yes

ENMmlsM1hc49DU4tOmVuSg;4RR88XZHdwszLnsxxRBLXg;qee3h7VtquJuvSLJ5RE-HQ;1;0;0;0;This pharmacy is horrible. I have one prescription filled here
column2: well I used to have it filled here. One of my dogs has severe seizure issues and is on 3 medications to control them. Two of the medications I get directly from the vet
column3: one I have to get from a human pharmacy- diazepam. This particular location is so inconsistent on how they fill it
column4: is unbelievable. I can't request a refill online
column5: through the app or the automated phone service. I actually have to call and speak to a person. I understand that this is a controlled substance and an ID needs to be shown to pick it up. Sometimes they ask to see my ID
column6: sometimes they don't. Sometimes I can give the ID number over the phone and they'll fill it and ask to see it when I pick up. Sometimes they don't ask for the ID at any point. Today I tried calling in a refill as my dog had a pretty epic seizure this morning and I was running low on the diazepam (the one medication that actually stops active seizures). I waited on hold for over 10 mins to speak to someone. I was then told that they couldn't refill over the phone as they needed to see my ID. I asked if they could fill it and I'd show my ID when I pick it up- nope
column7: not this time. Doesn't matter that they've done it in the past
column8: I now have to go in
column9: request the refill
column10: show my ID and wait. I just wish they were consistent. It's way too much of a hassle to work with them anymore. I'll give their competitor
column11: CVS a try. I'm done with this place.;14/08/2018 15:49

column1: EJD4SMyQ3vW414wm4aAlPQ;hxDma9MF5LhG2JnCbw2zWw;vuzilOmzlFbrSTiwZfOSOA;3;1;0;0;"I've tried only three things here and two of them weren't good

column1: The homemade brownies with chocolate icing were way too saccharine and nondescript for me
column2: and the jasmine iced tea was way too bitter. I was so excited to find a place in St. Louis that has a lower caffeine version. I'm a big green tea drinker
column3: so if it's not going to be caffeine free (and it never is
column4: unless you get the passion iced tea at Starbuck's or Kaldi's)
column5: then I'd love for it to be green tea. But here
column6: no matter how many different times I've ordered it
column7: it tastes as if it's been steeped 18 hours. It's not light and fragrant
column8: but heavy and acrid.

column1: But my friend's turkey sandwich was very good. The atmosphere is quite nice too. We always sit in the back by the coffee beans (from Kaldi's) on the black leather lounge chairs they've got. It's a fun

column1: On to the pie.  We opted for the double crust

IBs74paaqleTULLtPF763g;SFmxEXBcARDJN8QKkX90mQ;TgOoKnjMyygk0RcS148-UA;1;7;0;0;"We had an appointment for an oil change at 1:00. So we dropped the car off and came back at 5 to find out it hadn't been done yet so we decided we would bring the car back and get it done another day
column2: did not even get off the lot when the belt snapped. We left the car with them to fix it. Came back the next day to retrieve the car and the dashboard was smashed in oil all over the engine and head lights. No manager on duty
column3: the lady at the counter says there is nothing she can do and I would have to get In Touch with the manager. I get his card and I ask the lady if I call will he answer she says yes so I give it a ring and it's the stores number!!!!!!!

column1: We get in the car and leave and the car starts smoking. We think nothing of it it's probably just the oil all over the engine.
WRONG!!!
Car starts to over heat. pop the hood and none of the hoses are connected. So I start thinking why are these not connected these aren't even in the path of the belt.
THEY DISCONNECTED HOSES SO WE WOULD COME BACK TO FIND OUT WHATS WRONG WITH CAR SO WE COULD PAY THEM TO FIX IT!
All in all they
1. Smashed our dashboard in
2. Oil all over headlights and engine
3. Disconnected hoses for no reason
4. Did not reattach said hoses for there scams
This place is a JOKE and will SCAM you.";05/03/2015 04:21
040pCfZ-hWrZKxryWWxq3Q;P3erobq_HEm7LyoralwpMw;EsrLwzu66nah5pnSGwsMyA;4;4;1;3;"I don't generally get too excited about the Doylestown food scene
column2: but Honey is one exception.  Subtly enticing from the outside
column3: the honey inspired atmosphere could easily hang with the center city crowd inside.  Lots of privacy for such a tiny restaurant
column4: many of the tables are booths.

column1: Drink list is large enough
column2: though I didn't feel inspired to order anything.

column1: Here the tapas
column2: as we ordered it
column3: is essentially a deconstructed tasting menu
column4: and the price is in line with that.  It's nice in that you have more control
column5: but it comes at the cost of pacing and size.  I always find it a little intimidating to figure out the right amount to order
column6: and we overshot it a little bit this time.

column1: Bowl of spiced popcorn was a nice starter from the kitchen.
Following was the Chinese 5 spice sweet potato fries
column2: which comes with Red Miso Maple and Sweet Chile Sauces.  Fairly standard fries
column3: but the Miso sauce is excellent.

column1: Hot on its tail was the ""Fire & Ice""
column2: which is chilled king crab with oranges
column3: daikon
column4: white miso-chile mayonnaise
column5: and spicy carrot sorbet.  A little heavy with the mayo
column6: but the flavor was good.  Carrot sorbet works really well.

column1: At this point all of the previously mentioned items were on our table in some partially eaten state.  It makes you feel kind of rushed and cluttered when it's only two people.  Just relax and let us savor it.
After clearing out our backlog
column2: the lamb
column3: cremini mushroom
column4: and escargot skewers wrapped in bacon appeared.  It comes with a roasted garlic aioli dipping sauce that is quite good.  Nothing overly complicated
column5: it's hard to go wrong grilling lamb.

column1: Pan seared arctic char with shredded brussels sprouts
column2: smoked pork belly
column3: and

column1: truffled artichoke emulsion was pretty good.  Pork belly interior was very soft with good flavor to match with the crispy char.  Not bad
column2: but the best was for last.

column1: Beef tenderloin with butternut squash and barley risotto
column2: veal sausage
column3: and barley wine reduction.  Wonderful.  Rich and layered flavor
column4: it has an almost smokey undertone.  One of the better risottos I've had
column5: with the veal sausage in there more to add flavor than to be a primary ingredient.   Tenderloin is perfectly cooked
column6: a five star dish for sure.

column1: Intermezzo of pineapple sorbet and candied ginger.  Good
column2: but the ginger is so strong and sticky that I started eating around it.

column1: Desserts were pretty exceptional.  Lemon cheese cake with minted pineapple relish
column2: toasted pine nuts
column3: and spiced cranberry coulis.  Butternut squash cake with maple syrup
column4: white miso caramel
column5: toasted sesame
column6: and persimmon ice cream.  Great ending to an excellent meal.

column1: A few of the sauces were a little heavy
column2: but the creativity and flavors make Honey a must try.  One of the best restaurants north of the city.";03/01/2012 15:32

XZtFHNwv83tr5_Elw76q2w;CADPwVGAcSeIDbYjwAkurA;jySVipAqMqczPzOPLMnJpw;2;1;5;1;"My husband and kid dragged me to this cute little shop during a recent visit to Philly. I was initially excited to try the blended coffee ""freezes"" displayed in the online menu. Sadly

column1: OK. So since I was in the mood for coffee

dcDOrKYkCwUnPCymdA8HHw;9O0EgQUzityaKncpgQ5-YA;Y5s8Ei1O6pkUw5sadG6iQg;2;0;0;0;"Date night is Tuesday's and Geostorm was the entertainment of choice for the night.
Atmosphere:

Lobby is huge there is one box office window or 3 ticket machines we opted for the machine. It was easy and fast we had no problems choosing our tickets and seats. The lobby was also very clean same with the theater.
Staff/food:

Both need improvements which is sad we were literally the only people in the lobby yet I received cold corndog bites and the S/O got cold popcorn. We asked for a replacement for the popcorn he brought us back the same container I swear. Fine we took it and proceeded on with our journey. There is only one butter dispenser so be prepared to wait if you go on a busy night. The ticket checker was kind and prompt although again we are the only people there.
Movie:
By the time the movie started there was about 3 couple and 2 groups of other people it was nice. The volume a bit loud but the Imax aspect was great.
Overall:

I'd go back on a week night where I know no one was there because it would be a hassle to go on a weekend. There are no breaks in the seating so if you get a middle seat good luck. If they improved food quality and lack of staff enthusiasm I would definitely give more stars.
PS: Geostorm is awesome go see it";25/10/2017 13:21

QGBRWnu-yHDRTA2wSPTUnw;otBEESzGIg-NgDWgQm1q9g;BzLuIEFKQNuypD2qHfkEEQ;3;2;0;0;"This is an average tanning salon

column5: and some are used for upgrades. I've asked twice to have it explained
column6: since I can't figure out what I can use for what
column7: and I have both on my account. They seem annoyed at having to explain
column8: seemingly because they don't know either. After asking explicit questions I just gave up both times.

column3: until I asked about it later to see for what I could use it. And I was told ""That had to be used within that month.""

column1: Well
column2: OK.

column1: And then there was some kind of bonus buck credit that was included with my all-beds-inclusive package that I tried to use toward a purchase
column2: and they told me it had to be used only for bed upgrades.  Um
column3: my package included all beds.

column1: wAapwxcKXR9c5tOAHjloCA;Aqj9RedgPk8F8qwuxztqkg;9GucbV4osPF2FOIEdURPqQ;4;1;0;0;"We've been ""taking out"" from Ciconte's for the past 20 years or so.  Last weekend we decided to ""eat in"" at their (sort of) new location.
We went early
column2: so we expected there would be young children (and there were).  We were seated immediately and our server came over quickly.  We told her about a coupon we had and she happily accepted it.  (Free appetizer with two entrees and the appetizer - chicken meatballs in white bean sauce - was DELICIOUS). The service was fabulous for the entire meal.  If our server wasn't walking by
column3: someone else was -- checking up on things
column4: clearing dishes
column5: etc.

column1: The food
column2: as we knew
column3: was good and tasty and the sauce much better than some other Italian eat-in restaurants in the area.  Again
column4: the food was served hot and fresh and on nice dishes with appealing presentation.

column1: My husband was quite pleased with the experience and that really says something.
Keep in mind
column2: this was our only dining-in experience so far.  Hopefully if we choose to go a little later next time
column3: we are just as pleased.  Also since we had a road race the next day
column4: we had not done BYOB.  Next time we will.

column1: I found the service eating in is superior to taking out. In the past we've waited longer than anticipated and been given wrong items in our order on take out.  The eating in experience couldn't have been any different.";08/05/2014 15:34

MHhV2ndqtusWvz9YZRiizg;35cOtsnGyXJFkKCrmdW7Xg;ChlcxTEoWBQJXJ2Xb2vm5g;4;0;0;0;"I went here for an early lunch last Sunday while down in New Orleans for a bachelor party. Me and my buddy sat at the small bar so we could watch the Saints game on the only TV in the place. We were dressed in plain old shorts and T-shirts and my friend had sandals on. They didn't care and said we were dressed perfectly fine. It was nice and cool inside too.
I had a twist on a Tom Collins which they call a Saint Collins
column2: it was damn good too. The bartender was very friendly and shared a good bit of detail about the area to us.

column1: For an appetizer we shared the wood oven roasted pocket bread which reminded me of naan
column2: very good and you could taste every ingredient to it. I had a cup of the gumbo of the day which happened to be cochon au lait and andouille
column3: it was so good
column4: especially the cochon.

column1: My friend ordered a personal pizza for lunch
column2: he's a picky eater and did not like the sound of the toppings for the veggie pizza but still wanted something. The chef came out the bar and told him what was available
column3: he was very friendly. He wound up with a simple pie with just mozzarella with garlic and roma tomatoes I believe
column4: so boring but it's what he wanted. He said it was good and since he's a pizza connoisseur that's high praise.

column1: I had the shrimp and grits which were among the best I've ever had (nothing beats Charleston for them) my sole complaint was they were too thin and could not easily be eaten with a fork. But there were plenty of tasty fresh shrimp and great bacon.

Since we were starving we ordered creme brulee trio and I had a Costa Rican coffee latte. Every single creme brulee was very very good but the vanilla bean was the best creme brulee I've ever had. The coffee was good too.";09/09/2014 19:35

column3: when I called the restaurant they refused to do anything unless I could bring in my receipt.  I found this solution to ridiculous as I was more than happy to go through my bank and produce a receipt copy.  Thus
column4: BEWARE DO NOT LEAVE A TIP LINE BLANK EVEN IF YOU PURCHASE A $4.00 BOTTLE OF SAUCE BECAUSE THIEVES WORK HERE AND WILL STEAL FROM YOU.   The part that made me most mad was I use to work in the Service Industry and I am a regular 20% tipper on to go orders.  Thus

EL8-rroMru6TXuL524EQCA;iacbqyqqGUnykUmCevEyMg;pKUSoVcaGmhfF7ttpegctw;1;1;0;0;"Was in town for a comedy show
column2: which was the best part of our trip! We are Hampton/Hilton rewards members and have stayed any many Hampton inns and have always been extremely happy with every part of our stay.

column1: Unfortunately our stay here last night was very disappointing! Our room was very small for a king room
column2: compared to all the other Hamptons we have stayed at. There wasn't a vent fan in the bathroom! The room it self felt very dated and tired. Almost like a dressed up (cosmetic only) Super 8! Not that Super 8 is bad but I have a certain level of expectations when staying at a Hampton Inn and this one didn't even come close to achieving them.

column1: So this is by far the biggest issue of our stay was the bed!!!! I have always really enjoyed the beds at any Hampton Inn
column2: always very very comfortable and cozy. Last night I did not get any sound sleep the bed was very very worn!!! Our sheet/bed protector keep falling off because it was so worn out! Of course my husband and I both tossed and turned because the bed was so uncomfortable
column3: so the sheet would keep falling off! I didn't want to sleep directly on the bed itself which seemed to be very old! Both my shoulders hurt very bad from attempting to lay in my side for sleep. It is so disappointing to have such a bad experience at this Hampton because we specifically search for a Hampton Inn when traveling because we know the great quality we will be receiving. This one disappointed. Also my husband brought me coffee (which we have always LOVED!) but it was not good! Seemed watered down or something
column4: just missed the mark.

column1: If you are looking for the Hampton Inn experience as far as comfy beds
column2: great coffee and newer environment this one is not the one for you.";19/02/2017 15:31

column1: I did like the sandwich
column2: but it wasn't what I thought it would be. It had good flavor
column3: and I loved the onions. I ordered it ""wizz
column4: wit"" and I was surprised how FAST they get things done. I also got the cheese fries and a drink. All in all it was around $15 (!) and I ate it right there on the benches. Yes
column5: it was cold with the wind blowing.

column1: The best way I can describe it is to draw a parallel observation with another LA landmark that people rave and fawn over. King Taco. Sure
column2: they make good food. Sure they serve tons of customers every night and are rather well known. Sure they make GREAT late night stops. However
column3: late night munchies are not really the best way to judge foodstuffs. Perhaps being soaked in booze from late night carousing adds to the overall experience. There is NOTHING wrong with that. Just in the same way I like King Taco
column4: I liked Geno's.

column1: I however
column2: have had better cheesesteaks. So far
column3: the best cheesesteak I have had in the US was at Moochie's in Salt Lake City. It is not blasphemy
column4: and it in no way takes Geno's down for what it is. A pioneer in the field of cheeseteaks with a history only perhaps one other restaurant can rival. That rivalry I am sure also adds to the legend.

column2: I paid to upgrade to a suite on the third floor. Much cleaner and quieter. I can't hear my neighbors coughing and chatting at 1am anymore. It's pretty worn down and it needs an overhaul
column3: so don't expect much and you'll be fine. No sign of bed bugs
column4: just generally ""been around for awhile"". That all said

column1: 9hM9cQwHCprRQ2YYwbZU4Q;cU-Z8K3TNM019C-62GtwIw;Trbe4JX-oLHrrVVPcv0wog;4;11;2;3;"I usually only go to a fancy pants restaurant like Broussard's for a special occasion. But a friend told me about the $19.20 three course meal in honor of the 95th anniversary of the restaurant
column2: so we decided to check it out.

column1: The restaurant itself is as gorgeous as ever
column2: a gem of a fine dining establishment. There was a bit of a crowd
column3: so it wasn't empty which is  a good thing. I can't stand sitting in an empty restaurant. The service was good to above average.

column1: The $19.20 menu provides a few choices for each course. We both ordered the crab and shrimp cake for an appetizer. It was outstanding
column2: one of the better appetizers I have had in a long time. I ordered the short ribs which were good but not great. The sauce was nice and the presentation was nice with a big Portobello on top which was tasty. But the short ribs were cut in pieces and were found under a mound of mashed potatoes. Nothing at all bad about the dish
column3: it just didn't wow. My lovely better half ordered the fish ( drum I think) with tropical fruit salsa and coconut rice
column4: a much better choice. It was very well prepared
column5: especially the execution of the fish which was perfectly moist
column6: cooked just right. For dessert
column7: I ordered chocolate ice cream which consisted of a very tiny
column8: kid's portion (not much more than a tablespoon )of very good ice cream accompanied by about a teaspoon of whipped cream. The better half again ordered better and got the peanut butter mousse which was a much larger portion and excellent
column9: outstanding in fact.

column1: So if you're looking for a nice evening at a grand restaurant but don't want to break the bank
column2: come to Broussard's for good meal and overall dining experience during the $19.20 special. And
column3: frankly
column4: you should consider coming after the special is over. The food is that good.";28/07/2015 16:49

column1: e6v0t67E3O9rman_BKlLTg;L8LoKsZ9zncFoqqf5RiYgA;svqHsPiOz2aFvgQxBciLXg;4;4;2;4;"I should probably wait to review Rum Bar until I've spent more than just half an hour there

Mn71OcRISkwDnpXyvaS7oA;SxK6LjZsrX2S4ggYS6cW_A;gTC8IQ_i8zXytWSly3Ttvg;5;0;0;0;"We went to Butcher after having had several memorable dinners at Link's Herbsaint Restaurant.
Before talking about the Butcher
column2: I have to talk about the museum district in New Orleans.  We live in Chicago
column3: have lived in San Francisco and Switzerland
column4: and have traveled to a lot of places in Europe and the Southern Hemisphere.  We have been to New Orleans many times as my parents lived on the Gulf Coast pre-Katrina.  We only discovered the Museum District on our visit this past May.  What a treat!  The Modern Art Museum is an architectural treasure
column5: the World War II museum is profound
column6: the Southern Art Museum makes a dramatic entry and the venerable Civil War Museum is a true classic.

column1: After all that Museum stuff you get hungry.  Really hungry!  So walk about 3 blocks down to Link's Butcher and have a truly memorable lunch.  We had the roasted turkey with arugula
column2: tomato
column3: fontina and basil pesto aioli on 7 grain bread.  Wow.  Several of the regular patrons suggested the Buckboard bacon melt with collards on white
column4: but neither my wife nor I really warm up to collards so we took a pass.  Anyway
column5: add a great beer or in my wife's case a root beer
column6: and you have a very special lunch in the warehouse district of New Orleans.";28/05/2012 20:26

column1: ao4m_YhSuALnA8xrLycwYw;i6L9I8xDF-di3kgvDewnjg;xxx_0Ol7lbK0hVzv7x0-Yg;4;3;1;0;"We've been back to Lucky Bamboo a few times in recent months
column2: and I have to say that we've been more and more impressed with the food each visit.  This is the best
column3: most authentic Chinese food we've found in Nashville so far
column4: whether you order off the menu or try the dim sum weekend brunch.

column1: I particularly like the shrimp with mixed vegetables
column2: which is served in a flavorful white sauce made with garlic and sesame oil.  The shrimp is cooked well and the plate is generously portioned.  My husband is partial to the seafood pan fried noodles
column3: which is essentially the dish I described above with assorted seafood and served over a huge pile of lightly fried noodles.  We also very much enjoy their egg drop soup - very tasty without being overly salty
column4: and always served piping hot.

column1: We experienced the dim sum for the first time this morning
column2: and were pleasantly surprised.  After reading many a negative review here on Yelp
column3: we went in expecting the worst.  Instead
column4: we received a nice assortment of hot
column5: fresh dumplings and beef short ribs.  We also could have had some of the noodle dishes
column6: fried appetizers
column7: and desserts that were floating around
column8: though we chose not to.  Our favorite dumpling was the shrimp and pork shumai
column9: served with a sweet and spicy dipping sauce.  I'm not one to eat pork very often
column10: but did very much enjoy this dish and would order it again (my husband actually ordered himself 2 plates of the shumai and didn't regret it for a minute)!

column1: I will say that while the food has improved dramatically
column2: the service is still lacking and in need of some serious work.  We had to wait 15 minutes for our water glasses to be refilled
column3: the carts did not come around regularly
column4: and the dish we ordered off the menu was cold by the time it reached our table (and served without rice
column5: though the rice was supposed to come with).  I believe this is due to the large space of the restaurant and its many tables
column6: and also the expansive menu and many ordering options.  The servers are very nice and knowledgable
column7: and Jack
column8: the manager
column9: is always extremely kind whenever we're there - but the entire staff needs to be trained to work a bit more efficiently.

column1: Overall
column2: come try the food at Lucky Bamboo.  It IS good food and a place Nashville needs to satisfy us picky former New Yorkers who like our Chinese food.";26/05/2014 03:05

column1: VheNg0QEIAAcfHdBn8Kqcw;qq0seMYCWk4oT5Ho31fqWw;KXecZki-_3N7afs6HKWM3A;4;1;0;0;"I went this weekend for my first time and was pleasantly surprised.  The food had a lot of flavor and was very pleased with the special I ordered.  Yes

column1: Menu is not huge so I would recommend looking online or doing some research before you go if you tend to be a more ""picky"" eater!  I will definitely go back...wish this was closer down towards south Tampa but do see myself venturing up here again for round 2!";07/03/2016 21:11

kPDM2gkrrB_g-dI1Eya4Qw;1Nb49viIcb05O7S0KUN4EA;I_z-mh6SDIF3c5rnkLbVMA;4;1;0;0;"I had hesitation of having to deal with another car rental company after my bad experience with another big name car rental company.  But had no choice since I needed a car for the week while my car was being repaired.

I'm very happy to say that the experience with Enterprise was excellent from beginning to end.  Unlike the other company they did a very thorough check outside and inside before I drove off.  The car provided was clean and equal to what I was driving and recent (2015 I believe)
column2: meanwhile
column3: at the other place I got a crappy old and falling apart vehicle.

column1: Everyone I dealt with were professional and very nice.  You only get to make a first impression once and happy to say they didn't disappoint.  I will definitely use them again if I need to rent a vehicle again.
Tip:  Though they offer insurance where it also covers the deductible for $16.99/day
column2: best to just check to see if your own auto insurance company covers you fully and not get it.

column1: Also make a note of how much gas is in the tank.  Mine didn't have a full tank
column2: so they marked on their sheet where the gauge showed

RDsdbdfW6Ij2C1GjhcJI-Q;3-I7OhqGOOzcjPsP8ChJ2A;WbI0hy9A41X0rYk3oKqnDw;4;4;1;1;"Chinese Buffets have become hard to come by in my homeland of Pinellas County so when I found myself after spending a day at the BARF Ren Faire in Tampa
column2: on Fowler Avenue looking for vittles
column3: I whipped the ole truck into this China Buffet.

column1: At first the clientele outside seemed a bit dubious to be honest (many people just hanging outside by the front door) but once inside the atmosphere was pleasant and it became instantaneously obvious that there would be a huge selection.
On this particular Sunday evening the price for the Buffet was $10.95 ($19.95 if one opted to eat crab legs).  We each chose the $10.95 option and when the meal was done
column2: we really did not miss having the crab.

column1: Our first round was dedicated to the raw seafood offerings and sushi.  Steamed shrimp
column2: raw oysters and mussels and various fresh sushi rolls were piled onto our plates (being hungry Ren Faire goers in costume and all).  We each agreed that the shrimp were steamed just right and of a decent size and the oysters were very good (one could get their moneys worth just on a couple of plates of raw oysters
column3: they are that fresh and good).  The sushi was a delight across the board but the mussels were a bit flat and tasteless.

column1: Second round included standard asian fare including ribs
column2: several chicken and seafood dishes and the addition of a beautiful standing carve it yourself pork roast that was delicious.  My companion went for dim sum and she enjoyed every bite.

column1: Neither of us opted for the Mongolian grill option but it did look good
column2: I will definitely give it a go next time.

column1: The service was plentiful and polite as well as being authentic asian.  The asian tea a bit weak for my taste and the dessert table was just a mirage in the distance because our bellies were so full of the good stuff!  (It did look enticing however
column2: from a distance...I spies some huge cookies that I must try next time....

column1: All in all this is a good stop
column2: some dishes better than others as in all Asian Buffets but the good outweighed the not quite up to snuff by a wide margin and there were no really scary or bad dishes at all in our tastings.

column1: The decor' upon closer inspection could use a bit of maintenance but when you are serving the masses a lot of food at $10 a pop
column2: it is not hard to imagine that the margins can be slim.  An honest hard working and well prepared buffet
column3: really what else can you expect?";01/04/2015 14:32

column1: gR9EA0mtRh5rZU2CsYgeOA;2pzrdZiY66lRAlqgnPFtRA;6gCQvovXf3wmrfwuTyeLlQ;2;2;1;1;"The Taco Bus

column4: everyone who is drunk finds their way here and then has ""the best mexican food ever"" even though they can't see straight.  I was here sober
column5: even with $1 drafts
column6: and while it wasn't awful

column1: bTfvG0NEd1EqEWohx1n6_w;Qx-5FRNpL14H2TtIKmB1kA;Nm-4YHhit9Z0x8yMo5oS1w;4;1;1;1;"Well I certainly liked Sullivan's better than St. Elmo from the previous evening.  Evening two of my quick trip to Indy
column2: and I took someones suggestion to venture out by Keystone at the Crossing .  The dining room is pleasant and nicely laid out.  Roomy and not stuffy...casual.

column1: I ordered the Sunday dinner special for $29--a tremendous amount of food for a pittance of what it all would cost a la carte.
I had a rather regrettable calamari--breaded and over-fried--as an additional appetizer.  Couldn't tell if they were calamari rings or bits left over from the deep fryer.  huff
Caesar salad was fine.  The Fillet Mignon was AGAIN undercooked (see my St. Elmo review for further reference)
column2: and I had to send it back.  Still wasn't totally done
column3: but I simply ate around the pink part.  Folks
column4: it is NOT difficult to cook an 8 oz. fillet.  They're small
column5: and I had it butterflied.  Shouldn't have been difficult.  Oh well...Indy must not be a ""well-done"" steak kind of city.  My side was horseradish mashed potatoes
column6: which
column7: I kid you not
column8: is my second time in two dinners in a row that I've had horseradish in something.  Generous family-sized portion and not too spicy.  Banana bread pudding was ok...I only ordered it because it was one of the few things on the sampler that had ice cream
column9: and I like bananas.

column1: All in all
column2: not a bad place.  I liked my waiter at Sullivan's who
column3: unlike my waiter St. Elmo
column4: wasn't stuffy or had an irritatingly thick accent.  So with all that in mind
column5: plus the fact that I could get a nicely done steak meal in Indy for less than $30
column6: I'm giving it 4 stars.";10/12/2007 05:38
